主分类(中文)	HPO编号	名称(英文)	名称(中文)	定义(英文)	定义(中文)
生长异常	HP:0000002	Abnormality of body height	身高异常	Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	身高偏离该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000003	Multicystic kidney dysplasia	多囊性肾发育不全	Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvocaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.	多囊性肾发育不全的特点是各种大小不一的肾囊肿，缺乏正常肾盂肾盏系统。这种状态伴发输尿管或肾盂输尿管闭锁，受累肾脏无功能。
遗传模式	HP:0000005	Mode of inheritance	遗传模式	The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.	
遗传模式	HP:0000006	Autosomal dominant inheritance	常染色体显性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.	
遗传模式	HP:0000007	Autosomal recessive inheritance	常染色体隐形遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in homozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, autosomal recessive disorders manifest in homozygotes (with two copies of the mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).	
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000008	Abnormality of female internal genitalia	女性内生殖器异常	An abnormality of the `female internal genitalia` (FMA:45654).	女性内生殖器的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000009	Functional abnormality of the bladder	膀胱机能异常	`Dysfunction` (PATO:0001641) of the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900).	膀胱的功能异常。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000010	Recurrent urinary tract infections	复发性尿路感染	Repeated infections of the urinary tract.	尿路反复感染。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000011	Neurogenic bladder	神经性膀胱功能障碍	An inability to completely empty the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) during the process of `urination` (GO:0060073) owing to a neurological condition.	由于神经系统疾患导致排尿过程中无法完全排空膀胱。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000012	Urinary urgency	尿急	Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.	强烈的、突然要小便而出现的急迫性尿失禁。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000013	Hypoplasia of the uterus	子宫发育不良	Underdevelopment of the `uterus` (FMA:17558).	子宫发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000014	Abnormality of the bladder	膀胱异常	An abnormality of the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900).	发生在膀胱的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000015	Bladder diverticulum	膀胱憩室	`Diverticulum` (MPATH:68) (sac or pouch) in the `wall of the urinary bladder` (FMA:15902).	膀胱壁上存在憩室。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000016	Urinary retention	尿潴留	Inability to completely empty the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) during the process of `urination` (GO:0060073).	排尿过程中无法完全排空膀胱。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000017	Nocturia	夜尿症	Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.	夜间尿产量异常增多导致不寻常的频繁排尿。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000019	Urinary hesitancy	排尿困难	Difficulty in beginning the process of `urination` (GO:0060073).	排尿过程开始时困难。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000020	Urinary incontinence	尿失禁	Loss of the ability to control the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) leading to involuntary `urination` (GO:0060073).	控制膀胱能力丧失，导致非自主排尿。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000021	Megacystis	巨膀胱症	Dilatation of the bladder postnatally.	出生后膀胱扩张。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000022	Abnormality of male internal genitalia	男性内生殖器异常	An abnormality of the `male internal genitalia` (FMA:45655).	男性内生殖器的异常。
结缔组织的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0000023	Inguinal hernia	腹股沟疝	Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.	经由腹股沟的腹腔内容物的突起。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000024	Prostatitis	前列腺炎	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `prostate` (FMA:9600).	前列腺出现炎症。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000025	Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia	男性内生殖器功能异常		
内分泌系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000026	Male hypogonadism	男性性腺功能低下	`Decreased functionality` (PATO:0001624) of the male gonad, i.e., of the `testis` (FMA:7210).	男性性腺即睾丸功能性减退。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000027	Azoospermia	无精症	Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen.	精液中检测不到精子。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000028	Cryptorchidism	隐睾	Absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the testis.	阴囊内一侧或双侧睾丸缺如，是由于睾丸未通过腹股沟管下降到阴囊。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000029	Testicular atrophy	睾丸萎缩	Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.	睾丸萎缩表现为体积减小和潜在的生育能力丧失。
肿瘤;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000030	Testicular gonadoblastoma	睾丸性腺母细胞瘤	The presence of a `gonadoblastoma` (MPATH:315) of the `testis` (FMA:7210).	睾丸形成性腺母细胞瘤。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000031	Epididymitis	附睾炎	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `epididymis` (FMA:18255).	附睾发生的炎症 。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000032	Abnormality of male external genitalia	男性外生殖器异常	An abnormality of `male external genitalia` (FMA:45642).	男性外生殖器的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000033	Ambiguous genitalia, male	外阴性别不明，男性	`Ambiguous genitalia` (HP:0000062) in an individual with XY genetic gender.	`遗传学性别为XY个体的外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000034	Hydrocele testis	睾丸鞘膜积液	Accumulation of clear fluid in the  between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.	睾丸鞘膜层之间的透明液体积蓄。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000035	Abnormality of the testis	睾丸异常	An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).	睾丸（男性性腺）的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000036	Abnormality of the penis	阴茎异常		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000037	Male pseudohermaphroditism	男性假两性畸形	Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.	两性畸形是指性腺的形态和外生殖器不吻合。男性假两性畸形的染色体核型为男性（XY），但外生殖器呈不完全男性化、模棱两可或完全女性化。如果有性腺存在，一般是睾丸。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000039	Epispadias	尿道上裂	Displacement of the urethral opening on the dorsal (superior) surface of the penis.	尿道口开口异常，开在阴茎背侧（上面）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000040	Enlarged penis	阴茎增大		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000041	Chordee	阴茎下曲	A condition in which the head of the penis curves downward.	阴茎向下弯曲。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000042	Absent external genitalia	外生殖器缺如	Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.	男性或女性无外生殖器。
内分泌系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000044	Hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism	低促性腺素性功能减退症	Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).	低促性腺素性功能减退症的特征是性腺（男性的睾丸，女性的卵巢）功能降低，是由于缺乏性腺刺激垂体激素，如卵泡刺激素（FSH）和促黄体生成激素（LH）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000045	Abnormality of the scrotum	阴囊异常		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000046	Scrotal hypoplasia	阴囊发育不良		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000047	Hypospadias	尿道下裂	Displacement of the urethral opening on the ventral (inferior) surface of the penis.	尿道口开口位于阴茎腹侧面。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000048	Bifid scrotum	阴囊裂	Separation of the two halves of the scrotum, whereby commonly the 2 halves of the scrotum meet above the penis.	阴囊左右两部分分离，通常在阴茎根上部汇合。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000049	Shawl scrotum	披肩状阴囊	A condition in which the upper scrotal skin rises over the base of the penis.	阴囊上部皮肤移至阴茎背面根部。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000050	Hypoplastic male external genitalia	男性外生殖器发育不良	Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).	男性外生殖器（包括阴茎、阴囊和尿道）全部或部分发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000051	Perineal hypospadias	会阴型尿道下裂	Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.	尿道口的位置会阴部的尿道下裂。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000052	Urethral atresia, male	男性尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.	一种先天性异常，男性的尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000053	Macroorchidism	巨大睾丸	The presence of abnormally large testes.	异常的大睾丸。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000054	Micropenis	小阴茎	Abnormally small `penis` (FMA:9707). At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.	异常小的阴茎。出生时，正常阴茎大约长3厘米（从耻骨结节到阴茎顶端的拉直了的长度），小于2.0-2.5厘米为小阴茎。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000055	Abnormality of female external genitalia	女性外生殖器异常	An abnormality of the `female external genitalia` (FMA:45649).	女性外生殖器的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000056	Abnormality of the clitoris	阴蒂异常	An abnormality of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂的异常。
	HP:0000057	Clitoromegaly	阴蒂肥大	`Increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂体积增大。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000058	Abnormality of the labia	阴唇异常	An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.	阴唇的异常，阴蒂是女阴外部可见部分。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000059	Hypoplastic labia majora	大阴唇发育不良	Undergrowth of the outer labia.	大阴唇发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000060	Clitoral hypoplasia	阴蒂发育不良	Developmental hypoplasia of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂的发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000061	Ambiguous genitalia, female	外阴性别不明，女性	`Ambiguous genitalia` (HP:0000062) in an individual with XX genetic gender.	遗传学性别为XX个体的外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000062	Ambiguous genitalia	外阴性别不明	A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.	根据生殖器外型无法确定是属于哪一种性别。外阴性别不明可以使用Prader计分来进行评估:Prader 0:正常女性外生殖器；Prader 1:女性外阴但阴蒂增大；Prader 2:阴蒂较大，阴唇部分融合，形成漏斗状阴道口；Prader 3:阴茎增大，阴唇完全融合形成尿生殖窦，有单一的尿道开口。Prader 4:阴囊完全融合，泌尿生殖口在阴茎的根部或阴茎上，类似尿道下裂；Prader 5:正常男性外生殖器。Prader 1-4 诊断为外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000063	Fused labia minora	小阴唇融合	Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.	由于阴道阻塞使阴唇粘连而造成的小阴唇融合。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000064	Hypoplastic labia minora	小阴唇发育不良		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000065	Labial hypertrophy	阴唇肥厚		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000066	Labial hypoplasia	阴唇发育不良		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000067	Urethral atresia, female	女性尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.	一种先天性异常，女性的尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000068	Urethral atresia	尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.	一种先天性异常，尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000069	Abnormality of the ureter	输尿管异常	An abnormality of the `ureter` (FMA:9704).	输尿管的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000070	Ureterocele	输尿管囊肿	A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.	输尿管远端段先天性囊状扩张。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000071	Ureteral stenosis	输尿管狭窄	The presence of a stenotic, i.e., `constricted` (PATO:0001847) `ureter` (FMA:9704).	输尿管狭窄，即输尿管缢缩。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000072	Hydroureter	输尿管积水	The distention of the `ureter` (FMA:9704) with urine.	输尿管内潴留过量尿液导致其扩张。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000073	Ureteral duplication	输尿管重复	A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.	一种发育异常，一侧肾脏通过两根输尿管（而不是一根）连接到膀胱。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000074	Ureteropelvic junction obstruction	肾盂输尿管连接部梗阻	Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.	从肾盂到近端输尿管尿流受到阻塞。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000075	Renal duplication	肾重复	A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the `kidney` (FMA:7203) is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.	先天性泌尿道异常，其中肾发生并分别经由两个独立的肾盂和输尿管导出。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000076	Vesicoureteral reflux	膀胱输尿管返流	Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.	尿液从膀胱进入输尿管或向肾的异常（反向）流动，与输尿管膀胱处的瓣膜结构异常相关，或存在其他原因。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000077	Abnormality of the kidney	肾脏异常	An abnormality of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾脏的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000078	Abnormality of the genital system	生殖系统异常	An abnormality of the `genital system` (FMA:7160).	生殖系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000079	Abnormality of the urinary system	泌尿系统异常	An abnormality of the `urinary system` (FMA:7159).	泌尿系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000080	Abnormality of genital physiology	生殖生理异常	An `abnormal` (PATO:0000460) `functionality` (PATO:0001509) of the `genital system` (FMA:7160).	生殖系统发生的功能异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000081	Duplicated collecting system	双套集合管系统	A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney.	肾集合管系统的重复。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000083	Renal insufficiency	肾功能不全	A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.	肾功能的降低，肾功能包括尿液的浓缩、廓清废物、维持电解质平衡、保持血压体内平衡和钙代谢。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000085	Horseshoe kidney	马蹄肾	A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.	由肾实质或纤维组织跨越中线峡部连接左右肾，呈现马蹄状。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000086	Ectopic kidney	异位肾	A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.	由于发育异常导致肾脏不在正常解剖位置。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000089	Renal hypoplasia	肾发育低下	`Hypoplasia` (MPATH:133) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000090	Nephronophthisis	肾消耗病	Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.	肾皮髓质交界处囊肿形成伴肾小管间质纤维化。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000091	Abnormality of the renal tubule	肾小管异常	An abnormality of the `renal tubules` (FMA:15627).	肾小管的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000092	Tubular atrophy	肾小管萎缩	The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.	肾小管形成厚冗余基底膜，或与周围未萎缩小管相比直径减小超过一半。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000093	Proteinuria	蛋白尿	Increased levels of protein in the urine.	尿液中蛋白质水平增加。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000095	Abnormality of the glomerulus	肾小球异常	A structural anomaly of the `glomerulus` (FMA:15624).	肾小球的结构异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000096	Glomerulosclerosis	肾小球硬化	Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.	肾小球内疤痕组织占位。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000097	Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis	局灶性节段性肾小球硬化	Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.	在部分（但不是全部）肾小球存在节段性瘢痕组织增加。
生长异常	HP:0000098	Tall stature	高挑身材	A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	身高高于该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000099	Glomerulonephritis	肾小球肾炎	Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.	肾小球的炎症。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000100	Nephrotic syndrome	肾病综合征	Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.	肾病综合症包含一系列的异常，由肾小球功能障碍所致肾小球毛细血管壁通透性增加而产生明显的蛋白尿。肾病综合征是指严重的肾性蛋白质损失，致蛋白尿、低蛋白血症水肿和高血脂症等一系列临床表现。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000103	Polyuria	多尿	An `increased rate` (PATO:0000912) of urine production.	尿液生成率增加。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000104	Renal agenesis	肾发育不全	`Agenesis` (MPATH:57), that is, failure of the `kidney` (FMA:7203) to develop during embryogenesis and development.	肾发育不全是指在胚胎形成和发育过程中没有肾脏发育。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000105	Enlarged kidneys	肾增大	An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.	肾脏的大小异常增加。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000107	Renal cyst	肾囊肿	A fluid filled sac in the kidney.	肾脏中充满液体的囊。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000108	Renal corticomedullary cysts	肾皮髓质囊肿	The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.	皮质和髓质边界的多发性囊肿。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000110	Renal dysplasia	肾发育不良	The presence of `developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾发育不良。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000111	Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia	肾小球旁细胞肥大/增生	Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.	肾小球旁细胞数量增加和体积增大。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000112	Nephropathy	肾病	A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.	非特异性术语??，指肾脏的疾病或损伤。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000113	Polycystic kidney dysplasia	多囊性肾发育不良	The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.	双侧肾脏多发囊肿。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000114	Proximal tubulopathy	近端肾小管病	Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.	近端肾小管功能障碍，近端肾小管是从肾小囊到细尿管袢（汉勒氏袢）的肾单位的部分管道系统。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000117	Renal phosphate wasting	肾源性磷酸盐流失	High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.	尿液中高磷酸盐，发生低磷血症。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000119	Abnormality of the genitourinary system	泌尿生殖系统异常	The presence of any abnormality of the `genitourinary system` (FMA:280610).	泌尿生殖系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000121	Nephrocalcinosis	肾钙化质沉积症	Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.	肾钙质沉着症指是钙盐在肾实质的沉积。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000122	Unilateral renal agenesis	单侧肾未发育	A `unilateral` (PATO:0000634) form of `agenesis` (MPATH:57) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾单侧不发育。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000123	Nephritis	肾炎	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) affecting the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾脏出现炎症反应。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000124	Renal tubular dysfunction	肾小管功能障碍		
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000125	Pelvic kidney	盆腔肾	A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.	一种肾发育缺陷，肾脏解剖位置异常，位于骨盆内。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000126	Hydronephrosis	肾积水	Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.	肾盂和肾盏扩张导致肾脏的严重扩张。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000127	Renal salt wasting	肾源性盐流失	A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s).	尿液中一种或多种电解质浓度高，而血清中这些电解质浓度低。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000175	Cleft palate	腭裂	Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the `palate` (FMA:54549) resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).	腭裂是由腭突融合失败造成的发育缺陷，表现为口腔顶（软硬腭）的分裂
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000176	Submucous cleft hard palate	黏膜下硬裂腭	Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.	粘膜下硬腭裂以形成口腔顶部的骨性硬腭中间部缺损为特征。可能在触诊硬腭时检查出来。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000185	Cleft soft palate	软腭裂	Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.	软腭（也称为软腭，或肌肉腭）的裂口，为第7周和第12周妊娠之间发生的发育缺陷的结果。软腭裂可导致咽鼓管功能异常，由此导致中耳畸形和听力困难，以及因腭咽闭合不全带来的伴有重鼻音的语言问题

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000190	Abnormality of oral frenula	口腔系带异常	An abnormality of the `lingual frenulum` (FMA:59820), that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.	舌系带的异常或口腔内存在多余的系带。舌系带指连接舌头和口腔底部粘膜的小褶皱。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000200	Short lingual frenulum	舌系带过短	The presence of an abnormally short `lingual frenulum` (FMA:59820).	异常短小的舌系带
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000201	Pierre-Robin sequence	皮埃尔 - 罗宾序列	Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by `micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia)` (HP:0000347), `glossoptosis` (HP:0000162) and `cleft palate` (HP:0000175).	皮埃尔·罗宾畸形的特点是小下颌（下颌发育不全），舌下垂和腭裂的发育畸形序列。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000202	Oral cleft	口裂	The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.	口腔中有裂口，有唇裂和腭裂两种主要类型。唇裂指上颌和正中鼻突的先天性融合失败而形成在唇部的凹槽或裂缝。腭裂指腭先天性未能正确融合而在口腔顶部形成带槽凹陷或裂缝。唇颚裂可单独或合并发生。最好是每个缺陷分别编码。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000204	Cleft upper lip	上唇裂	A gap in the `upper lip` (FMA:59817). This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.	上唇的间隙。这是胚胎发育过程中唇组织非融合造成的先天性缺陷。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000205	Pursed lips	钱包状嘴唇	An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.	由于嘴唇收缩导致唇周皮肤呈放射状的一种面部畸形。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000206	Glossitis	舌炎	Inflammation of the tongue.	舌头发炎。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000207	Triangular mouth	三角嘴	The presence of a `triangular` (PATO:0001875) form of the `mouth` (FMA:49184).	嘴呈三角形。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000211	Trismus	牙关紧闭	Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.	张口能力受限。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000212	Gingival overgrowth	牙龈增生	`Hyperplasia` (MPATH:134) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762, that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.	牙龈增生即覆盖在牙槽嵴上的软组织变厚。增厚范围从仅包括齿间乳头，到牙龈增生覆盖整个牙冠。
头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000214	Lip telangiectasia	唇部毛细血管扩张	`Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the `lips` (FMA:59815).	唇部的毛细血管扩张（即存在小的、扩张的浅表血管）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000215	Thick upper lip vermilion	厚上唇	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	上唇中线唇红的高度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看下唇唇红的高度显得增加（主观）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000216	Broad secondary alveolar ridge	宽恒牙槽嵴		
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000217	Xerostomia	口腔干燥	Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.	因唾液腺功能障碍导致的口腔黏膜干燥。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000218	High palate	高腭	Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).	腭高大于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）或腭高在第一恒大臼齿处的水平高度超过该牙齿的高度的两倍（主观）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000219	Thin upper lip vermilion	薄上唇	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	上唇中线唇红的高度小于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看上唇唇红的高度显得变短（主观）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000220	Velopharyngeal insufficiency	腭咽闭合不全	Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.	腭咽括约肌功能下降，言语时不能把鼻腔与口腔分开。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000221	Furrowed tongue	沟裂舌	Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.	舌头背侧表面上的凹槽加深。
头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000222	Gingival hyperkeratosis	牙龈角化过度	`Hyperkeratosis` (MPATH:154) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	牙龈发生过度角化
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000223	Abnormality of taste sensation	味觉异常

头或颈部的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0000225	Gingival bleeding	牙龈出血	`Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) affecting the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	影响牙龈的出血
头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000227	Tongue telangiectasia	舌毛细血管扩张	`Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.	舌毛细血管扩张，即舌体浅表血管扩张
头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000228	Oral cavity teleangiectasia	口腔毛细管扩张	Presence of teleangiectases in the oral cavity.	口腔中有毛细管扩张。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000230	Gingivitis	牙龈炎	`Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	牙龈发炎
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000232	Everted lower lip vermilion	下唇唇红外翻	An abnormal configuration of the `lower lip` (FMA:59818) such that it is turned outward i.e., `everted` (PATO:0001597), with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.	下唇异常外翻，即从正面可见下唇唇红的内部（通常与牙齿相对）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000233	Thin vermilion border	薄嘴唇	Reduced width of the "skin of vermilion border region of upper lip" (FMA:312645).	上唇唇红区皮肤显得变窄
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000234	Abnormality of the head	头部异常	An abnormality of the `head` (FMA:7154).	头部的异常
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000235	Abnormality of the fontanelles and cranial sutures	囟门和颅缝的异常	Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments ).	囟门（在出生两年内骨化的由厚膜覆盖的区域）和颅缝（颅骨之间由韧带和纤维性关节构成的结缔组织相连形成的缝隙）的任何异常
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000236	Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle	前囟异常	An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.	前囟的任何异常。前囟即颅囟是位于冠状面和矢状缝线的交点的囟门。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000237	Small anterior fontanelle	小前囟	Abnormally decreased size of  the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.	前囟大小比同龄正常范围异常小
神经系统的异常	HP:0000238	Hydrocephalus	脑积水	Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.	脑积水是从脑脊液产生到吸收至体循环通路异常导致的脑室系统主动扩张。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000239	Large fontanelles	大囟门	In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.	在新生儿中，两块额骨、两块顶骨和一块枕骨由纤维缝合线连接，形成一个小的后囟和一个较大的菱形前囟。这些区域允许头颅通过产道和以后的增长。囟门逐渐骨化，后囟通常在出生后八周，前囟在出生后9?16个月的年龄闭合。如果囟门比年龄相符的正常值大，则被诊断为大囟门。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000240	Abnormality of skull size	头骨的大小异常	Any abnormality of the size of the skull.	头骨大小的任何异常。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000242	Parietal bossing	顶骨隆起	Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.	顶骨隆起是指在顶骨区明显突出。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000243	Trigonocephaly	三角头畸形	Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.	头颅呈三角形或三角锥形，尖位于额部中线，底位于两侧枕骨连线。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000244	Brachyturricephaly	短尖头畸形		
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000245	Abnormality of the sinuses	鼻窦异常	Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.	鼻旁鼻（颅）窦的异常。鼻窦是充满空气的空间，位于头骨和面部的骨头内部与鼻腔相通，包括上颌窦，额窦，筛窦，和蝶窦。
头或颈部的异常;免疫系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000246	Sinusitis	鼻窦炎	Inflammation of the `paranasal sinuses` (FMA:59679) owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.	由于病毒、细菌、真菌感染，过敏或自身免疫反应等原因所造成的鼻窦的炎症。（FMA:59679）
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000248	Brachycephaly	短头畸形	An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `decreased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002042). That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.	头骨形状的异常，其特征为前后直径减小。也就是说，头指数大于81％。或者说，头部的前后尺寸（长度）相比宽度显得缩短。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000250	Dense calvaria	颅骨密度过高	An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.	组成颅骨骨骼密度的异常增加。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000252	Microcephaly	小头畸形	Occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC) less than -3 standard deviations compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597). Alternatively, decreased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).	枕额（头）围（OFC）比年龄匹配的正常标准少3个标准差还小(参见Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597)。或者头盖骨尺寸减小。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000253	Progressive microcephaly	渐进性小头畸形	Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.	渐进性小头畸形的诊断在头围逐渐落后于同年龄和同性别的正常值时作出。
头或颈部的异常;免疫系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000255	Acute sinusitis	急性鼻窦炎	An `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `sinusitis` (HP:0000246).	急性鼻窦炎
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000256	Macrocephaly	大头畸形	Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).	枕额（头）周长大于年龄和性别相匹配的正常值的第97百分位数。或者头盖骨尺寸显得增大。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000260	Wide anterior fontanel	前囟增宽	Enlargement of the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.	前囟增大，（FMA:75439）考虑到年龄-相关等因素。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000262	Turricephaly	尖头畸形	Tall head relative to width and length.	头的长度相对于宽度更长。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000263	Oxycephaly	尖头畸形	Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.	尖头畸形（希腊oxus尖锐，kephalos头）是指头颅呈锥形或尖形。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000264	Abnormality of the mastoid	乳突异常	An abnormality of the `mastoid process` (FMA:52872), which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.	乳突的异常。乳突指从颞骨乳突部底面突出的圆锥形突出。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000265	Mastoiditis	乳突炎		
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000267	Cranial asymmetry	颅骨不对称	Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.	不对称的头颅骨骼
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000268	Dolichocephaly	长头畸形	An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `increased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002043), i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.	颅骨形状异常，其特点为前-后直径过长，即头骨从面前到脑后的尺寸过长。头颅指数低于76％。或相对于头部宽度，头部前-后长度显得过长。常由矢状缝的过早关闭导致。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000269	Prominent occiput	枕骨突出	Increased convexity of the `occiput` (FMA:49187) (posterior part of the skull).	枕骨（颅骨后部）的凸度增加
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000270	Delayed cranial suture closure	颅缝闭合延迟	Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.	婴儿在出生时通常有两个囟门，菱形前囟在冠状缝和矢状缝交界处，后囟门在枕顶骨的交点。后囟通常出生后第8周闭合，前囟平均出生后18个月闭合。本术语适用于如果超出正常年龄的囟门闭合延迟。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000271	Abnormality of the face	脸部异常	An abnormality of the `face` (FMA:24728).	脸部的异常
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000272	Malar flattening	平颧骨	Underdevelopment of the malar (frontal) process of the maxilla, appreciated in profile and/or by palpation.	上颌骨颧（前）突发育落后，通过侧面观察和/或触诊来识别。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000280	Coarse facial features	面容粗糙	Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.	眉毛，鼻子，嘴唇，嘴，下巴的外观不精细鲜明，通常是因为圆润和厚重的面部特征或伴有或没有皮下和骨组织增厚的皮肤增厚。

头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000294	Low anterior hairline	前发际低	Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella.	发际（trichion）和眉间（鼻根上方位于额骨上的最突出的点）的距离在中线上，多于平均值的两个标准偏差。或者，发际和眉间之间距离显得缩小。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000295	Doll-like facies	娃娃脸	A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin.	表现为圆脸形，圆脸颊，短鼻子以及相对较小的下巴的独特面部外观。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000306	Abnormality of the chin	下巴异常	An abnormality of the `chin` (FMA:46495), i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.	下巴的异常。下巴指面下部下唇以下部分，包括下颌中央突出部位。

头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000308	Microretrognathia	小退缩下颌	A form of `developmental hypoplasia` (MPATH:10060) of the `mandible` (FMA:52748) in which the mandible is `mislocalised posteriorly` (PATO:0001922).	下颌骨发育不全的一种形式，指下颌骨向后错位。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000309	Abnormality of the midface	面中部异常	An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.	面中部的异常。面中部指区域而不是解剖术语。其范围上至眼眶下缘，下至鼻基。它是由上颌骨（上颌）和颧骨形成。传统上，面中部不包括鼻和前颌骨。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000311	Round face	圆脸	The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.	从前方看面部外形较通常圆。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000315	Abnormality of the orbital region	眼眶区异常		
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000316	Hypertelorism	眼距过宽	Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).	瞳距比平均值大2个标准偏差（或，显得瞳距增加或双眼间隔过宽）。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0000317	Facial myokymia	面肌纤维颤搐	Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of the facial muscles.	面肌纤维颤搐是面部肌肉的细微纤丝活动。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000319	Smooth philtrum	人中扁平	Flat skin surface, with no ridge formation in the central region of the upper lip between the nasal base and upper vermilion border.	在鼻基与上唇红之间的皮肤表面平坦，没有脊形成。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000320	Bird-like facies	鸟样相脸		
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000321	Square face	方脸	Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance.	面部轮廓，如从正面观察，可显示较宽的颜面上部/头颅和颜面下部/下颌骨，外形如一正方形。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000322	Short philtrum	人中短	Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.	鼻基与上唇中线红唇的距离低于平均值超过2个标准偏差，或者，鼻基和上唇中线唇红之间的距离显得缩短。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000324	Facial asymmetry	面部不对称	An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.	脸的左侧和右侧之间存在异常的差别。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000325	Triangular face	三角脸	Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin.	从正面看，面部轮廓呈三角形，两侧太阳穴处较宽，下巴窄小。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000326	Abnormality of the maxilla	上颌骨异常	An abnormality of the `Maxilla` (FMA:9711) (upper jaw bone).	上颌骨的异常
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000327	Hypoplasia of the maxilla	上颌骨发育不全	Underdevelopment of the `Maxilla` (FMA:9711).	上颌骨发育不全。
肿瘤;头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0000329	Facial hemangioma	面部血管瘤	Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.	发生在面部的血管瘤，一种血管内皮细胞的良性肿瘤。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000331	Short chin	短下巴	Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.	从下唇唇红到下巴最下点的垂直距离减少。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000336	Prominent supraorbital ridges	眶上脊突出	Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.	额骨的眉弓轮廓向前和/或向两侧突起增加。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000337	Broad forehead	宽前额	Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead.	前额宽度或前颞间距大于平均值两个标准偏差（客观）;或前额两侧之间的距离显得增加。
头或颈部的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0000338	Hypomimic face	面具面容		
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000339	Pugilistic facies	拳击面容	Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer.	粗糙的面部特征让人联想起一个拳击手。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000340	Sloping forehead	额头倾斜	Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.	额头的前表面倾斜度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）;或者从侧面观察额头显得过度向后倾斜。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000341	Narrow forehead	额头狭窄	Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).	前额的宽度或者额颞间距离低于平均值多于两个标准偏差（客观）;或显得狭窄的颞骨间区域（主观）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000343	Long philtrum	长人中	Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.	鼻基及上唇中线之间的距离超过平均值的2个标准偏差，或者鼻基和上唇中线之间的距离显得增加。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000346	Whistling appearance	吹口哨面容	An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.	一种由于嘴唇不断的收缩导致张口减小的面部畸形，病人的嘴唇看起来像在吹口哨。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000347	Micrognathia	小下颌畸形	`Developmental hypoplasia` (MPATH:10060) of the `mandible` (FMA:52748).	下颌骨发育不全。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000348	High forehead	额头高	An abnormally increased height of the forehead.	额头高度的异常增加。
头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000349	Widow's peak	美人尖	Frontal hairline with bilateral arcs to a low point in the midline of the forehead.	两侧前额发际线呈弧形并在中线处略低。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000350	Small forehead	小额头	The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.	异常小的前额。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000356	Abnormality of the outer ear	外耳异常	An abnormality of the `external ear` (FMA:52781).	在`外耳`的异常（FMA: 52781）。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000358	Posteriorly rotated ears	后旋耳	A type of `abnormal location of the ears` (===HP:0000357===) in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).	一种耳位置异常（===HP:0000357===），耳朵位置的特征为向后旋转（耳朵的上部向头部的背面旋转，耳朵的下部向前方旋转）。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000359	Abnormality of the inner ear	内耳异常	An abnormality of the `inner ear` (FMA:60909).	“内耳”(FMA:60909)的异常。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000360	Tinnitus	耳鸣	Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.	耳鸣是一种没有外部声刺激却出现的声音相关的听觉体验，这种体验常位于耳朵或头颅中。
	HP:0000361	Pulsatile tinnitus (tympanic paraganglioma)	搏动性耳鸣（鼓室副神经节瘤）	Pulsatile tinnitus related to a tympanic paraganglioma, which is a benign neoplasm of the middle ear.	鼓室副神经节瘤（一种中耳良性肿瘤）相关的搏动性耳鸣。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000362	Otosclerosis	耳硬化症	In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.	在耳硬化症中，不正常的骨组织在镫骨及其周围聚集造成镫骨部分固定。这限制了镫骨运动从而导致耳聋。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000363	Abnormality of earlobe	耳垂异常	An abnormality of the `lobule of pinna` (FMA:60984).	在`pinna`的小叶的异常（FMA: 60984）。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000365	Hearing impairment	听力障碍	A `decreased magnitude` (PATO:0002018) of the `sensory perception of sound` (GO:0007605).	“声音感官知觉”(GO:0007605)的“明显下降”(PATO:0002018)。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000369	Low-set ears	低位耳	Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.	耳廓与头皮连接上缘低于眼内眦向后与耳连接的假想水平线。

免疫系统的异常;耳朵的异常	HP:0000371	Acute otitis media	急性中耳炎	Acute otitis media is a short and generally painful infection of the middle ear.	急性中耳炎是中耳的广泛、短暂的疼痛感染。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000372	Abnormality of the auditory canal	耳道异常	An abnormality of the `External acoustic tube` (FMA:61734) (also known as the auditory canal).	“外耳道”(FMA:61734)（也被称为耳道）的异常。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000376	Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II	II型耳蜗分隔不全	The cochlea is lacking the entire modiolus and cribriform area, resulting in a cystic appearance. This is accompanied by a large cystic vestibule.	耳蜗缺乏蜗轴和筛区，导致囊性外观。这种情况下，前庭也常常呈囊性。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000377	Abnormality of the pinna	耳廓异常	An abnormality of the `pinna` (FMA:56580), which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.	其也被称为在耳廓或外耳: 所述`pinna`（56580 FMA）的异常。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000378	Cupped ear	杯状耳	Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).	横向的招风耳，缺乏对耳轮的折叠（包含上下脚的缺失）。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000381	Stapes ankylosis	镫骨固定	Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).	镫骨（中耳中的镫形小骨或听小骨）固定是指先天性或获得性的镫骨关节强直，其与声音传导机制（外耳道、鼓膜及/或中耳听小骨）障碍导致的传导性听力损失相关。

头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000384	Preauricular skin tag	耳前皮赘	A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in front of the auricle (outer part of the ear).	耳组织的常带有软骨核心的退化的附属物，仅位于耳廓的前面（耳朵的外部）。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000385	Small earlobe	小耳垂	Reduced volume of the earlobe.	耳垂体积的减小。

免疫系统的异常;耳朵的异常	HP:0000389	Chronic otitis media	慢性化脓性中耳炎	Chronic otitis media refers to fluid, swelling, or infection of the middle ear that does not heal and may cause permanent damage to the ear.	慢性中耳炎是指中耳流液肿胀，或感染未痊愈导致耳永久性损害。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000396	Overfolded helix	耳轮过度卷曲	A condition in which the `helix` (FMA:60992) is `folded` (PATO:0001910) over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.	耳轮（FMA: 60992）’卷曲程度超过正常（PATO: 0001910）。即，耳轮边缘过度卷曲由此，游离边缘平行于耳的平面。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000399	Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment	学语前感音神经性听力损失	A form of `sensorineural deafness` (===HP:0008538===) with either `congenital onset` (===HP:0003577===) or `infantile onset` (===HP:0003593===), i.e., before the acquisition of speech.	感音神经性耳聋（===HP:0008538=== ）的一种，先天性（===HP:0003577===）或婴幼儿期发病（===HP:0003593===），即学会语言前发病。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000400	Macrotia	巨耳畸形	Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).	主观判断耳廓长度和宽度明显增加。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000402	Stenosis of the external auditory canal	外耳道狭窄	An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.	外耳道的异常缩小。
免疫系统的异常;耳朵的异常	HP:0000403	Recurrent otitis media	反复发作型中耳炎	Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.	中耳炎易感性增加，表现为中耳炎反复发作。
耳朵的异常	HP:0000405	Conductive hearing impairment	传导性听力障碍	An abnormality of `vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear` (GO:0055127) leading to impairment of `sensory perception of sound` (GO:0007605).	“声音振动传导到内耳”（GO: 0055127）的异常，导致“声音的感官知觉障碍”（GO: 0007605）。

耳朵的异常	HP:0000411	Protruding ear	招风耳	Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).	耳朵平面与颞骨乳突部的夹角大于第97百分位数年龄（目标），或者乳突处耳轮外缘的最大距离（目标）点超过2厘米。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000422	Abnormality of the nasal bridge	鼻梁异常	Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. 头或颈部的异常	HP:0000444	Convex nasal ridge	凸鼻嵴	Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.	鼻脊向连接鼻根和鼻尖的假想线之前弯曲。鼻子经常会同时显得突出和鼻小柱低
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000445	Wide nose	宽鼻	Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.	两侧鼻翼之间的距离大于同年龄平均值超过2个标准偏差，即鼻基宽度和鼻翼之间的宽度显得增加。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000446	Narrow nasal bridge	鼻梁狭窄	Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.	鼻子的骨桥宽度减小。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000447	Pear-shaped nose	梨形鼻		
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000448	Prominent nose	鼻子突出	Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.	鼻中隔根部和鼻尖之间的距离大于平均值加两倍标准差，或者，鼻子显得向前突起。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000451	Triangular nasal tip	三角鼻尖	The presence of a `triangular`  form of the ` mouth `	鼻尖呈三角形。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000452	Choanal stenosis	鼻后孔狭窄	Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).	鼻后孔（后鼻孔）异常收窄
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000453	Choanal atresia	鼻后孔闭锁	Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).	鼻后孔（后鼻孔）闭合不存在或异常
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000454	Flared nostrils	喇叭状鼻孔		
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000455	Broad nasal tip	宽鼻尖	Increase in width of the `nasal tip` (FMA:59518).	鼻尖宽度增加
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000456	Bifid nasal tip	双歧鼻尖	A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.	鼻尖的分裂。目视可见的有垂直压痕，裂开，或凹陷的鼻尖
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000457	Depressed nasal ridge	鼻嵴凹陷	Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.	由鼻嵴凹陷导致的鼻子不突出。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000458	Anosmia	嗅觉丧失	An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.	不能感知气味。这是一个通用术语，描述不能闻到的任何气味，可以是嗅觉过程中任何一部分异常而引起的，这一过程包括把气味物质吸收到覆盖嗅觉上皮的鼻腔粘膜，扩散到纤毛，与嗅觉神经元的受体位点结合，产生神经电冲动，从而感知的气味。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000460	Narrow nose	鼻子狭窄	Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.	鼻翼间距离低于年龄矫正的平均值超过2个标准偏差，或者鼻基宽度显得减小。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000463	Anteverted nares	鼻孔前翻	Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).	观察者与被观察者头部保持法兰克福水平且两人眼睛平齐，在这样的视角下观察到鼻孔朝前。外观表现为朝天鼻（鼻尖上翘）。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000464	Abnormality of the neck	颈部异常	An abnormality of the `neck` (FMA:7155).	颈部的异常
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000465	Webbed neck	颈蹼	A abnormality skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders.	从颈侧到肩部的皮肤连成一片皱褶。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000466	Limited neck range of motion	颈部运动范围受限		
头或颈部的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0000467	Neck muscle weakness	颈肌无力	`Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `neck musculature` (FMA:71290).	颈部肌肉组织力量减少
结缔组织的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000468	Increased adipose tissue around the neck	颈周脂肪组织增加	An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.	围绕颈部的皮下脂肪组织增加。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000470	Short neck	短颈	Diminished length of the `neck` (FMA:7155).	颈部的长度缩短
心血管系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0000471	Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia	胃肠道血管发育不良	`Dysplasia` (MPATH:589) affecting the vasculature of the `gastrointestinal tract` (FMA:71132).	`影响胃肠道血管的发育异常。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000472	Long neck	长颈	Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.	颈部顶-底长度的增加。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0000473	Torticollis	斜颈	Involuntary contractions of the `neck musculature` (FMA:71290) resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.	颈部肌肉不自主收缩导致头部运动异常或位置异常。
胎儿发育或出生异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000474	Thickened nuchal skin fold	颈部皮肤皱褶冗赘	A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (pmid:16100637).	胎儿颈后皮肤厚度增厚。通过胎儿头部横断位位于透明隔腔和丘脑水平，倾斜向后包括小脑处测量皱褶。测量取自枕骨中部外侧缘至皮肤最外侧。在18至24周大于或等于6mm，或16至18周大于或等于5毫米可认为测量值显著。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000475	Broad neck	宽颈	Increased side-to-side width of the neck.	颈部一侧到另一侧宽度增加
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000476	Cystic hygroma	囊状水瘤	A cystic lymphatic lesion of the `neck` (FMA:7155).	颈部囊性淋巴病变
眼睛的异常	HP:0000478	Abnormality of the eye	眼部异常	Any abnormality of the `eye` (FMA:54448), including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.	眼部异常，包括眼球的位置、间距和眼内组织的异常（54448 FMA）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000479	Abnormality of the retina	视网膜的异常	An abnormality of the `retina` (FMA:58301).	在视网膜上的异常（FMA:58301）。
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000480	Retinal coloboma	视网膜缺损	A notch or cleft of the retina.	视网膜的裂或凹槽。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000481	Abnormality of the cornea	角膜异常	Any abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238), which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.	角膜是覆盖在虹膜，瞳孔和前房的眼睛的前部的透明组织:所述角膜上（58238 FMA）的任何异常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000482	Microcornea	小角膜	A congenital abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.	角膜的先天性异常（FMA:58238），其中角膜和眼睛的眼前段都小于正常。角膜的水平直径甚至没有在成年期达到10毫米。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000483	Astigmatism	散光	Astigmatism describes a refractive error  characterized by a difference in the horizontal and vertical  curvature of the cornea.	散光，其特征为在角膜的水平和垂直曲率的屈光不正。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000484	Hyperopic astigmatism	远视散光	A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.	散光的形式，其中一个子午线是远视，而90度另一线上没有屈光不正。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000485	Megalocornea	巨角膜	An enlargement of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.	正常的清晰度和功能。 巨角膜的诊断是出生时角膜水平直径12毫米或更大，或两岁后水平角膜直径达13mm或以上。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000486	Strabismus	斜视	Strabismus (also known as squint) is a condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other.	斜视（也称为斜视）是指两只眼睛的协调性减弱。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000487	Congenital strabismus	先天性斜视	Congenital strabismus	出生后即发生的斜视
眼睛的异常	HP:0000488	Retinopathy	视网膜病变	Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.	视网膜的任何非炎性疾病。这里该非特异性术语??保留，因为它在文献中广泛使用，但如果可能的新注解应注明精确的类型的视网膜异常。
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000490	Deeply set eye	眼睛深陷	An `eye` (FMA:54448) that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.	眼睛比典型的脸面部平面更深地凹入
眼睛的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0000491	Keratitis	角膜炎	Inflammation of the cornea.	角膜炎症。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000492	Abnormality of the eyelid	眼睑异常	An abnormality of the `eyelids` (FMA:75178).	眼睑的异常
眼睛的异常	HP:0000493	Abnormality of the fovea	黄斑中心凹异常	An abnormality of the `fovea centralis` (FMA:58658), the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.	黄斑中心凹的异常（FMA:58658），黄斑中心区位于黄斑中央，此部位视锥细胞浓度最高，主导分辨率视觉和色觉。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000494	Downslanted palpebral fissures	下斜睑裂	The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.	睑裂倾角低于均值的两个标准差以上。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000495	Recurrent corneal erosions	复发性角膜糜烂	The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.	复发性角膜上皮糜烂的存在。虽然大部分角膜上皮缺损愈合快，有些人可能会表现出经常性溃疡。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000496	Abnormality of eye movement	眼球运动异常	An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.	在自愿或非自愿的眼睛运动时出现的异常。

眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0000498	Blepharitis	眼睑炎	Inflammation of the eyelids.	眼睑的炎症
头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000499	Abnormality of the eyelashes	睫毛异常	An abnormality of the `eyelashes` (FMA:53669).	睫毛的异常
眼睛的异常	HP:0000501	Glaucoma	青光眼	Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.	青光眼是指在通常与眼内压升高相关的视神经病变，常伴有视网膜神经节细胞的损失。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000502	Abnormality of the conjunctiva	结膜异常	An abnormality of the `conjunctiva` (FMA:59011).	在结膜上的异常（FMA:59011）。
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0000503	Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels	结膜血管迂曲	The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.	结膜的血管曲折和转数增加。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000504	Abnormality of vision	视力异常	Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).	视力的异常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000505	Visual impairment	视觉障碍	Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.	不同程度视力的丧失
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000506	Telecanthus	内眦距过宽	Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.	内眦距离大于平均值超过两个标准偏差（客观）;或者，两眼内眦之间的距离显得增加。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000508	Ptosis	上睑下垂	The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).	上睑缘比正常位于3毫米，覆盖虹膜（目标）的上部分;或者，遮蔽一部分的瞳孔的光线（主观）。
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0000509	Conjunctivitis	结膜炎	Inflammation of the  `conjunctiva` (FMA:59011).	在结膜上发生的炎症（FMA:59011）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000510	Retinitis pigmentosa	视网膜色素变性	Hereditary degeneration and atrophy of the retina.	遗传性视网膜变性。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000511	Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy	垂直性核上性凝视麻痹	A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.	核上性凝视麻痹是一个无法看在垂直方向的脑损伤的结果。有眼球运动的自愿性方面的损失，但是，由于脑干仍然完好，所有的反射共轭眼球运动是否正常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000512	Abnormal electroretinogram	视网膜电流图异常	Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.	视网膜中各种类型细胞的电反应异常可通过视网膜电流图检测。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000514	Slow saccadic eye movements	慢眼跳	An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.	异常缓慢速度的眼跳。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000517	Abnormality of the lens	晶状体异常	An abnormality of the `lens` (FMA:58241).	在晶状体上的异常（FMA:58241）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000518	Cataract	白内障	A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline `lens` (FMA:58241) of the eye or in its `capsule` (FMA:58881).	白内障是指晶状体或晶状体的囊膜不透明或混浊。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000519	Congenital cataract	先天性白内障	A congenital `cataract` (HP:0000518).	出生后即发现有白内障`（HP:0000518）。
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000520	Proptosis	眼球突出	An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.	眼球相对于面部比通常向前突起很多。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000522	Alacrima	无泪	Absence of tear secretion.	缺乏泪液分泌。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000523	Subcapsular cataract	囊下白内障	A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the `capsule of the lens` (FMA:58881).	白内障影响晶状体后囊下的皮质
眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000524	Conjunctival telangiectasia	结膜毛细血管扩张	The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.	小（约0.5?1.0毫米）扩张血管出现在结膜的粘膜表面。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000525	Abnormality of the iris	虹膜异常	An abnormality of the `iris` (FMA:58235), which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.	在虹膜上（FMA:58235）的异常，虹膜是位于角膜和晶状体之间的色素肌肉组织，中间的开口称为瞳孔。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000526	Aniridia	无虹膜	Congenital absence of the `iris` (FMA:58235).	先天性无虹膜（FMA:58235）。

头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000534	Abnormality of the eyebrow	眉毛异常	An abnormality of the `eyebrow` (FMA:54237).	眉毛的异常

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000537	Epicanthus inversus	下内眦赘皮	A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.	始于下眼睑中部之下，并向上弯覆盖至内眼角前面和侧面的皮肤褶皱。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000538	Pseudopapilledema	假性视乳头水肿	Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.	视盘明显肿胀，但没有颅内压增高。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000539	Abnormality of refraction	屈光异常	An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.	在光的聚焦由眼睛，以产生一清晰的影像在视网膜上的过程中出现异常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000540	Hypermetropia	远视	An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.	屈光的一种，特征是看到清楚远处物体的能力，而附近的物体出现模糊。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000541	Retinal detachment	视网膜脱离	Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.	视网膜（神经视网膜）从色素上皮内层分离。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000542	Impaired ocular adduction	眼内收障碍	Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.	眼睛向鼻子方向内收的能力下降。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000543	Optic disc pallor	视盘苍白	A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.	视盘灰黄色的颜色变浅（视神经乳头在视网膜的部位）。视盘通常具有一个中央粉红色的凹陷。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000544	External ophthalmoplegia	眼外肌麻痹	Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.	麻痹外眼部肌肉。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000545	Myopia	近视	An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.	屈光异常的一种，特征是看近处物体清楚，而在远处的对象出现模糊。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000546	Retinal degeneration	视网膜变性	A deterioration of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.	视网膜的病变。这里非特异性术语??保留，因为它在文献中广泛使用，但如果可能的新注解应注明精确的类型的视网膜异常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000547	Tapetoretinal degeneration	毯层状视网膜变性	Tapetoretinal degeneration	视网膜变性中的一种
眼睛的异常	HP:0000548	Cone-rod dystrophy	锥杆营养不良	Cone-rod dystrophy	视锥和视杆细胞均有损伤
眼睛的异常	HP:0000549	Abnormal conjugate eye movement	眼球共轭运动异常	Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.	眼球正常的运动协调需要双眼同时协调的注视同一目标。

眼睛的异常	HP:0000556	Retinal dystrophy	视网膜营养不良	Retinal dystrophy	视网膜营养不良
眼睛的异常	HP:0000557	Buphthalmos	Buphthalmos	Buphthalmos refers to a congenital open-angle glaucoma of the eye. The term buphthalmos (from Greek 'bous' or ox and 'ophthalmos' or eye) is descriptive of an enlarged eyeglobe resulting from increased intraocular pressure. The eyeglobe is especially prone to distension in newborns and infants because its collagen filaments are not as rigid as in adults and may easily be stretched.	Buphthalmos指眼睛的先天性开角型青光眼。术语buphthalmos（从希腊语“BOUS”或牛，“ophthalmos'或眼睛）是描述性的，从眼内压增高引起的眼球大。所述眼球大容易发生于新生儿和婴儿，因为此时巩膜的胶原纤丝不像成人的坚硬，容易被拉伸。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000558	Rieger anomaly	Rieger综合征	A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.	遗传性眼前节发育不良，特点有虹膜角膜畸形，青光眼，虹膜基质发育不良，和角膜混浊的一种先天性畸形。

眼睛的异常	HP:0000639	Nystagmus	眼球震颤	Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.	一种规律性，非自主的单眼或双眼震颤，震颤的双眼不能固视、共轭凝视，或前庭机制不良。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000640	Gaze-evoked nystagmus	凝视诱发眼震	Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.	眼球震颤在看向右或向左变得明显。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000641	Dysmetric saccades	Dysmetric 扫视	The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.	眼球扫视时的控制器信号有两个组成部分:脉冲是控制眼球从一点到另一点的快速移动，步骤保持眼睛在某一位置不动。当脉冲和步骤不匹配时，dysmetric refixation即发生了。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000642	Red-green dyschromatopsia	红绿色觉障碍	Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.	识别红色和绿色色调困难。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000643	Blepharospasm	眼睑痉挛	A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.	影响眼睑和额头的肌肉局部肌张力障碍，伴有双眼睑不自主复发性痉挛
眼睛的异常	HP:0000646	Amblyopia	弱视	Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.	视力下降，无可检测的解剖学缺陷，也不可用镜片矫正。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000647	Sclerocornea	角膜巩膜化	A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.	先天性异常，其中部分或全部的角膜获得巩膜的特性，从而导致角膜混浊。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000648	Optic atrophy	视神经萎缩	`Atrophy` (MPATH:127) of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863). Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.	视神经萎缩是由于视网膜神经节细胞轴突死亡所致，表现为眼底检查中视神经乳头颜色灰暗。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000649	Abnormality of vision evoked potentials	视觉诱发电位异常	An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.	视觉诱发电位的异常（VEP），这是电势，通过短暂的视觉刺激，记录视神经到视中枢的电活动。
眼睛的异常	HP:0000650	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	多导视觉诱发电位振幅降低	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	多导视觉诱发电位振幅降低
眼睛的异常	HP:0000651	Diplopia	复视	Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.	复视是指一个对象被感知为两个图像。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000652	Lower eyelid coloboma	下眼睑缺损	A short discontinuity of the margin of the `lower eyelid` (FMA:54442).	下眼睑的下沿存在断裂。

眼睛的异常	HP:0000654	Decreased electroretinogram (ERG) amplitude	视网膜电图振幅降低	Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.	视网膜电图反应降低。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000656	Ectropion	眼睑外翻	An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.	眼睑边缘向外翻转（外翻）或旋转。
神经系统的异常;眼睛的异常	HP:0000657	Oculomotor apraxia	动眼运动异常	Inability to follow objects visually with compensatory head movements, decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.	即使有代偿头动作，也无法直观地跟随物体，降低追求平稳，取消前庭眼反射。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0000658	Eyelid apraxia	眼睑失用症		
眼睛的异常	HP:0000659	Peters anomaly	Peters 综合征	A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.	眼前段异常的一种综合征，通常表现为中央，旁中央，或完全的角膜混浊。
眼睛的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0000660	Lipemia retinalis	视网膜脂血症	A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.	视网膜血管有乳脂状的外观，当血液中的脂质浓度极度增大，配浅粉色乳白色视网膜血管和脉络膜血管改变苍白的反射发生。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000670	Carious teeth	龋齿	Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.	龋齿是影响牙齿结构的多因素细菌感染。该术语被用于描述的比预期更多的龋齿存在。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000674	Anodontia	无牙畸形	The congenital `absence` (PATO:0002000) of all teeth.	先天性缺失所有牙齿

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000684	Delayed eruption of teeth	牙齿萌出延迟	`Delayed` (PATO:0000502) `tooth eruption` (MeSH:D014078), which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.	牙齿萌出的延迟，定义为牙齿萌出年龄比平均值大2个标准偏差。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000685	Hypoplasia of teeth	牙齿发育不全	Developmental hypoplasia of `teeth` (FMA:12516).	牙齿发育不全。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000687	Widely spaced teeth	牙间隙增宽	Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.	在相同的牙列中大部分牙齿之间的距离（齿隙）增大。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000689	Dental malocclusion	牙齿错位咬合	Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.	牙齿错位咬合指牙齿咬合或对齐的异常，以及上下牙齿契合方式的异常，从而导致牙齿排列过挤或咬合模式异常。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000690	Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor	上颌侧切牙发育不全	`Agenesis` (MPATH:57) of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the `maxillary lateral primary incisor` (FMA84217) and `maxillary lateral secondary incisor` (FMA:55724).	一个或多个上颌侧切牙发育不全，包括乳上颌侧切牙和恒颌上侧切牙
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000691	Microdontia	小牙畸形	`Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.	牙齿的尺寸减小，定义为近中侧到远侧的牙齿直径（宽度）低于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，牙齿的最大宽度显得减小。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000692	Misalignment of teeth	牙列不齐	Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., `misaligned` (PATO:0001654) `teeth` (FMA:12516).	牙齿的排列，定位或者间距异常，即牙齿排列不齐。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000695	Natal tooth	胎生牙齿	Erupted tooth or teeth at birth.	出生时已萌出的牙齿。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0000698	Conical tooth	圆锥形齿	An abnormal `conical` (PATO:0002021) form of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.	不正常的圆锥形形态的牙齿，也就是牙齿周边斜聚在一起成锥形
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000699	Diastema	牙间隙增大	Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.	相同牙弓上两个相邻牙齿间的空隙增大。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0000700	Periapical radiolucency	牙根尖周射线可透	Radiolucency (reflecting a reduction in the bony substance) around the apex (the tip of the dental root).	牙顶点（牙根的尖端）周围的射线可透（反映出骨质降低）。

神经系统的异常	HP:0000707	Abnormality of the nervous system	神经系统异常	An abnormality of the `nervous system` (FMA:7157).	在`神经系统`的异常（FMA:7157）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000708	Behavioral abnormality	行为异常	An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities.	一种精神功能异常，包括各种情感，行为，认知功能和感知觉的异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000709	Psychosis	精神病	A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs.	一种表现为人格和思维模式改变的疾病，常伴有幻觉和妄想
神经系统的异常	HP:0000710	Hyperorality	口欲亢进	A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth.	用口腔检查物体的一种倾向或冲动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000711	Restlessness	躁动		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000712	Emotional lability	情绪不稳		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000713	Agitation	易激惹		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000716	Depression	抑郁	A condition characterized by pervasive dysphoric mood, loss of interests, and inability to experience pleasure.	以普遍烦躁不安的情绪，失去兴趣，高兴不起来为特征的状态。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000717	Autism	孤独症	Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	自闭症是一种神经发育障碍，主要表现为社交能力受损、兴趣狭窄和行为刻板。婴幼儿期起病，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000718	Aggressive behavior	攻击性行为	Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself.	攻击行为可以表现为言语攻击、对目标的物理攻击、对人的身体攻击、并且还可能包括自我攻击。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000719	Inappropriate behavior	不适宜行为		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000720	Mood swings	情绪波动	An exaggeration of emotional affects such as laughing crying, or yawning beyond what the person feels.	扩大的情绪反应，如超出个人体验的大笑大哭，或打哈欠。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000721	Lack of spontaneous play	自发性游戏缺乏		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000722	Obsessive-compulsive behavior	强迫行为	Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV).	复发性强迫观念或强迫行为导致严重的耗时现象（患者每天需要浪费1小时以上），或者引起明显的痛苦或损伤（DSMⅣ）
神经系统的异常	HP:0000723	Restrictive behavior	限制性行为	Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities.	行为特点是不正常的限制，仅有少量的兴趣和活动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000725	Psychotic episodes	精神病发作		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000726	Dementia	痴呆	A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.	整体认知能力下降不能满足正常的社会或职业功能。痴呆标志着先前存在的认知能力丧失，通常在成人，可以影响记忆，思维，语言，判断和行为。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000727	Frontal lobe dementia	额叶痴呆		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000728	Impaired ability to form peer relationships	同伴关系建立能力障碍		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000729	Autistic behavior	自闭症行为	A disorder beginning in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	婴幼儿期出现的异常，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄
神经系统的异常	HP:0000732	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	恪守程序或习惯		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000733	Stereotypic behavior	刻板行为	A repetitive behaviour that does not serve an observable goal. In general the movements are not aimed at the environment, but at the person itself. Stereotypical behaviour is seen especially in children with sensory, intellectual and/or cognitive handicaps.	重复的无目的性的行为。总的来讲活动不是针对环境，但在人本身。刻板的行为，在伴有感官、智力和/或认知障碍的儿童尤为常见。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000734	Disinhibition	脱抑制	A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.	缺乏约束表现在几个方面，包括无视社会规范，冲动，风险评估能力差。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000735	Impaired social interactions	社会交往障碍	Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.	社会交往困难，其特征性损害如目光接触，微笑，适当的面部表情和身体姿势，且难以形成的同伴关系和建立友谊。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000736	Short attention span	注意力短暂	Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.	注意力降低特点是注意力分散和冲动性，但不一定满足注意缺陷多动障碍的诊断标准。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000737	Irritability	易激惹		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000738	Hallucinations	幻觉	Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.	在有意识的、清醒状态下，缺乏真实的外界刺激的一种感觉，因此他们是生动的、实质性的、并存在于外部客观空间。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000739	Anxiety	焦虑	Feeling or dread, apprehension, and impending disaster.	感觉恐惧、忧虑、和即将发生灾难。

神经系统的异常	HP:0000741	Apathy	情感淡漠	Lack of emotion or emotional expression; a disorder of motivation that persists over time.	缺乏感情或情绪的表达;一种持续性动力障碍的一种疾病。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000742	Self-mutilation	自残		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000743	Frontal release signs	额叶释放征象	Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.	出现原始反射，是额叶受损的征象。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000744	Low frustration tolerance	低挫折承受力		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000745	Diminished motivation	动机减弱	A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.	有目的的行为（即动机）减少。动机是使人们开始行为和适应的决定因素，激励完成持续有意图的行动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000746	Delusions	妄想	A belief that is pathological and is held despite evidence to the contrary.	是一种与现实不符且不可能实现但坚信的病理性信念。

神经系统的异常	HP:0000750	Delayed speech and language development	语言发育迟缓	A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age.	语言发育的程度与同年龄段儿童所应达到的标准比较明显落后。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000751	Personality changes	性格改变	An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.	在思想，行为或情感上的异常变化。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000752	Hyperactivity	多动		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000753	Autism with high cognitive abilities	具有高认知能力的自闭症		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000756	Agoraphobia	广场恐怖症	A type of anxiety disorder characterized by avoidance of public places, especially where crowds gather.	一种形式的焦虑障碍，以避免公共场所，特别是在人群聚集区为特点。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000757	Lack of insight	自知力缺乏		
神经系统的异常	HP:0000758	Impaired use of nonverbal behaviors	非言语行为应用障碍	Reduced ability to use nonverbal behavior for communication, such as eye-to-eye gaze, facial expression, body posture, and gestures.	使用非语言行为进行交流的能力下降，如眼睛对眼睛注视，面部表情，身体姿势和手势。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000759	Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system	外周神经系统的异常	An abnormality of the `peripheral nervous system` (FMA:9903), which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system.	`外周神经系统`（9903 FMA）的异常。外周神经系统是由从中枢神经系统发出的分支神经组成。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000762	Decreased nerve conduction velocity	神经传导速度降低	A reduction in the speed at which electrical signals propagate along the axon of a `neuron` (FMA:54527).	电信号沿着神经轴突（FMA:54527）传导速度的降低。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000763	Sensory neuropathy	感觉神经病	Peripheral neuropathy affecting the sensory nerves.	影响感觉神经的周围神经病变。
神经系统的异常	HP:0000764	Peripheral axonal degeneration	外围轴索变性	Progressive deterioration of peripheral axons.	外周神经轴突的逐步恶化。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000765	Abnormality of the thorax	胸廓的异常	Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).	胸廓的任何异常，胸廓是身体的一个区域，由胸骨、胸椎脊柱和肋形成。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000766	Abnormality of the sternum	胸骨异常	An anomaly of the `sternum` (FMA:7485), also known as the breastbone.	胸骨的异常。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000767	Pectus excavatum	漏斗胸	A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest ("pectus") a caved-in ("excavatum") appearance.	胸壁特点是胸骨凹陷的缺陷，使胸部（“漏斗”）一塌式（“excavatum”）的外观。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000768	Pectus carinatum	鸡胸	A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.	胸部甲畸形引起的肋的过度生长和特征胸骨凸起。

内分泌系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0000825	Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia	高胰岛素性低血糖	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) combined with a `decreased concentration` (PATO:0001163) of `glucose` (CHEBI:17234) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	血中胰岛素浓度异常升高的同时伴有血葡萄糖浓度的减低。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000826	Precocious puberty	性早熟	The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.	指第二性征在正常年龄之前开始。尽管正常儿童青春期开始的年龄差别很大而难以界定“正常年龄”，性早熟通常定义为男孩9岁或者女孩8岁之前青春期发育开始。

内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000829	Hypoparathyroidism	甲状旁腺功能减退症	A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.	甲状旁腺激素分泌不足导致的一种病理状态，特点是低钙血症和高磷酸盐血症。
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000830	Anterior hypopituitarism	垂体前叶功能减退症	A condition of reduced function of the pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.	垂体前叶功能减退产生的症状,表现为一种或多种垂体激素分泌减少, 如生长激素，促甲状腺激素，促肾上腺皮质激素，泌乳素，黄体生成素和卵泡刺激素。
内分泌系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0000831	Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus	胰岛素抵抗型糖尿病	A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as will as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.	糖尿病的一种，其致病原因不是由于缺乏胰岛素，而是由于胰岛素的靶组织如肌肉，脂肪和肝细胞等丧失对胰岛素的反应。这种类型的糖尿病中通常血中葡萄糖浓度，及空腹和餐后血清胰岛素水平都升高。
