神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000837	Gonadotropin excess	促性腺激素增多	Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.	垂体前叶产生过多的促性腺激素（FSH，LH）。
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常;生长异常	HP:0000839	Pituitary dwarfism	垂体性侏儒症	A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.	一种比例正常但矮小的身材，与垂体功能异常有关，这种异常或者只是生长激素的分泌不足，或者是全垂体机能减退，即所有垂体前叶激素分泌不足。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000840	Adrenogenital syndrome	肾上腺生殖综合征	Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.	肾上腺生殖综合征也称为先天性肾上腺增生，由于肾上腺中类固醇激素生产失调导致皮质醇不足。引起垂体促肾上腺皮质激素分泌增多，从而导致肾上腺过量产生一些具有雄激素作用的中间产物。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000841	Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system	肾素血管紧张素系统亢进	An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.	肾素 - 血管紧张素系统活性异常增加，通过增加血容量和收缩血管引起高血压。
内分泌系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0000842	Hyperinsulinemia	高胰岛素血症	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	血中胰岛素浓度异常升高
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000843	Hyperparathyroidism	甲状旁腺功能亢进症	Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.	甲状旁腺过量产生甲状旁腺激素（PTH）。
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000845	Growth hormone excess	生长激素增多	Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.	肢端肥大症是由于在骨骺已闭合的人中脑垂体产生过多生长激素引起的一种状态，主要引起肢体远端部分的增大。包括颅骨周长增加，鼻子变宽，舌头肿大，面部特征变得粗糙，下颌骨过度增长，而牙齿变得分开。手指和脚趾的厚度增加。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000846	Adrenal insufficiency	肾上腺功能不全	Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.	由于肾上腺腺体本身的缺陷, 导致其产生的类固醇激素（主要是皮质醇）的不足
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000847	Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system	肾素 - 血管紧张素系统异常	An abnormality of the `renin-angiotensin system` (FMA:74787).	肾素 - 血管紧张素系统的异常
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000848	Increased circulating renin level	血肾素水平升高	An increased level of renin (PRO:000013883) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	血液循环中肾素水平升高
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000849	Adrenocortical abnormality	肾上腺皮质异常		
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000851	Congenital hypothyroidism	先天性甲状腺功能减退症	A type of `hypothyroidism` (HP:0000821) with `congenital onset` (HP:0003577).	一种先天性发病(HP:0003577)的甲状腺功能低下(HP:0000821)
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000852	Pseudohypoparathyroidism	假性甲状旁腺功能减退症	A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.	此症特点是对甲状旁腺激素的作用失敏，低血钙，高血磷，和相对高浓度的甲状旁腺激素。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000853	Goiter	甲状腺肿	An enlargement of the `thyroid gland` (FMA:9603).	甲状腺腺体的增大
肿瘤;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000854	Thyroid adenoma	甲状腺腺瘤	The presence of a `adenoma` (MPATH:270) of the `thyroid gland` (FMA:9603).	甲状腺出现腺瘤。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0000855	Insulin resistance	胰岛素抵抗	`Increased resistance` (PATO:0001650) towards `insulin` (PRO:000009054), that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.	`增加resistance`（PATO:0001650）朝向`insulin`（PRO:000009054），即，胰岛素在降低血糖水平减少的效果。
内分泌系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0000857	Neonatal insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus	新生儿胰岛素依赖型糖尿病		
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000858	Menstrual irregularities	月经不调症		
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000859	Hyperaldosteronism	醛固酮增多症	Overproduction of the mineralocorticoid aldosterone by the adrenal cortex.	肾上腺皮质生产的盐皮质激素醛固酮过多。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000860	Parathyroid hypoplasia	甲状旁腺发育不全	Developmental hypoplasia of the `parathyroid gland` (FMA:13890).	甲状旁腺发育不全
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000863	Central diabetes insipidus	中枢性尿崩症	A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.	由于下丘脑分泌血管加压素（AVP）缺陷引起的尿崩症。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000864	Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis	下丘脑 - 垂体轴异常	Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that  hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.	垂体（也称为脑下垂体），是在脑的底部从下丘脑的底端突出的一个内分泌腺。垂体分泌的激素有促肾上腺皮质激素，促甲状腺激素，泌乳素，生长激素，内啡肽，卵泡刺激素，黄体生成素，催产素，抗利尿激素。垂体前叶的激素分泌受下丘脑激素的严格控制，而垂体后叶基本上是下丘脑的延伸，所以下丘脑和垂体可被认为是一个功能单元。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000866	Euthyroid multinodular goiter	甲状腺功能正常结节性甲状腺肿		
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000867	Secondary hyperparathyroidism	继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进	Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.	继发性甲状旁腺亢进指在有低血钙症时甲状旁腺激素的生产过量。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000868	Decreased fertility in females	女性生育能力下降		
内分泌系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000869	Secondary amenorrhea	继发性闭经		
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000870	Prolactin excess	泌乳激素过多	The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.	指泌乳素血中水平异常升高。泌乳素是一种由垂体前叶分泌的蛋白质激素，影响乳腺发育及怀孕期的泌乳。
神经系统的异常;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000871	Panhypopituitarism	全垂体功能减退	A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).	垂体功能缺损影响所有垂体前叶激素（生长激素，促甲状腺激素，卵泡刺激素，黄体生成素，促肾上腺皮质激素，和泌乳素）。
内分泌系统的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0000872	Hashimoto thyroiditis	桥本甲状腺炎	A chronic, autoimmune type of `thyroiditis` (HP:0100646) associated with `hypothyroidism` (HP:0000821).	一种慢性的与甲状腺功能减退(HP:0000821)相关的自身免疫性甲状腺炎HP:0100646。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0000873	Diabetes insipidus	尿崩症	A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).	一种过量饮水伴多尿，低渗尿（稀释性）的状态。尿崩症可能是由于血管加压素（AVP）分泌缺陷（中枢或神经性尿崩症）或肾脏对AVP的反应缺陷（肾性尿崩症）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0000875	Episodic hypertension	阵发性高血压	Not persistently high arterial blood pressure.	非持续性的高血压，只是偶尔发作，自发终止。
内分泌系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0000876	Oligomenorrhea	月经稀少症	Infrequent periods (less than 6 per year).	月经期频率减少（每年少于6次）。

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000919	Abnormality of the costochondral junction	肋软骨交界处异常	Any anomaly of the `costochondral junction` (FMA:7956). The costochondral junctions are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.	肋软骨交界处的任何异常。肋软骨交界处位于肋骨的远端和肋软骨之间，连接肋骨和胸骨的杆状透明软骨。

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000927	Abnormality of skeletal maturation	骨骼成熟异常	The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.	自胎儿至青春期，骨架的骨头的大小、形状和钙化发生一系列特征性改变。这个过程中的异常包括骨骼成熟的延迟或加速，或一些偏差，但不是所有骨头都会这样，发生成熟的预期模式的改变。

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000938	Osteopenia	骨质疏松	Osteopenia refers to a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD) below normal peak BMD but not low enough to be classified as osteoporosis. According to the WHO, osteopenia is characterized by a value of BMD more than 1 standard deviation below the young adult mean, but less than 2 standard deviations below this value.	骨质减少是指在骨矿物质密度的降低（BMD）低于正常峰骨密度但不低到足以被归类为骨质疏松症。根据世界卫生组织，骨质减少的特征在于骨密度值大于年轻成年人平均值低于1个标准差，但小于2个标准偏差低于此值。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0000939	Osteoporosis	骨质疏松	Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO, osteoporosis is characterized by a value of BMD 2.5 standard deviations or more below the young adult mean.	骨质疏松症是一种全身骨骼疾病，其特征为低骨密度和骨组织的微结构退化与骨脆性随之增加。根据世界卫生组织，骨质疏松症的特征在于骨密度值2.5个标准差以上的年轻成人下面的意思。

That is, the long bone is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.	长骨的不正常外观相似哑铃，具有重量在每端一个短路棒。即，长骨被缩短并显示燃烧干骺端的（扩大）。

体壁的异常	HP:0000956	Acanthosis nigricans	黑棘皮病	A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck.	该病的皮损特点是局部皮肤增厚，过度色素沉着斑，主要发生在面部和颈部的褶皱处。
体壁的异常	HP:0000957	Cafe-au-lait spot	咖啡斑	Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.	咖啡斑指的是边缘光滑，颜色介于浅棕色至深棕色之间的色素过度沉着性病变，大小因年龄而异，成年人的皮损直径在1.5厘米以上，儿童则在0.5厘米以上。
体壁的异常	HP:0000958	Dry skin	干性皮肤	Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.	皮肤缺乏足够的水分。
骨骼系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000960	Sacral dimple	骶骨窝	A subtype of `skin dimples` (HP:0010781) presenting as an indentation in the skin of the intergluteal cleft .	表现为在intergluteal裂的皮肤压痕:中`皮肤dimples`（0010781 HP）A亚型。
呼吸系统异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000961	Cyanosis	紫绀	A bluish or purplish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes due to an increase in the amount of deoxygenated hemoglobin in the blood or a structural defect in the hemoglobin molecule.	因血液中还原型血红蛋白的含量增加或血红蛋白分子的结构缺陷而表现出皮肤或粘膜的颜色变蓝或变紫。
体壁的异常	HP:0000962	Hyperkeratosis	角化过度	Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.	角化过度是皮肤最外层的角质层异常增厚所致，角质层是由大量从颗粒层退化的角质细胞，在表皮形成多面扁平状角蛋白构成。
体壁的异常	HP:0000963	Thin skin	薄皮	Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.	皮肤的厚度降低，通常和皮肤的弹性和柔软度缺失有关。
免疫系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000964	Eczema	湿疹	Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.	湿疹是皮炎的一种表现，湿疹这个术语可用于很多皮肤病变，且可能与大量潜在因素相关。湿疹的皮损呈多形性，可包括干燥伴反复发生的红色皮疹、水肿、干燥伴瘙痒、结痂、剥落、水泡、裂隙、渗血或出血。
心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000965	Cutis marmorata	大理石样皮肤	A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.	因皮肤毛细血管扩张、静脉淤血，皮肤出现紫色或红蓝色围绕中央苍白区呈网状改变，又称网状青斑，常发生在下肢、手臂和躯干，冬季加重。
体壁的异常	HP:0000966	Hypohidrosis	少汗症	Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat.	汗腺分泌能力异常减弱。
血液和造血组织异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000967	Petechiae	瘀点	Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.	瘀点是针尖大小红色或紫色的斑点，类似红疹，是皮肤或粘膜下毛细血管破裂发生浅表出血的表现。瘀点一般有发生出血的倾向。
体壁的异常	HP:0000968	Ectodermal dysplasia	外胚层发育不良	Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.	外胚层发育不良是一组累及皮肤、头发、指甲、牙齿以及汗腺发育异常的先天性疾患。

This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.	瘀斑（青肿）指的是由于血液从破裂的血管逸入组织而引起的皮肤变色。这个术语指的是瘀伤易感性的异常增加。病例报道中发现其相应的表型异常通常表现为无外伤发生后出现的频繁青紫和瘀斑。
血液和造血组织异常;心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0000979	Purpura	紫癜	Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning "purple") is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.	紫癜（源自拉丁语:purpura，意为“紫色”）是一种压之不褪色的皮肤紫红色斑。通常由皮下出血引起。由于毛细血管脆性增加从而发展成紫癜。紫癜比瘀点大。

体壁的异常	HP:0001065	Striae distensae	萎缩纹	Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.	皮肤表现为红色、较薄的凹陷性萎缩带。初起为粉红色的线状萎缩，接着，线状拉长且颜色变为淡红或略带紫色，最后，表现为白色的与皮纹方向平行的凹陷性萎缩带。萎缩纹最常发生在弹性较大的部位如腰部，臀部，大腿，胸部，腹部和肩部。
神经系统的异常;肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0001067	Neurofibromas	神经纤维瘤	The presence of multiple cutaneous neurofibromas.	
体壁的异常	HP:0001069	Episodic hyperhidrosis	发作性多汗症	Intermittent episodes of abnormally increased perspiration.	间歇性发作的排汗增多。

肿瘤;心血管系统的异常	HP:0001076	Glabellar hemangioma	眉间血管瘤	Glabellar hemangioma,which is a benign and usually self-involuting tumor (swelling or growth) of the endothelial cells that line blood vessels that is characterised by increased number of normal or abnormal vessels filled with blood.	血管瘤是一种良性通常能够自行消退的内皮细胞肿瘤，以血管数目增多为特征。发生在眉间的血管瘤即眉间血管瘤。

消化系统的异常	HP:0001082	Cholecystitis	胆囊炎	The presence of `inflammatory` (PATO:0002104) changes in the `gallbladder` (FMA:7202).	胆囊存在炎症改变。
眼睛的异常	HP:0001083	Ectopia lentis	晶状体异位	Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.	晶状体的错位。晶状体的局部位移（或错位）被描述为晶状体的半脱位，而一个完整的位移被称为晶状体的脱位。如果晶状体完全脱位，可脱至前房，玻璃体，或视网膜上。如果晶状体部分的移动，但仍然包含在晶体空间内，则它被称为半脱位。
眼睛的异常	HP:0001084	Corneal arcus	角膜环	A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years.	角膜缘（角巩膜交界处）的朦胧的，灰白色的约2毫米宽的环形带。角膜环一般发生双侧，并涉及在角膜脂质沉积。角膜环可发生于老年人，是衰老过程的一部分，也可发生于50岁以下高胆固醇血症的人。
眼睛的异常	HP:0001085	Papilledema	视乳头水肿	Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.	乳头水肿指视盘继发于脑脊髓液压力增高的任何因素的水肿（肿胀）。

眼睛的异常;头或颈部的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0001097	Keratoconjunctivitis sicca	干燥性角结膜炎	Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.	干眼可由相关的泪膜成分（水，粘蛋白，或脂质），眼睑异常，或上皮异常所致。干燥性角结膜炎通常导致划痕或沙的感觉（异物感），症状有瘙痒，泪少，对光敏感，发红，疼痛，眼睑移动困难。

眼睛的异常	HP:0001149	Lattice corneal dystrophy	格子样角膜营养不良	The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.	角膜上出现的的细小分枝状Bowman层的浑浊，可以从中央部扩散到周边。深角膜基质可以涉及但不达到Descemet膜。可能会出现经常性角膜糜烂。组织学检查显示在角膜的胶原纤维淀粉样蛋白沉积物。
	HP:0001150	Choroidal sclerosis	脉络膜硬化	Choroidal sclerosis is a descriptive term applied to the ophthalmoscopic appearance of prominent white choroidal vessels in which the blood columns are not seen or are sheathed by white lines.	脉络膜硬化是一种描述性术语，用于描述眼底检查中不能看到脉络膜血管或脉络膜血管有白线护套。

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001156	Brachydactyly syndrome	短指畸形综合征	Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used to describe a series of Mendelian diseases characterized by distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here, however, it is preferable to described the observed phenotypic abnormalities precisely.	出现不成比例的数字比较短的手/脚。字短指用来描述了一系列具有明显缩短的位模式（短指类型AE）孟德尔疾病。这是这里使用的意义，但是，它是优选的精确描述的所观察到的表型异常。

Bony fusions are revered to as "bony" syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as "symphalangism".	手指或脚趾间的蹼或融合，仅涉及软组织或包括骨结构。如果融合发生在桡尺轴线，骨性融合被称为“骨”性并指。手指或脚趾在近-远轴的骨头融合称为“关节粘连”。

四肢异常	HP:0001169	Broad palm	宽掌	For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.	从出生的儿童至4岁的手掌宽度大于2的SD高于平均值;从4至16岁儿童的手掌宽度高于95百分位数;或者，手掌的宽度出现不成比例宽为长度。

The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middel fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.	手的中间部分（手指和掌骨）丢失，给人一种劈裂的外观。其严重程度是变化很大，从中指略微发育不良、中指缺如，以至寡指或单指手。

四肢异常	HP:0001176	Large hands	巨手		
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001177	Preaxial hand polydactyly	Preaxial多指手	Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.	编外位数位于手的径向侧。多趾（编外位），涉及拇指发生在许多不同的形式高可变性和严重程度。
四肢异常	HP:0001178	Ulnar claw	尺侧爪手	An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.	手的姿态异常，特征是无名指和小手指掌指关节的过伸，同时发生指间关节弯曲，向掌心卷曲。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001180	Oligodactyly (hands)	少指（趾）畸形	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of fingers.	一个发育缺陷造成比手指的正常数量少的存在。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001181	Adducted thumb	拇指内收	In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.	在静止位置，拇指的尖端上，或附近，手掌，靠近第四或第五手指根部。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001182	Tapered finger	锥形手指	The gradual reduction in girth of the digit from proximal to distal.	手指的指围从近端向末端逐渐减少。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001187	Hyperextensibility of the finger joints	指关节伸展过度	The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.	手指关节的能力，超越其运动正常范围。
四肢异常	HP:0001188	Hand clenching	手摩擦	An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints.	不正常的手的姿势，其中，双手紧握拳头来。所有持有数字在掌指及指间关节完全弯曲。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001191	Abnormality of the carpal bones	腕骨异常	An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).	影响手腕骨骼的异常，组成手腕的骨骼有舟骨、月骨、三角骨、豆状骨、棱形骨、斜方骨、头状骨和钩骨。
四肢异常	HP:0001193	Ulnar deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand	手或手指向尺侧偏斜		
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001194	Abnormalities of placenta and umbilical cord	胎盘和脐带的异常	An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).	胎盘（发育中的胎儿子宫壁连接的器官）或脐带的（胎儿与胎盘的连接）中的异常。
胎儿发育或出生异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0001195	Single umbilical artery	单脐动脉	Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord.	单脐动脉（SUA）是指在超声影像下缺乏脐带中两条脐动脉围绕胎儿膀胱的正常声像特征，而仅见其中一条。
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001196	Short umbilical cord	脐带过短	Decreased length of the `umbilical cord` (FMA:85541).	脐带长度缩短。
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001197	Abnormality of prenatal development or birth	胎儿产前发育或出生异常	An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.	胎儿的异常或胎儿出生异常，不含结构异常。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001199	Triphalangeal thumb	三指节拇指	A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.	拇指在近-远轴上有三节指骨。该术语用于描述拇指有一个额外的指骨，拇指变成与其他手指一样的外观。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001204	Distal symphalangism (hands)	末节指关节粘连	The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.	术语远侧symphalangism指的手的数字的远端和中间指骨的骨融合，换句话说远端指间关节（DIJ）是缺失的，可以看出无论是在X射线或作为不存在远端的指间手指折痕。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001211	Abnormality of the fingertips	指尖异常		
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0001212	Prominent fingertip pads	指尖垫突出	A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term "persistent fetal fingertip pads" is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist.	指尖的腹侧方面的软组织突出。术语“持续胎儿指尖垫”经常被用作同义词，但是最好不要使用，因为它暗示这往往不存在病人的历史的知识。
结缔组织的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001215	Camptodactyly of 2nd-5th fingers	食指至小手指全弯曲	The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.	远端指间关节和/或第二到第五手指的近端指间关节，但无法通过主动或被动的扩展被扩展到180度。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001216	Delayed ossification of carpal bones	腕骨骨化延迟	Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.	腕骨骨化发生后比年龄调整规范。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001217	Clubbing	杵状指	Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.	拓宽了与指甲的增加纵向和横向弯曲相关联的所有层面对数字提示的软组织（软组织无肿胀水肿）的。
四肢异常	HP:0001218	Autoamputation	自发性肢体离断	Spontaneous detachment (amputation) of an appendage from the body.	从身体的附属物自发支队（截肢）。
结缔组织的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001220	Interphalangeal joint contracture of finger	手指的指间关节挛缩	Chronic loss of joint motion in an interphalangeal joint of a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.	关节运动的手指的指间关节慢性损失，由于在非骨组织结构变化。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001222	Spatulate thumbs	匙状拇指	Spoon-shaped, broad thumbs.	匙状的宽拇指。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001223	Pointed proximal second through fifth metacarpals	第2到第5近端掌骨尖	All of the metacarpal bones of the hand have a pointed proximal appearance.	所有的手的掌骨的有尖近侧外观。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001225	Wrist swelling	腕关节肿胀		
四肢异常;体壁的异常	HP:0001226	Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of digits	肢端溃疡和骨髓炎导致手指自发性离断	Ulceration and osteomyelitis of the distal parts of the limbs associated with necrosis and spontaneous detachment of digits or parts of digits.	溃疡和坏死和的数字或数字份自发脱离的四肢的前端部的骨髓炎。
四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001227	Abnormality of the thenar eminence	大鱼际异常	An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.	大鱼际异常，大鱼际是拇指下方的手掌肌肉。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001230	Broad metacarpals	掌骨变宽	Abnormally broad metacarpal bones.	异常广阔的掌骨。
体壁的异常	HP:0001231	Abnormality of the fingernails	指甲异常	An abnormality of the `fingernails` (FMA:54327).	指甲的异常。
心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0001232	Nail bed telangiectasia	甲床毛细血管扩张	Telangiectases in the area of the `nails` (FMA:54326).	甲基底部毛细血管扩张。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001233	2-3 finger syndactyly	食指、中指并指	2-3 finger syndactyly means the fusion of 2nd to 3rd finger.	第二、三手指融合型并趾。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001234	Hitchhiker thumb	“打车手势”拇指	With the hand relaxed and the thumb in the plane of the palm, the axis of the thumb forms an angle of at least 90 degrees with the long axis of the hand.	与手轻松和在手掌平面的拇指，拇指的轴线形成至少90度的与手的长轴的角度。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001238	Slender finger	修长的手指	Digits are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.	数字是不成比例的狭窄（减少周长）的手/脚的大小或建立个人的。
结缔组织的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001239	Wrist flexion contracture	腕关节屈曲挛缩	A chronic loss of wrist joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the wrist.	由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构性变化，使腕关节活动度面型丧失，妨碍了手腕关节的正常运动。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001241	Capitate-hamate fusion	头钩骨融合		
四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001245	Small thenar eminence	小鱼际小	Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.	小鱼际发育不好，拇指根部手掌软组织减少。
四肢异常	HP:0001248	Short tubular bones (hand)	短管状骨（手）		
神经系统的异常	HP:0001249	Intellectual disability	智力残疾	Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70.	源于发育阶段的智力功能低于正常。智力残疾，以前被称为精神发育迟滞，定义为智商得分低于70。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001250	Seizures	癫痫发作	Seizures are an intermittent `abnormality of the central nervous system` (FMA:HP:0002011) due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures.	癫痫发作是中枢神经系统（FMA:HP:0002011）因突然，过度，无序大脑神经元放电而产生的间歇性异常；临床特点由感觉障碍、意识丧失、精神功能受损、或抽搐的动作为特征。术语癫痫用于描述慢性，复发性癫痫发作。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001251	Ataxia	共济失调	Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- oder overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).	小脑共济失调是指由于小脑功能障碍导致的共济失调。这引起了各种基本的神经缺陷，包括协调不能（缺乏肌肉，四肢和关节之间的协调），辨距障碍（缺乏判断距离能力，可导致抓握运动时不能达到或超过目标），和轮替运动障碍（不能进行需要拮抗肌群反复切换开关的快速运动）。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001252	Muscular hypotonia	肌张力减退	Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching.	肌张力减退是指异常肌张力低下（张力运动或拮抗运动肌肉量），常累及肌力减退。张力减退的特征在于拮抗运动减少，以被动伸展为主。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001254	Lethargy	嗜睡	A state of  disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating.	一种漠不关心，精神萎靡，无欲的状态，导致难以执行简单任务或集中注意力。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001256	Intellectual disability, mild	轻度智力残疾	Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.	轻度智力残疾定义为智商（IQ）在50-69的范围内。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001257	Spasticity	痉挛状态	A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.	运动系统疾病特征是速度依赖的牵张反射伴与肌张力增高，夸大（过度兴奋的）腱反射。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001258	Spastic paraplegia	痉挛性截瘫	Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles.	痉挛状态和小腿和臀部的肌肉无力。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001259	Coma	昏迷	Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli.	完全没有觉醒和意识内容，表现为对任何外部刺激没有反应。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001260	Dysarthria	构音障碍	Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.	构音障碍一般用于描述语言清晰度降低的神经言语障碍。根据受损的神经结构不同，可分为痉挛性、弛缓性、共济失调性、运动过度性、运动减弱性或混合性构音障碍。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001262	Somnolence	嗜睡		
神经系统的异常	HP:0001263	Global developmental delay	全面发育迟缓	A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.	儿童重要的运动功能和精神发育迟缓，包括运动技能，言语和语言能力，认知能力和社会情感能力。此术语应仅用于描述的年龄小于五岁儿童。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001264	Spastic diplegia	痉挛性双侧瘫痪	Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.	痉挛（神经肌肉张力增高）主要集中在腿部，臀部和骨盆的肌肉。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001265	Hyporeflexia	腱反射减弱	Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	神经反射减弱，如膝腱反射。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001266	Choreoathetosis	舞蹈手足徐动	Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).	以手足徐动（无法维持肌肉在固定位置）和舞蹈样运动（广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动）为特征的不自主运动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001268	Mental deterioration	智能衰退	Loss of previously present mental abilities, generally in adults.	既往存在的智能丧失，一般指成人。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001269	Hemiparesis	轻偏瘫	Relatively mild weakness in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.	一侧上下肢相对较轻的无力，有时累及面部。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001270	Motor delay	运动延迟	A type of `Developmental delay` (HP:0001263) characterized by a delay in acquiring motor skills.	一种主要表现为运动技能学习能力延迟的发育迟滞。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001271	Polyneuropathy	多发性神经病	A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.	周围神经的广泛疾病
神经系统的异常	HP:0001272	Cerebellar atrophy	小脑萎缩	Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellum`(FMA:67944).	小脑萎缩（缩小）（FMA:67944）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001273	Abnormality of the corpus callosum	胼胝体异常	Abnormality of the `corpus callosum` (FMA:86464).	`胼胝体`的异常（FMA:86464）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001274	Agenesis of corpus callosum	胼胝体发育不全	Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.	胼胝体发育障碍导致的胼胝体缺如，它可以由发育过程中的多个步骤的障碍引起，包括在中线的细胞增殖和迁移，轴突生长或神经胶质细胞生长。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001276	Hypertonia	肌张力增高		
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0001278	Orthostatic hypotension	体位性低血压	A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.	当一个人变换为站立的位置时突然出现血压下降的一种低血压。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001279	Syncope	晕厥	Syncope is defined as a short loss of consciousness and muscle strength, characterized by a fast onset, short duration, and spontaneous recovery.	晕厥是指暂时性意识丧失，肌肉无力，特点是发作迅速，持续时间短，能自然恢复。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001281	Tetany	手足抽搐	A disorder characterized by muscle twitches, cramps, and carpopedal spasm, and when severe, laryngospasm and seizures. This condition is associated with unstable depolarization of axonal membranes, primarily in the peripheral nervous system.	一个疾病的特点是肌肉抽搐，痉挛，及手足痉挛，严重时，出现喉痉挛和癫痫发作。这种病症与轴突膜不稳定去极化相关联，主要在周围神经系统。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001283	Bulbar palsy	球麻痹	Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.	球麻痹（或延髓麻痹）是指后组颅神经（九、十、十一和十二）双侧功能损害。延髓核或束水平的下运动神经元病变或者发自脑干的后组颅神经双侧病变时出现球麻痹。球麻痹往往与咀嚼困难，面部肌肉无力，构音障碍，软腭无力和呛咳，吞咽困难，发音困难相关。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001284	Areflexia	神经反射消失	Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	没有神经反射，如膝腱反应。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001285	Spastic tetraparesis	痉挛性四肢轻瘫	Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs.	痉挛性无力影响到四肢。
神经系统的异常;免疫系统的异常	HP:0001287	Meningitis	脑膜炎	`Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `meninges` (FMA:231572).	`脑膜（FMA:231572）的炎症 (MPATH:212)。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001288	Gait disturbance	步态不稳	The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease.	步态不稳可以用于描述任何形式的行走能力受损。广义上，指因神经系统病变影响行走，但是也可以是骨折或其他原因的疼痛。目前步态不稳指因神经或肌肉病变导致的行走困难。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001289	Confusion	意识模糊	Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.	缺乏明确、连贯的思维、感知、理解或行动。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001290	Generalized hypotonia	广泛低肌张力	Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).	广泛的肌张力减退（异常低肌张力）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001291	Abnormality of the cranial nerves	颅神经异常	Abnormality affecting one or more of the `cranial nerves` (FMA:5865), which emerge directly from the brain stem.	一支或多支颅神经（FMA:5865）的异常，颅神经是直接从脑干发出的神经。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001293	Cranial nerve compression	颅神经受压		
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0001297	Stroke	卒中	Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.	由于大脑动脉闭塞动脉或破裂导致供应部分大脑的血流突然受损。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001298	Encephalopathy	脑病	Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.	脑病是用于描述脑部疾病、损伤或故障的术语。一般情况下，脑病可表现为精神状态改变。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001300	Parkinsonism	帕金森症	Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.	由于中脑黑质产生多巴胺的神经元变性而导致以震颤、强直、行动迟缓和步态异常为特征的神经系统异常
神经系统的异常	HP:0001301	Chronic sensorineural polyneuropathy	慢性多发性感觉神经病		
神经系统的异常	HP:0001302	Pachygyria	巨脑回	A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex.	一种表现为大脑半球皮层脑回异常增厚的一种先天性畸形
神经系统的异常	HP:0001304	Torsion dystonia	扭转性肌张力障碍	Sustained involuntary  muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.	持续不自主的肌肉收缩引起身体的扭曲和重复的动作。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001305	Dandy-Walker malformation	丹迪·沃克畸形	A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman's terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.	先天性脑畸形典型特征是小脑蚓部形成不完整，第四脑室扩张，以及后颅窝扩大。通俗地说，丹迪·沃克畸形是小脑和第四脑室相关的囊肿（通常是对称的）。这可能会干扰到脑脊液从脑流出的能力，导致脑积水。丹迪·沃克囊肿是在早期胚胎发育大脑形成时形成的。小脑的囊肿通常有几条血管贯穿其连接到大脑，因而无法手术切除。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0001308	Tongue fasciculations	舌肌束震颤	Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.	舌肌肌束颤动或震动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001310	Dysmetria	辨距不良	A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the inability to carry out movements with the correct range and motion across the plane of more than one joint related to incorrect estimation of the distances required for targeted movements.	`共济失调`（HP:0001251）的一种，表现为因对完成目标动作需要的距离估计错误，导致不能在正确的范围内执行运动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001311	Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology	神经系统电生理检查异常	An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles.	神经细胞之间或神经细胞与肌肉之间联系的电信号异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001312	Giant somatosensory evoked potentials	巨大的体感诱发电位	An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.	一种异常增大的（如波幅增高）体感诱发电位。

神经系统的异常	HP:0001327	Photomyoclonic seizures	光肌阵挛		
神经系统的异常	HP:0001328	Specific learning disability	特定的学习障碍	Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.	某些技能，如阅读或写作、协调、自我控制、或注意力受损，影响学习能力。该损害是全面性智力障碍无关。

神经系统的异常	HP:0001332	Dystonia	肌张力障碍	An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.	肌张力异常增加导致固定的异常姿势。因为缓慢和间歇的扭转运动导致四肢和躯干的夸张旋转和姿势。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001334	Communicating hydrocephalus	交通性脑积水	A form of `hydrocephalus` (HP:0000238) in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space.	一种脑积水（HP:0000238）类型，在脑室和蛛网膜下腔之间的脑脊液流动中没有可见的梗阻。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001335	Bimanual synkinesia	双手联带运动	Mirror hand movements.	镜像手部协同运动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001336	Myoclonus	肌阵挛	Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.	很简短，随意不自主的肌肉收缩发生在休息，以应对感官刺激，或陪同随意运动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0001337	Tremor	震颤	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement.	一种无意的，振荡的肌肉往复运动。

神经系统的异常	HP:0001340	Enhancement of the C-reflex	C-反射增强	Increase in amplitude of a long-loop response upon somatosensory evoked potential testing, representing an electrically evoked myoclonic response.	体感诱发电位长环路反应的波幅增高，代表一种电诱发的肌阵挛反应。

神经系统的异常	HP:0001343	Kernicterus	核黄疸	Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.	间接胆红素水平极度升高导致的婴儿大脑核团损害。死于核黄疸的婴儿组织学上显示基底节和脑干黄染，也就是说，核黄疸严格来说是一个病理诊断。婴儿存在核黄疸意味着特征性急性或慢性胆红素引起的神经功能障碍。

头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001362	Skull defect	颅骨缺损	A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.	由胚胎期发育异常所导致的颅骨部分缺损。缺损的部位覆盖正常的皮肤。在某些病例，头颅的X射线表明潜在的溶骨性病变在一岁之前已停止。
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001363	Craniosynostosis	颅缝早闭	Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.	颅缝早闭指颅缝的过早闭合。原发性颅缝早闭指由于头骨发育异常而导致的一个或多个颅骨缝合线闭合过早，而继发性颅缝早闭指由于大脑发育失败导致的结果。

结缔组织的异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001371	Flexion contracture	屈曲挛缩	A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.	屈曲挛缩是弯曲（弯曲）的联合，不能主动或被动拉直。它因此是关节运动的慢性损失，由于肌肉的结构变化，肌腱，韧带，或皮肤，防止关节的正常运动。

遗传模式	HP:0001417	X-linked inheritance	X连锁遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.	
遗传模式	HP:0001419	X-linked recessive inheritance	X连锁隐性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.	
四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0001421	Abnormality of the musculature of the hand	手部肌肉异常		
遗传模式	HP:0001423	X-linked dominant inheritance	X连锁显性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.	
遗传模式	HP:0001425	Heterogeneous	异质性的	#####	
遗传模式	HP:0001426	Multifactorial inheritance	多因子遗传	A mode of inheritance that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants possibly together with environmental factors. Diseases inherited in this manner are termed complex diseases.	
遗传模式	HP:0001427	Mitochondrial inheritance	线粒体遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).	
遗传模式	HP:0001428	Somatic mutation	体细胞突变	#####

生长异常	HP:0001507	Growth abnormality	生长异常		
生长异常	HP:0001508	Failure to thrive	未能茁壮成长	Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.	未能茁壮成长（FTT）是指孩子的身体生长明显低于正常。
生长异常	HP:0001510	Growth delay	生长延迟	A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.	长前和出生后生长缓慢或缺乏。
生长异常	HP:0001511	Intrauterine growth retardation	胎儿宫内发育迟缓	An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.	胎儿生长异常受限，胎儿体重低于该孕龄体重第十百分位以下。
生长异常	HP:0001513	Obesity	肥胖	Body weight that is grossly above the acceptable or desirable weight, usually due to accumulation of excess fats in the body. The standards may vary with age, sex, genetic or cultural background. In the body mass index (BMI), a BMI greater than 30.0 kg/m2 is considered obese, and a BMI greater than 40.0 kg/m2 is considered morbidly obese.	体重严重高于可接受或期望重量，通常是由于过量的脂肪在体内蓄积。该标准可能随年龄，性别，遗传或文化背景不同而变化。就身体质量指数（BMI）而言，当BMI大于30.0kg/m2被认为是肥胖，BMI大于40.0kg/m2被认为是病态肥胖。
生长异常	HP:0001518	Small for gestational age	足月小样儿	Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.	体型小于该性别该孕龄相关标准体型，定义为重量位于该孕龄重量第十百分位以下。
生长异常	HP:0001519	Disproportionate tall stature	不成比例的高挑身材	A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.	一个高大苗条的身材，伴随臂展与身高比增加（> 1.05）和上半身与下半身比降低（<0.85），即，超长的胳膊和腿。四肢及手脚都异常苗条。
生长异常	HP:0001520	Large for gestational age	大于胎龄儿	The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.	大于胎龄儿指婴儿出生时体重大于该孕龄体重90百分位以上。

胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001561	Polyhydramnios	羊水过多	The presence of excess amniotic fluid surrounding the fetus during pregnancy, the sonographic diagnosis of Polyhydramnios is usually based on an AFI >25cm or on a single deepest pocket of amnionic fluid >8cm,several groups have termed Polyhydramnios as mild if the AFI is 25 to 29.9cm, moderate if 30 to 34.9cm, and severe if 35 cm or more.	在妊娠期间围绕胎儿的羊水量过多， 超声诊断提示羊水指数大于25cm或羊水暗区大于8cm，其中轻度羊水过多羊水指数为25-29.9cm，中度羊水过多羊水指数为30-34.9cm，严重羊水过多羊水指数大于35cm。
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001562	Oligohydramnios	羊水过少	The insufficient of amniotic fluid surrounding a fetus in pregnancy，the sonographic diagnosis of oligohydramnios is usually based on an AFI <5cm or on a single deepest pocket of amnionic fluid <2cm.	在妊娠期间围绕胎儿的羊水量不足。超声诊断指标是羊水指数小于5cm或羊水暗区小于2cm。

That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, follwed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.	该肋骨有一个广口钟的形状。即，肋笼的上部分被收缩，由一个凸区域follwed，和肋骨的下部分再扩展为具有大的直径。

体壁的异常	HP:0001596	Alopecia	脱发	Loss of hair from the head or body.	头部或躯体毛发的脱失。
体壁的异常	HP:0001597	Abnormality of the nail	指（趾）甲异常	Abnormality of the `nail` (FMA:54326).	指（趾）甲的异常。
体壁的异常	HP:0001598	Concave nail	反甲	The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.	先天纵向（后侧末端）凸拱不存在或反转。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001600	Abnormality of the larynx	喉部异常	An abnormality of the `larynx` (FMA:55097).	喉部（FMA:55097）的异常。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001601	Laryngomalacia	喉软骨软化	Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.	喉软骨软化是一种吸气时软骨松软和塌陷的喉软骨先天发畸形育。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001602	Laryngeal stenosis	喉狭窄	Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.	喉部受限或狭窄，可伴有与喉狭窄程度相关呼吸困难。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001604	Vocal cord paresis	声带麻痹	`Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).	声带运动能力减弱。
神经系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0001605	Vocal cord paralysis	声带麻痹	A loss of the ability to move the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).	声带运动能力丧失（FMA:55457）。
	HP:0001606	Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)	声带麻痹（肿瘤侵犯导致）		
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001607	Subglottic stenosis	声门下狭窄		
声音的异常	HP:0001608	Abnormality of the voice	声音异常	Any abnormality of the voice.	嗓音的任何异常。
声音的异常	HP:0001609	Hoarse voice	声音嘶哑	Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.	声音嘶哑是指声音的音调或质量的变化，声音听起来虚弱，带着很重的呼吸声，有摩擦音或沙哑。
声音的异常	HP:0001611	Nasal speech	鼻音很重	A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech, associated with incomplete or weak closure of the velum.	一种构音特点，讲话时因鼻腔气流异常增加所致，与软腭关闭不全或削弱有关。
声音的异常	HP:0001612	Weak cry	哭声微弱		
	HP:0001613	Hoarse voice (caused by tumor impingement)	声音嘶哑（因肿瘤挤压所致）		
声音的异常	HP:0001615	Hoarse cry	声音嘶哑的叫喊		
声音的异常;神经系统的异常	HP:0001618	Dysphonia	发音困难	An impairment in the ability to produce voice sounds.	产生声音的能力减弱。
声音的异常	HP:0001620	High pitched voice	高音调的声音	An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice.	嗓音音调（频率）的异常升高。
声音的异常	HP:0001621	Weak voice	嗓音微弱	Reduced intensity (volume) of speech.	语音的强度（音量）减弱。
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001622	Premature birth	早产	The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.	是指妊娠满28周至不足37周间分娩者。
胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001623	Breech presentation	臀先露	A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.	胎儿进入产道中的先露部位为臀部或足。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001626	Abnormality of the cardiovascular system	心血管系统异常	Any abnormality of the `cardiovascular system` (FMA:7161).	心血管系统的异常（FMA:7161）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001627	Abnormality of cardiac morphology	心脏形态异常	An abnormality of the `heart` (FMA:7088).	心脏的异常（FMA:7088）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001629	Ventricular septal defect	室间隔缺损	A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.	心脏的两个底部室（心室）之间、围绕室间隔最上方出现孔洞。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001631	Defect in the atrial septum	房间隔缺陷	Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the `interatrial septum` (FMA:7108) that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.	房间隔缺损（ASD）是房间隔的先天性畸形，能够导致左心房和右心房之间的血液流通（FMA:7108）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001633	Abnormality of the mitral valve	二尖瓣异常	An abnormality of the `mitral valve` (FMA:7235).	二尖瓣的异常（FMA:7235）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001634	Mitral valve prolapse	二尖瓣脱垂	One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.	左心房收缩时一个或两个二尖瓣小叶（尖）的向后隆起到左心室。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001635	Congestive heart failure	充血性心力衰竭	The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.	心脏组织或压力的异常升高迫使心脏泵血功能缺陷，导致功能异常。心脏衰竭与在心肌收缩缺陷有关。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001636	Tetralogy of Fallot	法洛四联症	A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.	一个先天性心脏畸形疾病，包括肺动脉狭窄，主动脉骑跨，室间隔缺损，右心室肥厚。 至少存在三四个上述特征时可被诊断为法洛四联症。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001637	Abnormality of the myocardium	心肌异常	An abnormality of the myocardium.	心肌的异常。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001638	Cardiomyopathy	心肌病	A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.	心肌结构和功能异常，在没有冠心病、高血压、心脏瓣膜病以及先天性心脏病的条件下观察到的心肌异常。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001639	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy	肥厚性心肌病	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.	肥厚性心肌病（HCM）是指没有继发因素（高血压，瓣膜疾病）情况下心室壁即发生肥厚的一类疾病。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001640	Cardiomegaly	心脏扩大	`Increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `heart` (FMA:7088).	心脏扩大。（FMA:7088）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001641	Abnormality of the pulmonary valve	肺动脉瓣异常	An abnormality of the `pulmonary valve` (FMA:7246).	肺动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7246）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001642	Pulmonic stenosis	肺动脉瓣狭窄	A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).	在肺动脉瓣（瓣膜狭窄）或略低于肺动脉瓣的部位发生右心室流出道的变窄。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001643	Patent ductus arteriosus	动脉导管未闭	In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.	在子宫内，动脉导管（DA）通过主肺动脉连接到降主动脉从肺离开并朝向胎盘转移心室输出。动脉导管未闭（PDA）在生命的前3天是在健康情况和早产新生儿中是生理上分流的，通常出生后约24小时之内本关闭的，约三个星期后完全关闭。生理上关闭失败是指持久的动脉导管未闭（PDA）。根据左到右分流的程度，动脉导管未闭具有临床后果。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001644	Dilated cardiomyopathy	扩张型心肌病	Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.	扩张型心肌病（DCM）被定义为，不存在其他异常病态（包括高血压、瓣膜病）或者冠心病的条件下，左心室扩张以及左心室功能异常。右心室扩张和功能障碍可能是存在的，但不是诊断的必要条件。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001645	Sudden cardiac death	心脏猝死	The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).	心脏意外地突然停止跳动造成很短时间内发生死亡（一般在发病1小时以内）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001646	Abnormality of the aortic valve	主动脉瓣异常	Any abnormality of the `aortic valve` (FMA:7236).	主动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7236）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001647	Bicuspid aortic valve	二叶主动脉瓣	The presence of an `aortic valve` (FMA:7236) with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).	主动脉瓣只有两个瓣膜，而不是正常的三个。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001648	Cor pulmonale	肺源性心脏病	Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.	肺动脉和右心室慢性高血压引起的右心衰竭。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001649	Tachycardia	心动过速	Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.	心脏运动速率极快，通常在100次每秒以上。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001650	Aortic valve stenosis	主动脉瓣狭窄	The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.	主动脉瓣狭窄或缩小。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001651	Dextrocardia	右位心	The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.	心脏位于胸腔的右边，也就是说，心脏的解剖位置有一个左-右反转（或“镜像”），定位在右侧，而不是左侧的。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001653	Mitral regurgitation	二尖瓣返流	An `abnormality of the mitral valve` (HP:0001633) characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.	一种“二尖瓣异常”（HP:0001633），其特征是心室收缩过程中由于二尖瓣发育不全或无力导致血液通过二尖瓣逆流回漏。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001654	Abnormality of the heart valves	心脏瓣膜异常	An abnormality of a `Cardiac valve` (FMA:7110).	心脏瓣膜的异常（FMA:7110）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001655	Patent foramen ovale	卵圆孔未闭	Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.	婴儿出生后卵圆孔未能闭合，导致左、右心房间存在一潜在的导管。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001657	Prolonged QT interval	QT间期延长	Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).	由心电图（EKG）测量所得的从Q波的起始至T波的时间过长。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001658	Myocardial infarction	心肌梗死	Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.	心脏血液供应的阻塞引起心肌坏死，并常伴有胸痛，气短，心悸气短，焦虑以及独特的心电图结果和血清标志物肌酸激酶MB分数和肌钙蛋白升高。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001659	Aortic regurgitation	主动脉瓣反流	An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.	主动脉瓣的功能不全，导致血液从主动脉反流到左心室。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001660	Truncus arteriosus	动脉干	A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.	起源于心脏的单一动脉干。肺动脉，主动脉和冠状动脉均源于这个单一的主干而不是其他通道。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001662	Bradycardia	心动过缓	A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).	比正常心率慢（成人，少于60次每分钟）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001663	Ventricular fibrillation	室颤	Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.	不产生左心室收缩的情况下左心室肌肉纤维的非控制收缩。心室颤动通常始于室性早搏和快速性室性心动过速造成的不协调短期心室纤颤。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001664	Torsade de pointes	尖端扭转型室性心动过速	A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.	一种室性心动过速，多种形态的QRS波群改变了原有振幅和周期长度，因而在心电图中有围绕基线出现振荡。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001667	Right ventricular hypertrophy	右心室肥大	Enlargement of the right ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is often attributed to pulmonary hypertension and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.	右心室的扩张。经常是由于肺动脉高压而引起心室质量的增加引起，也能导致心血管事件的发病率和死亡率增加。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001669		大动脉转位		一个复杂的先天性心脏缺陷，其中主动脉起自形态学右心室而肺动脉起自形态学左心室。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001670	Asymmetric septal hypertrophy	非对称性中隔肥厚	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.	以肥厚为特征的一种心肌病，主要是室间隔肥厚，干扰了左心室血液排空。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001671	Abnormality of the cardiac septa	心中隔异常	An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.	左心与右心间隔部分的异常，即心房或心室内隔膜的异常。
	HP:0001673	Tachycardia (with pheochromocytoma)	心动过速（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）	Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.	心脏运动速率极快，通常在100次每秒以上（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001674	Complete atrioventricular canal defect	完全性房室通道缺损	A congenital heart defect characteizred by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.	一种先天性的心脏缺陷，房间隔缺损，室间隔缺损，房室瓣异常。
	HP:0001675	Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma	嗜铬细胞瘤相关性心脏节律紊乱	Cardiac arrhythmias associated with pheochromocytoma－caused excessive catecholamine secretion	由嗜铬细胞瘤分泌过量儿茶酚胺所引起的心律失常
	HP:0001676	Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)	心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）	Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)	心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001677	Coronary artery disease	冠状动脉疾病	Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.	冠状动脉壁内粥样斑块的积聚导致冠状动脉直径减小，增加了心肌缺血的风险。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001678	Atrioventricular block	房室传导阻滞	Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.	房室结介导的心房去极化向心室传到的延迟或阻滞。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001679	Abnormality of the aorta	主动脉异常	An abnormality of the `aorta` (FMA:3734).	主动脉的异常（FMA:3734）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001680	Coarctation of aorta	主动脉缩窄	Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.	主动脉段的狭窄或收缩。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001681	Angina pectoris	心绞痛	Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.	用力过度或应激引起的突发性胸痛，与心肌缺血有关。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001682	Subaortic stenosis	主动脉基部狭窄	A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the `left-ventricular outflow tract` (FMA:9473) related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.	血液流经左室流出道时发生梗阻，与 主动脉瓣下狭窄有关。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001683	Ectopia cordis	心脏异位	Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.	在胸腔外或者通过腹壁裂缝的心脏除脏术的先天腹壁畸形。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001684	Secundum atrial septal defect	第二房间隔缺损	A kind of `atrial septum defect` (===[[HP:0001631) arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.	一种`房间隔缺损`（HP:0001631），由卵圆孔扩大，第二房间隔发育不全，或第一房间隔过度吸收引起的。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001685	Myocardial fibrosis	心肌纤维化	Cardiac fibrosis commonly refers to the proliferation of fibroblasts in the cardiac muscle.	心肌纤维化是指心肌组织中成纤维细胞异常增殖形成的纤维化。
声音的异常	HP:0001686	Loss of voice	失声		
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001688	Sinus bradycardia	窦性心动过缓	Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.	心动过缓指的是静息状态下平均窦性心率分钟少于50次。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001691	Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis	肌性主动脉瓣下狭窄	A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow though the left-ventricular outflow tract.	一类室间隔肌肉增厚引起的主动脉瓣下狭窄，这导致血液流经左心室受阻。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001692	Primary atrial arrhythmia	原发性房性心律失常	A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.	一种原发性的心脏电生理传导紊乱。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001693	Cardiac shunt	心脏分流	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.	偏离正常血液循环的心脏血流模式。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001694	Right-to-left shunt	右向左分流	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.	血液在心脏流动的回路异常:从右向左流动。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001695	Cardiac arrest	心脏骤停	Cardiac arrest, also known as cardiopulmonary arrest or circulatory arrest, is a sudden stop in effective blood circulation due to the failure of the heart to contract effectively or at all.	心脏骤停也称为心肺骤停或循环骤停，由心脏收缩功能丧失导致的血液循环的突然停止。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001696	Situs inversus totalis	全内脏反位	A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.	胸腹主要器官的解剖学位置左右反转（或“镜面反射”）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001697	Abnormality of the pericardium	心包异常	An abnormality of the `pericardium` (FMA:9869), i.e., of the  fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.	心包异常是指包绕在心脏和和大血管根部(如主动脉近端，腔静脉，和肺动脉)外的双层囊性结构发生异常。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001698	Pericardial effusion	心包积液	Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.	心包内积累液体。
死亡/衰老	HP:0001699	Sudden death	猝死	Rapid and unexpected death.	
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001700	Myocardial necrosis	心肌坏死	Myocardial cells take place necrosis	心肌坏死
免疫系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0001701	Pericarditis	心包炎	Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).	包裹在心脏周围的囊状物（心包）发生炎症反应。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001702	Abnormality of the tricuspid valve	三尖瓣异常	An abnormality of the `tricuspid valve` (FMA:7234).	右房室瓣即三尖瓣的异常（FMA:7234）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001704	Tricuspid valve prolapse	三尖瓣脱垂	One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.	右心室的收缩时三尖瓣瓣膜的一个或多个瓣叶（尖）的向后凸出进入右心房。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001705	Right ventricular outlet obstruction	右心室流出道梗阻	One feathers of the tetralogy of fallot, right ventricular outlet get narrowing or obstructing in infundibulum, infundibulum, pulmonary valve ring, main pulmonary artery or branch pulmonary artery.	法洛四联症特征之一，右心室流出道狭窄或梗阻可位于漏斗部，肺动脉瓣膜部，肺动脉瓣环，肺动脉主干或肺动脉分支。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001706	Endocardial fibroelastosis	心内膜弹力纤维增生症	A condition characterized by hypertrophy of the wall of the left ventricle and conversion of the endocardium into a thick fibroelastic coat,with the capacity of the ventricle sometimes reduced,but often increased.	一种疾病状态，以左心室壁肥厚，心内膜生长进入厚的弹力纤维组织帽为特征，心室功能有时降低，但通常是增强的。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001707	Abnormality of the right ventricle	右心室异常	An abnormality of the `right ventricle` (FMA:7098) of the heart.	心脏右心室的异常（FMA:7098）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001708	Right ventricular failure	右心衰竭	Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading top pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.	右心室的执行其功能的能力（从肺动脉接收血液和喷射血液进入右心房）减弱，经常导致外周性水肿，腹水和肝肿大。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001709	Third degree atrioventricular block	三度房室传导阻滞	A form of  atrioventricular block  in which atrial impulse propagates to the ventricles.	房室传导阻滞的一种形式，其中心房冲动无法传播到心室。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001710	Conotruncal defect	圆锥动脉干缺损	A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.	先天性心脏流出道畸形。圆锥动脉干畸形被认为是由胚胎心脏流出道畸形造成的，和包括永存动脉干，法洛四联症，主动脉弓中断，大动脉转位以及右心室双出口。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001711	Abnormality of the left ventricle	左心室异常	An abnormality of the `left ventricle` (FMA:7101) of the heart.	心脏左心室的异常（7101 FMA）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001712	Left ventricular hypertrophy	左心室肥大	Enlargement of the left ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is attributed to sustained abnormal pressure or volume loads and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.	由于长期压力或容量负荷异常引起的心脏左心室扩张，是由心室质量增大形成的，是心血管病发病和死亡的一个重要原因。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001713	Abnormality of cardiac ventricle	心室异常	An abnormality of a `cardiac ventricle` (FMA:7100).	心脏心室的异常（FMA:7100）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001714	Ventricular hypertrophy	心室肥厚	Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.	心脏心室肌肉组织扩大、心室壁的宽度增加并失去弹性。心室肥厚在临床上分为左，右心室肥厚。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001716	Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome	午-帕-怀三氏综合征	A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.	由于房室附加通路产生异常冲动,造成心室提前激动的一种心脏传导系统混乱疾病。
心血管系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001717	Coronary artery calcification	冠状动脉钙化	`Calcification` (PATO:0001447), that is, pathological  deposition of calcium salts, affecting  the `coronary arteries` (FMA:3800).	`Calcification`（PATO:0001447），也就是，钙盐病理沉积，影响`冠状动脉arteries`（FMA:3800）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001718	Mitral stenosis	二尖瓣狭窄	Ab abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.	二尖瓣的孔口异常狭窄。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001719	Double outlet right ventricle	右室双出口	Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.	右室双出口（DORV）是一种心室与动脉的异常连接，指两个大血管（主动脉和肺动脉）完全或主要从右心室发出。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001722	High-output congestive heart failure	高输出充血性心脏衰竭	A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.	高的心排血量的一种心力衰竭形式。这可能发生在患有心脏衰竭和甲状腺功能亢进症，贫血，妊娠，动静脉瘘和其他病的病人中。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001723	Restrictive cardiomyopathy	限制性心肌病	Myocardial disease in which the ventricular walls are excessively rigid,impeding ventricular filling; it is marked by abnormal diastolic function but by normal or nearly normal systolic function.	限制性心肌病是一类心室壁过分坚硬，有碍于心室充盈的心肌病，特征性表现为舒张功能异常，而收缩功能却正常或几乎正常。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001724	Aortic dilatation	主动脉扩张	Aorta enlarge to greater than normal size.	主动脉尺寸增加大于正常大小。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0001726	Increased prevalence of valvular disease	瓣膜病发病率增加	Increased prevalence of valvular disease	瓣膜病发病率增加
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001727	Thromboembolic stroke	血栓栓塞性中风	A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.	由于血栓栓塞发生脑血管意外（中风）。
耳朵的异常	HP:0001730	Progressive hearing impairment	渐进性听力损失	A `progressive` (PATO:0001818) form of `hearing impairment` (===HP:0000365===).	一种进行性下降的（PATO:0001818）听力损失（===HP:0000365===）。
消化系统的异常	HP:0001732	Abnormality of the pancreas	胰腺异常	An abnormality of the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).	胰腺的异常。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001733	Pancreatitis	胰腺炎	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) in the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).	存在于胰腺的炎症。
消化系统的异常	HP:0001734	Annular pancreas	环状胰腺	A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.	一种胰腺先天异常，其中胰腺完全（有时候不完全）环绕十二指肠第二段，且偶尔会遮住靠近中部的十二指肠。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001735	Acute pancreatitis	急性胰腺炎	A `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `pancreatitis` (HP:0001733).	一种急性形式的胰腺炎。
消化系统的异常	HP:0001737	Pancreatic cysts	胰腺囊肿	A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.	具有粘膜上皮的胰腺囊肿。
消化系统的异常	HP:0001738	Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency	胰腺外分泌功能不全	Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.	与缺乏消化酶导致消化食物能力降低相关的分泌胰腺功能受损。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0001742	Nasal obstruction	鼻塞	Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.	降低空气通过鼻腔的能力，常常导致用口呼吸。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001743	Abnormality of the spleen	脾脏异常	An abnormality of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).	脾脏的异常。

免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001746	Asplenia	无脾	Absence (aplasia) of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).	脾的缺失（不发育）。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001747	Accessory spleen	副脾	An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.	副脾为一个圆形的、等超声波回声的、均质的以及光滑的结构，被看作是一种正常变异，多数位于脾的内部轮廓，邻近门区或在肾下极周围。无致病相关性。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0001748	Polysplenia	多脾	Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.	多脾是一种先天性疾病，表现为多个小副脾。

四肢异常	HP:0001760	Abnormality of the foot	足部异常	An abnormality of the `skeleton of foot` (FMA:24222).	足的骨骼异常。
四肢异常	HP:0001761	Pes cavus	高弓足	The presence of an unusually high `plantar arch` (FMA:43942). Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight.	一个非常高的`足底arch`的存在（FMA:43942）。也称为脚背高，PES高弓足是指当它承受重量的脚的鞋底的一个明显的镂空表。
四肢异常	HP:0001762	Talipes equinovarus	马蹄内翻足	Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.	马蹄内翻足（也称马蹄内翻足）通常有四个主要构成:前足折反内收、脚跟和足后部反转、踝关节和距下关节马蹄形（伸展受限）和腿向内旋转。
四肢异常	HP:0001763	Pes planus	扁平足	A foot where the `plantar arch` (FMA:43942) is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.	足部其中`跖arch`（FMA:43942）是在与地面或当个人站在地板接触;或者，在患者仰卧，一个脚，其中拱是有一台板由具有类似于从负重预期的压力审查员压紧在脚底的表面接触;或者，拱的高度减小。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001765	Hammertoe	槌状趾	Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.	过伸跖骨，趾骨关节近端指间关节过度屈曲的。
四肢异常	HP:0001769	Broad foot	脚变宽	A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.	足部为其测量宽度高于第95百分位数年龄;或者，这似乎不成比例的宽它的长度足。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001770	Toe syndactyly	脚趾并指畸形	Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are revered to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as "Symphalangism".	脚趾间织带的蹼或融合脚趾，只仅涉及软部件分或包括骨骼结构。如果融合发生在胫-腓轴线，骨性融合物尊被称为“骨”性并趾指畸形如果融合发生在桡尺轴线。脚趾在PROXIMO近 - 远端轴的骨头融合物refered称为“Symphalangism关节粘连”。
结缔组织的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001771	Achilles tendon contracture	跟腱挛缩	A contracture of the `Achilles tendon` (FMA:51061).	在`跟腱tendon`的挛缩（FMA:51061）。

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001773	Short foot	短脚	A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).	一个测量脚长度超过2 SD低于平均值为27新生 - 41周的妊娠，或脚小于第3百分位个人从出生到16岁（目标）。另外，出现不成比例的短脚（主观）。

胎儿发育或出生异常	HP:0001788	Premature rupture of membranes	胎膜早破	Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.	临产前超过1小时以上发生的胎膜破裂。
胎儿发育或出生异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0001789	Hydrops fetalis	胎儿水肿	The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.	两个或以上的胎儿腔隙出现异常液体积聚，包括腹水，胸水，心包积液和皮肤水肿。
胎儿发育或出生异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0001790	Nonimmune hydrops fetalis	非免疫性胎儿水肿	Nonimmune hydrops fetalis is a serious fetal condition in which abnormal fluid accumulates in at least two different compartments ,and in which ciruulating antibodies against red cell antigens are absent in the mother.	非免疫性胎儿水肿是指胎儿出现两处或以上不同部位的体液异常聚积；但母血中没有抗胎儿红细胞抗体

体壁的异常	HP:0001806	Onycholysis	甲分离	Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.	甲板从甲床分离。
体壁的异常	HP:0001807	Ridged nail	甲纵嵴	Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.	甲板纵向线性突起。
体壁的异常	HP:0001808	Fragile nails	甲脆性增加	Nails that easily break.	甲容易断裂。
体壁的异常	HP:0001809	Split nail	甲纵裂	A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.	甲板沿纵轴分裂但是沿横轴依然相连。
体壁的异常	HP:0001810	Dystrophic toenail	趾甲营养不良	Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.	趾甲异常包括颜色的改变（甲变色）和甲板部分或完全性毁损。
体壁的异常	HP:0001812	Hyperconvex fingernails	指甲异常凸起	When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.	当检查者竖着看向指尖部位时可以观察到甲表面有纵向凸起。
体壁的异常	HP:0001814	Deep-set nails	嵌甲	Deeply placed nails.	甲长到皮肤里。
体壁的异常	HP:0001816	Thin nail	薄甲	Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.	可垂直观察到的甲变薄。
体壁的异常	HP:0001817	Absent fingernail	指甲缺损	Absence of a `fingernail`(FMA:54327).	指甲的缺损。
体壁的异常	HP:0001818	Paronychia	甲沟炎	The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).	甲沟炎发生在甲侧缘或基底部，由常见易感细菌或真菌感染引起，感染可急性发生（急性甲沟炎）或慢性发展（慢性甲沟炎）。
体壁的异常	HP:0001820	Leukonychia	白甲	White discoloration  of the `nails` (FMA:54326).	甲褪色呈白色。
体壁的异常	HP:0001821	Broad nail	宽甲	Increased width of nail.	甲的宽度增加。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001822	Hallux valgus	拇趾外翻	Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).	拇趾的横向偏差（即，在小趾方向）。
生长异常	HP:0001824	Weight loss	体重减轻	Reduction inexisting body weight.	减少体重减少。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0001827	Genital tract atresia	生殖道闭锁	Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.	生殖道的先天性闭塞。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001829	Foot polydactyly	足多趾	A kind of `polydactyly` (HP:0010442) characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.	有种'polydactyly`（HP:0010442），特点是编外脚趾或脚趾的存在。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001830	Postaxial foot polydactyly	轴后趾足	Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.	脚指畸形最常见的是指六个脚趾一只脚的存在。 Postaxial多趾影响横向线和复制的范围可以从一个良好的关节位，以一个基本的数字。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001831	Short toe	短指（趾）畸形	A `toe` (FMA:25046) that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.	一个`toe`（FMA:25046）相比，足部出现不成比例的短。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001832	Abnormality of the metatarsal bones	跖骨异常	Abnormalities of the `metatarsal bones` (FMA:24492) (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).	跖骨的异常，跖骨是位于足后部和足中部的跗骨和脚趾的趾骨之间的五个管状骨。
四肢异常	HP:0001833	Long foot	脚长	Increased back to front length of the foot.	增加回到脚的前部的长度。
结缔组织的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001836	Camptodactyly of toe	脚趾弯曲	Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.	Camptodactyly是近端指间关节，它通常逐步渐进的无痛屈曲挛缩。这个术语是指一个或多个脚趾camptodactyly。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001837	Broad toe	脚趾变宽	Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.	可见增加宽度的非拇趾位数而不增加的背腹尺寸。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001838	Rocker bottom foot	跷足底部	The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.	的两个突出的脚跟和鞋底的凸形轮廓的存在。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001839	Split foot	脚劈裂	A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.	脚的中间部分（脚趾和跖骨）缺失，给人一种劈裂的外观。其严重程度变化很大，从第三脚趾轻度发育不良、第二或第三脚缺如，以至寡趾或单趾脚。。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001840	Metatarsus adductus	跖骨异常	The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.	跖骨均向内侧偏离（tibially），即，骨骼中的前足部的弯曲的一半或转动在朝向主体。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001841	Preaxial foot polydactyly	轴前趾足	Duplication of all or part of the first ray.	所有复制或第一线的一部分。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001842	Acroosteolysis (feet)	肢端溶骨症（脚）		
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001844	Abnormality of the hallux	拇趾异常	This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.	本术语适用于大脚趾（也称为脚拇趾）的所有异常。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001845	Overlapping toe	趾重叠	Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest.	描述脚位上的相邻数字的背水面休息时脚是在休息。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001847	Long hallux	拇指长	Increased length of the `big toe` (FMA:25047).	在'大toe`的长度增加（FMA:25047）。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001848	Calcaneovalgus deformity	足外翻变形	This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).	这是在其中所述脚定位靠在胫骨中的姿势畸形。鞋跟（跟骨）被向下定位（即，踝向上弯曲），和足跟接通向外（外翻）。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001849	Oligodactyly (feet)	少指（趾）畸形	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.	一个发育缺陷造成比脚趾的正常数量少的存在。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001850	Abnormality of the tarsal bones	跗骨异常	An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.	跗骨的异常，跗骨是足部由七个骨头组成的骨头群，位于胫骨、腓骨和跖骨之间，包括跟骨（脚跟骨）和距骨（脚踝）骨。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001852	Sandal gap	趾指畸形	A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.	第一趾（大脚趾）和第二趾之间的间距很大差距。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001853	Bifid distal phalanx of toe	脚趾末节指骨骨裂

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001857	Short distal phalanx of toe	末节趾骨短小	Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short `distal phalanx of toe` (FMA:75830).	从脚趾末端到最远端指间折痕或远侧指间关节屈曲点，即距离短，toe`的异常短`末节指骨（FMA:75830）。

四肢异常	HP:0001883	Talipes	畸形足	A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.	足和踝部的变形，有不同的亚型:马蹄内翻足、马蹄外翻足、仰趾内翻足和仰趾外翻足。
四肢异常	HP:0001884	Talipes calcaneovalgus	仰趾外翻足	Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.	仰趾外翻足是一种柔软的足畸形（相对于僵硬的先天性垂直型距骨变形足），可以任一形式出现，位置性的或结构性的足变形，取决于其严重性和/或病因。 仰趾外翻足变形的轴线是在胫距关节，足的位置处于极端过伸状态。脚呈现“向上向外”的外观，足背几乎接触到踝关节和小腿的前部。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0001885	Short 2nd toe	第2趾短	Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the `second toe` (FMA:25048).	在'第二toe`不发达（发育不全）（FMA:25048）。

免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001890	Autoimmune hemolytic anemia	自身免疫性溶血性贫血	An autoimmune form of `hemolytic anemia` (HP:0001878).	一种与自身免疫有关的溶血性贫血（HP:0001878）。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001892	Abnormal bleeding	出血异常	An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects.	异常出血，通常称为出血易感性体质。出血体质可能与血管、血小板和凝血功能障碍相关。
