血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001897	Normocytic anemia	正常红细胞性贫血	A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal.	一种贫血，其中红血细胞的体积是正常的。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001898	Increased red blood cell mass	红细胞增多症	The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.	循环中的的红血细胞量增加。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001899	Increased hematocrit	红细胞压积增高	An increase in the volume of packed erythrocytes in a blood specimen.	在血液检测样本中红细胞累积体积增加。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001900	Increased hemoglobin	血红蛋白浓度增加		
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001901	Polycythemia	红细胞增多症	Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.	红细胞增多症的诊断原则是红细胞计数、血红蛋白水平和红细胞体积都超过正常值的上限。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001902	Giant platelets	巨血小板	Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).	巨血小板大于7微米，并且通常为10至20微米。当血小板比该领域的平均红细胞的大小大时称为巨血小板。 （来自美国病理学院，血液学手册，1998年描述改编）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001903	Anemia	贫血	A reduction in `erythrocytes` (CL:0000232) volume or hemoglobin concentration.	红细胞（CL :0000232）体积或血红蛋白浓度的减少。
免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001904	Autoimmune neutropenia	自身免疫性中性粒细胞减少	Autoimmune-induced `neutropenia` (HP:0001875).	自体免疫诱导的中性粒细胞减少（HP:0001875）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001905	Congenital thrombocytopenia	先天性血小板减少	Thrombocytopenia with congenital onset.	先天性发病的血小板减少症。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001907	Thromboembolism	血栓栓塞症	The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.	血管内血栓形成，随后通过血液从原发处移动至体内另一个部位，通常导致远端部位血管闭塞。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001908	Hypoplastic anemia	再生不良性贫血	Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.	贫血伴有不同程度的红细胞发育不全，无白细胞或血小板减少。
肿瘤;免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001909	Leukemia	白血病	A cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an abnormal proliferation of leukocytes.	由于白细胞的异常增殖的引起的发生在血液和骨髓的癌症。
免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001911	Abnormality of granulocytes	粒细胞异常	An abnormality of `granulocytes` (CL:0000094).	粒细胞异常（CL:0000094）。
免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001912	Abnormality of basophils	嗜碱性粒细胞异常	A `basophils` (CL:0000767) abnormality.	嗜碱性粒细胞（CL:0000767）异常。
免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001913	Granulocytopenia	粒细胞减少	An abnormally reduced number of `granulocytes` (CL:0000094) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	在外周血中粒细胞（0000094 CL）的数量异常减少（FMA:9670）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001915	aplastic anemia	再生障碍性贫血	Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.	再生障碍性贫血指全血细胞减少与骨髓增生低下。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0001917	Renal amyloidosis	肾淀粉样病变	A form of `amyloidosis` (HP:0011034) that affects the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	淀粉样病变累及到肾。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001924	Sideroblastic anemia	铁粒幼细胞性贫血	Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).	铁粒幼细胞性贫血是由于铁掺入血红蛋白分子的缺陷。铁粒幼红是有铁质沉淀于细胞质（这可以通过普鲁士蓝染色证明）的红细胞。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001927	Acanthocytosis	棘形红细胞增多症	Acanthocytosis is a type of `poikilocytosis` (HP:0004447) characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shaped resembling many-pointed stars.	棘形红细胞增多症是血细胞形态的多样性（HP:0004447）的一种类型，其特征在细胞表面出现尖峰样突起。该细胞形状不规则类似于五角星。

消化系统的异常	HP:0002031	Abnormality of the esophagus	食管异常	An abnormality of the `esophagus` (FMA:7131).	食管的异常。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002032	Esophageal atresia	食管闭锁	A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.	一种导致食管腔完全闭锁的发育缺陷，食管末端形成一盲袋而非连接于胃。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002033	Poor suck	吸吮无力	An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.	一种吸吮反射不足，导致新生儿难以以母乳喂养。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002034	Abnormality of the rectum	直肠异常	An abnormaltiy of the `rectum` (FMA:14544), the final segment of the large intestine that stores solid waste until it passes through the anus.	直肠，即储存固体废物直至其通过肛门的大肠的最后一段的一种异常。

结缔组织的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002036	Hiatus hernia	裂孔疝	The presence of a `hernia` (MPATH:75) in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the `gastric cardia` (FMA:14561) protrudes through the diaphragmatic `esophageal hiatus` (FMA:58289).	一个疝的存在，其中，胃的上部，即，主要是胃的贲门，通过膈食管裂孔伸出。

肿瘤;消化系统的异常	HP:0002044	Zollinger-Ellison syndrome	Zollinger-Ellison 综合征	A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.	胃泌素分泌肿瘤（通常位于胰腺、十二指肠或腹部淋巴结）分泌胃泌素增多，刺激胃粘膜到最大活性，随之产生胃肠粘膜溃疡。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0002045	Hypothermia	低体温	Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.	体温降低因失败体温调节。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0002046	Heat intolerance	不耐热	The inability to maintain a comfortably body temperature in warm or hot weather.	无法维持一个舒适体温在温或热的天气。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0002047	Malignant hyperthermia	恶性高热	Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C in response to inhalational anesthetics such as halothane or to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine.	恶性高热的特征在于，以39-42℃的快速温度增加响应于吸入麻醉药如氟烷或肌肉松弛剂，如琥珀酰胆碱。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0002049	Proximal renal tubular acidosis	近端肾小管酸中毒	A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a  failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.	一种肾小管酸中毒，其特征是由于近端肾小管上皮细胞重吸收碳酸氢盐障碍，导致尿碳酸氢盐消耗及继发性酸血症。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002059	Cerebral atrophy	脑萎缩	Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.	大脑萎缩（缩小，细胞数量或组织体积减少）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002060	Abnormality of the cerebrum	大脑异常	An abnormality of the `telencephalon` (FMA:62000), which is also known as the cerebrum.	大脑，也被称为`telencephalon`（62000 FMA）的异常。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002061	Lower limb spasticity	下肢痉挛	A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.	特点是随着肌张力增高速度依赖的下肢牵张反射增加、腱反射亢进（高兴奋性）的运动障碍，。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002062	Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract	锥体束的形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the `pyramidal tract` (FMA:72634), whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.	所有锥体束（FMA:72634）的结构异常，其主要成分，皮质脊髓束，是脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。除了皮质脊髓束，锥体系统包括皮质延髓束，皮质中脑束，皮质脑桥束。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002063	Rigidity	强直	Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.	连续持续性不自主的肌肉收缩。当受影响的肌肉被动拉伸，无论肌肉的受牵拉稠度怎样，拮抗的程度保持恒定。此功能有助于区分肌肉痉挛还是强直。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002064	Spastic gait	痉挛步态		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002066	Gait ataxia	步态共济失调	A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking.	`共济失调`(HP:0001251)的一种类型，表现为正常行走时所需的协同运动能力受损。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002067	Bradykinesia	运动迟缓	Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).	运动迟缓的字面意思是缓慢运动，临床上用于表示运动执行缓慢（相对于运动减少，这是用来指运动的起始缓慢）。
神经系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002068	Neuromuscular dysphagia	神经肌肉吞咽困难		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002069	Generalized tonic-clonic seizures	全面性强直-阵挛发作	Generalized tonic-clonic seizures are `generalized seizures` (HP:0002197) with bilateral symmetrical tonic contraction then bilateral clonic contractions of somatic muscles usually associated with autonomic phenomena.	全面性强直-阵挛发作是全面性发作（HP:0002197），躯体肌肉双侧对称性强直收缩，然后阵挛性收缩，通常伴有自主神经症状。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002070	Limb ataxia	肢体共济失调	A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects movements of the extremities.	影响肢体运动的一种共济失调（HP:0001251）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002071	Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function	锥体外系功能障碍	A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).	与基底节病变导致神经状态异常，典型的表现包括运动不能（无法发起动作的启动，或不能迅速和容易地进行随意运动），肌强直（广泛的无节律的肌肉快速持续收缩），舞蹈症（普遍一个强制，快速，干，和不宁性质）的心律失常的动作，手足徐动症（不能维持手指，脚趾，或其他组的肌肉中的固定位置的肌肉），和静坐不能（不能保持不动）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002072	Chorea	舞蹈样运动	Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion.	舞蹈样运动（希腊文“跳舞”），指的是广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动，表现为抽动样，坐立不安。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002073	Progressive cerebellar ataxia	进行性小脑共济失调		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002074	Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment	神经元自体荧光脂褐素增加	Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.	脂褐素，自体荧光脂褐素的专业术语，是积聚在最衰老细胞的蛋白质和脂质混合物，尤其是涉及高脂质转换（例如，肾上腺髓质）或吞噬的其他类型细胞（例如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）。此术语适用于神经元脂褐素（也称为自身荧光脂蛋白）的积聚增加是否超过患者预期的年龄。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002075	Dysdiadochokinesis	轮替运动障碍	A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as rhythmically tapping the fingers on the knee, generally related to a cerebellar lesion.	`共济失调`（HP:0001251）的表现之一，表现为进行快速交替运动的功能受损，比如不能有节奏地用手拍打膝盖，一般为小脑病变所致。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002076	Migraine	偏头痛	Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.	偏头痛是一种慢性神经系统疾病，特点是发作性头痛及相关症状。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002077	Migraine with aura	有先兆偏头痛	A type of `migraine` (HP:0002076) in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.	偏头痛（HP:0002076）的一种类型，先兆的特点为局灶性神经现象，通常进行性的，可伴有或不伴有头痛。先兆的症状可以包括完全可逆的视觉，感觉，和言语症状，但无运动无力。视觉症状可能包括闪光、点、线和/或视觉缺失，和/或单侧感觉症状诸如感觉异常或麻木。至少一个的先兆症状逐渐发展超过5分钟或更长时间，和/或不同的症状连续发生。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002078	Truncal ataxia	躯干性共济失调	A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects the proximal musculature, especially that involved in gait stability.	一种影响近端肌肉的共济失调（HP:0001251），尤其是那些参与步态稳定的肌肉。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002079	Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum	胼胝体发育不良	Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.	胼胝体发育不完全。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002080	Intention tremor	意向性震颤	An oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).	摆动性小脑性共济失调，肢体静止或刚开始随意运动时消失，持续运动和需要更加精准时加重（例如，触摸目标如患者的鼻子或医生的手指） 。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002083	Migraine without aura	无先兆偏头痛	Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.	反复的头痛发作持续4-72小时，符合至少下列两个的标准:1）单侧，2）搏动性，3）中度或重度疼痛，和4）日常体力活动可加重，避免日常活动避免如爬楼梯。头痛发作通常伴有恶心，呕吐，畏光，或畏声。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002084	Encephalocele	脑膨出	A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.	?一种神经管缺陷，其特征为脑的囊样突起，以及颅骨开口处覆盖脑的膜上的囊样突起。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002085	Occipital encephalocele	枕叶脑膨出	A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.	一种发生在颅骨的枕骨区域的脑膨出（即，颅内容物包括脑组织从通常覆盖有皮肤或粘膜的头盖骨上的先天性开口突出去）。枕叶脑膨出表现为枕骨中线肿胀，通常有正常厚度的头皮覆盖。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002086	Abnormality of the respiratory system	呼吸系统异常	An abnormality of the `respiratory system` (FMA:7158), which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.	呼吸系统（FMA:7158）的异常，其中包括呼吸道，肺部和呼吸肌。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002087	Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract	上呼吸道异常	An abnormality of the `upper respiratory tract` (FMA:45661).	`上呼吸道`（FMA:45661）的异常。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002088	Abnormality of the lung	肺部异常	An abnormality of the `lung` (FMA:7195).	肺部（FMA:7195）的异常。

免疫系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0002090	Pneumonia	肺炎	Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.	肺实质任何部分的炎症。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002091	Restrictive lung disease	限制性肺疾病		
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002092	Pulmonary hypertension	肺动脉高压	Pulmonary hypertension is defined as a mean pulmonary artery pressure greater than 25 mm Hg during rest (normal level, 10 mm Hg) or greater than 30 mm Hg during exercise (normal level, 15 mm Hg), as determined with right heart catheterization.	肺动脉高血压被定义为在休息平均肺动脉压大于25毫米汞柱（正常水平，10个毫米汞柱）或在锻炼期间大于30毫米汞柱（正常水平，15个毫米汞柱），由右心脏导管插入术来确定。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002093	Respiratory insufficiency	呼吸功能不全	Failure to adequately provide oxygen to cells of the body and to remove excess carbon dioxide.	未能充分提供氧到机体的细胞和除去过量的二氧化碳。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002094	Dyspnea	呼吸困难	Difficult or labored breathing.	呼吸费力或劳力性呼吸困难。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002097	Emphysema	肺气肿		
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002098	Respiratory distress	呼吸窘迫		
免疫系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0002099	Asthma	哮喘	Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.	哮喘的特征在于，气管支气管树因多种应激因素导致气道狭窄，引起了呼吸困难、咳嗽、喘息。
免疫系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0002100	Recurrent aspiration pneumonia	反复吸入性肺炎	Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.	吸入性肺炎的易感性增加，吸入性肺炎是由于吸入异物导致的肺炎，表现为吸入性肺炎反复发作的病史。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002101	Abnormal lung lobation	肺分叶异常	Defects in the formation of pulmonary lobules.	肺叶形成时的缺陷。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002102	Pleuritis	胸膜炎	Inflammation of the pleura.	胸膜炎症。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002103	Abnormality of the pleura	胸膜异常	An abnormality of the `pulmonary pleura` (FMA:9734), the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.	位于胸膜的异常。胸膜(FMA:9734)是覆盖在肺与内侧胸壁的薄而透明的膜。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002104	Apnea	呼吸暂停	Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.	呼吸肌无运动，并在肺中无气体交换。这个术语指呼吸暂停反复发作，而不是一个单一的事件。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002105	Hemoptysis	咯血	Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.	从喉、气管支气管或肺部咳出血或血丝痰。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002107	Pneumothorax	气胸	Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.	胸腔内气体积聚，导致部分或完全肺萎陷。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002108	Spontaneous pneumothorax	自发性气胸	Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.	气无胸部或肺外伤发生的气胸。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0002110	Bronchiectasis	支气管扩张	Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.	由于局部的和不可逆转的结构破坏，并大气道的扩张，从而导致支气管的持续异常扩张。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002118	Abnormality of the cerebral ventricles	脑室异常	Abnormality of the `cerebral ventricles` (FMA:275917).	在`脑室`的异常（FMA:275917）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002119	Ventriculomegaly	巨脑室	An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.	脑的脑室系统容积增大。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002121	Absence seizures	失神发作	Recurrent absence seizures are `generalized seizures` (HP:0002197) and are characterized by a loss of consciousness, thus, are a form of `dialeptic seizures` (HP:0011146).	复发性失神发作是种全面性癫痫发作（HP:0002197），其特点是意识丧失，因此，是一种`dialeptic seizures`形式（HP:0011146）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002123	Generalized myoclonic seizures	全身性肌阵挛发作	Seizures with sudden, brief (< 100 msec) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal).	癫痫发作，突然、短暂的（<100毫秒）的单块肌肉或肌群不自主地单次或多次不规则收缩（轴性，四肢近端，远端）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002126	Polymicrogyria	多小脑回	A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere characterized by an excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain.	大脑半球的特征在于小脑回（卷积）数量过多的大脑的表面上的先天性异常。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002132	Porencephaly	脑穿通畸形	A disorder of the brain in which a cyst or cavity filled with cerebrospinal fluid develops in the cerebral hemisphere.	大脑中有充满脑脊液的囊性结构或空腔
神经系统的异常	HP:0002133	Status epilepticus	癫痫持续状态	Seizures lasting for more than 30 minutes or longer or multiple seizures repeated frequently without regaining consciousness between seizures.	发作持续时间超过30分钟或更长时间或多次癫痫频繁重复发作，发作之间未恢复知觉。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002136	Broad-based gait	宽基步态	An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.	是一种异常的步态模式，站立和行走时双脚距离很宽。这往往是小脑性共济失调的组成部分。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002143	Abnormality of the spinal cord	脊髓异常	An abnormality of the `spinal cord` (FMA:7647) (myelon).	在`脊髓`的异常（FMA:7647）（myelon）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002144	Tethered cord	脊髓栓系	During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.	在正常的胚胎发育中，脊髓最初占据整个脊柱的长度，但随着脊髓圆锥和椎体的分化、生长，最终位于L1水平的位置。终丝是远侧胚胎脊髓退缩之后形成的一种细长的线状结构并将脊髓附着在尾骨上。如果有一根粗大的绳子样的终丝将脊髓固定在L2水平或以下就会导致脊髓栓系，并且可能会因为脊髓收到的异常张力而导致神经系统体征。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002145	Frontotemporal dementia	额颞叶痴呆	A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight.	额颞叶功能退变引起的痴呆类型，临床表现为个性和行为改变，如脱抑制行为，冷漠和自知力缺乏。

Patients have difficulty chewing, swallowing and demonstrate slurred speech (often initial presentation) as well as abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.	假性球麻痹症状是由于锥体束通路上皮层延髓束受损而出现的一种上运动神经元病变。表现为咀嚼、吞咽困难和表达不清（通常为最初表现）。还有不受控制的强哭强笑等症状

血液和造血组织异常;心血管系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002239	Gastrointestinal hemorrhage	胃肠道出血	`Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) affecting the `gastrointestinal tract` (FMA:71132).	`影响胃肠系统的出血。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002240	Hepatomegaly	肝脏肿大	Abnormally `increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `liver` (FMA:7197).	肝脏尺寸异常增大。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002242	Abnormality of the intestine	肠道异常	An abnormality of the `intestine` (FMA:7199). The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.	肠道的异常。与其密切相关的术语，肠病，被用于指肠道的任何疾病。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002243	Protein-losing enteropathy	蛋白丢失性肠病	Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.	血浆蛋白过量渗漏入消化道内引起的蛋白从消化道异常流失。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002244	Abnormality of the small intestine	小肠异常	An abnormality of the `small intestine` (FMA:7200).	小肠的异常。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002245	Meckel diverticulum	Meckel憩室	Meckel's diverticulum is a congenital diverticulum located in the distal ileum.	Meckel憩室是位于回肠远端的先天性憩室。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002246	Abnormality of the duodenum	十二指肠异常	An abnormality of the duodenum, i.e., the first section of the small intestine.	十二指肠，即小肠的第一部分的异常。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002247	Duodenal atresia	十二指肠闭锁	A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the duodenal lumen, that is, an abnormal closure of the duodenum.	一种导致十二指肠腔完全闭锁的发育缺陷，即，十二指肠的异常闭合。
血液和造血组织异常;心血管系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002248	Hematemesis	吐血	The vomiting of blood.	血的呕吐。
血液和造血组织异常;心血管系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002249	Melena	黑便	The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., sotmach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.	与消化道出血相关的黑色、柏油样粪便的排泄。如果血在结肠停留的时间够长，足以使结肠细菌将其降解而产生黑便。一种降解产物，血红素，浸染粪便使其呈黑色。因此，黑便通常伴随上消化道出血（例如，胃溃疡或十二指肠溃疡），其血液通常在肠道的停留时间较下消化道出血更长。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002250	Abnormality of the large intestine	大肠异常	Any abnormality of the `large intestine` (FMA:7201).	大肠的任何异常。
神经系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002251	Aganglionic megacolon	无神经节性巨结肠	An abnormality resulting from a lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) that results in bowel obstruction with enlargement of the colon.	由于肠道缺乏神经节细胞引起的异常（即肠道的无神经节段），导致肠梗阻伴结肠扩大。
消化系统的异常	HP:0002253	Colonic diverticulosis	结肠憩室	The presence of `multiple` (PATO:0002118) `diverticula` (MPATH:68) of the colon.	结肠存在多个憩室。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0002263	Exaggerated cupid's bow	夸张的丘比特唇弓	More pronounced paramedian peaks and median notch of the Cupid's bow.	丘比特弓（唇弓）的更显著的正中两侧的双峰和正中切口。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002266	Focal clonic seizures	局灶性阵挛性发作		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002267	Exaggerated startle response	过度惊跳反射	An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face.	突然且意外的视觉、听觉或面部周围快速的移动引发的过度地惊跳反射。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002268	Paroxysmal dystonia	阵发性肌张力障碍	A form of dystonia characterized by episodes of dystonia (often hemidystonia or generalized) lasting from minutes to hours. There are no dystonic symptoms between episodes.	肌张力障碍的一种形式特征是肌张力障碍（通常hemidystonia或全身），从几分钟到几个小时持续发作。有发作之间没有肌张力障碍的症状。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002269	Abnormality of neuronal migration	神经细胞迁移异常	An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain.	神经细胞迁移异常，如神经元从他们的起源迁移至其在大脑中的最终位置的过程中的异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002270	Abnormality of the autonomic nervous system	自主神经系统异常	An abnormality of the `autonomic nervous system` (FMA:9905).	`自主神经系统`的异常（FMA:9905）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002271	Autonomic dysregulation	自主神经失调	An abnormality of the regulation of the `autonomic nervous system` (FMA:9905).	`自主神经系统调节异常（FMA:9905）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002273	Tetraparesis	四肢轻瘫	Weakness of all four limbs.	四肢虚弱。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002275	Poor motor coordination	运动不协调		
神经系统的异常;眼睛的异常	HP:0002277	Horner syndrome	霍纳综合征	An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.	异常特征由交感神经系统的损伤而引起，表现为单方面上睑下垂，瞳孔缩小，并经常同侧少汗和结膜下注射。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002280	Enlarged cisterna magna	小脑延髓池扩大	Increase in size of the cisterna magna, one of three principal openings in the subarachnoid space between the arachnoid and pia mater, located between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla oblongata.	位于小脑和延髓背面之间的小脑延髓池大小增加。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002281	Gray matter heterotopias	灰质异位	Gray matter heterotopia is a neurological disorder caused by clumps of grey matter being located in the wrong part of the brain. It is characterized as a type of cortical malformation. The neurons in heterotopia may appear to be normal, except for their mislocation; nuclear studies have shown glucose metabolism equal to that of normally positioned gray matter. The condition causes a variety of symptoms, but usually includes some degree of epilepsy or recurring seizures, and often affects the brain's ability to function on higher levels. Symptoms range from nonexistent to profound, in which case heterotopia can result in severe seizure disorder, loss of motor skills, and mental retardation.	灰质异位是指因灰质团块位于脑内错误的位置导致的神经功能障碍，是皮质畸形的一种。除了位置，异位的神经元可能是正常的；且葡萄糖代谢水平与正常位置的灰质一致。这种情况可以造成的多种不同症状，但通常包含一定程度的癫痫或反复痫性发作，常会影响大脑更高水平的能力。其表现可以无症状，也可以引起严重症状，比如严重的癫痫，运动能力丧失，智力低下。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002282	Heterotopia	异位		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002283	Global brain atrophy	全脑萎缩	Unlocalized atrophy of the brain with decreased total brain matter volume and increased ventricular size.	大脑整体灰质体积减少，而非特定部位萎缩，伴脑池扩大。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002301	Hemiplegia	偏瘫	Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.	一侧上下肢瘫痪（肌肉功能完全丧失），有时累及面部。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002304	Akinesia	运动不能	Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily.	没有发起自主活动或运动并能快速、轻松地执行日常的自主运动的能力。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002305	Athetosis	手足徐动症	Athetosis (from the Greek word for 'changeable' or 'unfixed') refers to an inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, tongue, or any other group of muscles in a fixed position. Instead, posture is interrupted by slow, purposeless involuntary movements.	手足徐动症（来自希腊字为'可变“或”不固定“）是指无法维持手指、脚趾、舌头或任何其他组的肌肉在固定位置。相反，姿势被缓慢、无目的的不自主运动中断。
神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常	HP:0002307	Drooling	流涎	Habitual flow of saliva out of the mouth.	从嘴里习惯性地流出口水。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002308	Arnold-Chiari malformation	小脑扁桃体下疝畸形	Arnold-Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.	Arnold-Chiari 畸形包括小脑扁桃体向下移位，并且延髓通过枕骨大孔，有时会由于阻塞脑脊液外流造成脑积水。

耳朵的异常	HP:0002321	Vertigo	眩晕	An abnormal sensation of spinning while the body is actually stationary.	身体实际上静止不动却自觉旋转的异常感觉。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002322	Resting tremor	静止性震颤	A resting tremor occurs when muscles are at rest and becomes less noticeable or disappears when the affected muscles are moved. Resting tremors are often slow and coarse.	静止性震颤发生在肌肉静息时，当受累肌肉活动时变得很轻或消失，是缓慢的粗大的震颤。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002346	Head tremor	头部震颤	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting head movement.	无意识的，影响头部运动的反复的肌肉振荡运动。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002352	Leukoencephalopathy	白质脑病	This term describes abnormality of the white matter of the cerebrum resulting from damage to the myelin sheaths of nerve cells.	该术语描述源于神经细胞的髓鞘损害所致的大脑白质异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002353	EEG abnormality	脑电图异常	Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain's spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.	通过头皮电极记录大脑的自发电活动的脑电图（EEG）观察到的异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002354	Memory impairment	记忆障碍	An impairment of memory as manifested by a reduced ability to remember things such as dates and names, and increased forgetfulness.	记忆障碍，表现为记住事情的能力下降和遗忘增加，如日期、名称。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002355	Difficulty walking	行走困难	Reduced ability to walk (ambulate).	行走（走动）能力下降。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002356	Writer's cramp	书写痉挛	A focal dystonia of the fingers, hand, and/or forearm that appears when the affected person attempts to do a task that requires fine motor movements such as writing or playing a musical instrument.	手指，手和/或前臂的局灶性肌张力障碍，在受影响的人试图完成需要精细动作的任务时出现，如书写或玩乐器的任务出。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002357	Dysphasia	语言障碍

神经系统的异常	HP:0002360	Sleep disturbance	睡眠障碍	An abnormality of sleep including such phenomena as 1) insomnia/hypersomnia, 2) non-restorative sleep, 3) sleep schedule disorder, 4) excessive daytime somnolence, 5) sleep apnea, and 6) restlessness.	是一种睡眠异常包括以下现象:1）失眠/睡眠过度，2）非恢复性睡眠，3）睡眠节律紊乱，4）白天过度嗜睡，5）睡眠呼吸暂停，和6）躁动。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002373	Febrile seizures	高热惊厥	Febrile seizures are convulsions induced by a fever in infants or small children and are generally characterized by loss of consciousness and tonic-clonic movements. Most febrile seizures last a minute or two.	指婴儿或幼儿发热导致的抽搐，通常表现为意识丧失和强直-阵挛发作。大多数热性惊厥持续一到两分钟。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002374	Diminished movement	运动减少		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002375	Hypokinesia	少动	Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.	异常的运动减少。与瘫痪相比，运动迟缓并不是缺乏运动的力量，而是运动的贫乏。典型的习惯性动作（如交叉双臂，盘腿）的频率减低。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002376	Developmental regression	发育倒退	Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.	丧失发育能力，表现为缺少里程碑性的发育标志。
	HP:0002377	Paraganglioma-related cranial nerve palsy	副神经节瘤相关的颅神经麻痹	A cranial nerve palsy associated with a paraganglioma of the head or neck.	与头部或颈部的副神经节瘤相关的颅神经麻痹。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002378	Hand tremor	手部震颤		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002380	Fasciculations	肌束震颤	Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.	指在皮肤下观察到的细微、局部及不自主地肌肉收缩（抽搐），是由于轴索的兴奋性增高导致的（通常是运动神经元病的表现）。这导致了轴索支配的所有肌肉纤维独立于其他运动单位的自发性放电。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002381	Aphasia	失语症		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002383	Encephalitis	脑炎		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002384	Focal seizures with impairment of consciousness or awareness	局灶性发作伴有意识障碍	A `partial seizure` (HP:0007359) characterized by impairment or loss of consciousness.	表现为意识障碍或意识丧失的部分性发作（HP:0007359）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002385	Paraparesis	下肢轻瘫	Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.	双下肢力弱或部分瘫痪
神经系统的异常	HP:0002389	Cavum septum pellucidum	第五脑室	If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.	如果透明隔的两个薄层未融合在一起，那么就会出现的一个充满液体的空间或空腔。透明隔间腔在出生时存在，但通常3-6个月时消失。它宽约1cm，壁是平行的。它是一个封闭的空间，不属于脑室系统的一部分，不与蛛网膜下腔相连。
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0002390	Spinal arteriovenous malformation	脊髓动静脉畸形		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002392	EEG with polyspike wave complexes	脑电图，伴多棘慢复合波	The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG.	脑电图示重复的棘波之后紧随慢波。
	HP:0002394	Walking on tiptoes	用脚尖行走		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002395	Lower limb hyperreflexia	下肢腱反射亢进

神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0002401	Stroke-like episodes	卒中样发作		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002403	Positive Romberg sign	闭目难立征阳性	The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.	病人站立时并脚来保持平衡，然后被要求闭上眼睛。如果闭眼后失去平衡曾考虑为Romberg征阳性，可能存在本体感觉的异常。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002404	Thickened superior cerebellar peduncle	小脑上脚增厚	Increased width of the `superior cerebellar peduncle` (FMA:72495).	小脑上脚（FMA:72495）的宽度增加。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002406	Limb dysmetria	肢体辨距不良	A type of `dysmetria` (HP:0001310) involving the limbs.	累及肢体的一种辨距不良（HP:0001310）。
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0002408	Cerebral arteriovenous malformation	脑动静脉畸形		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002410	Aqueductal stenosis	中脑导水管狭窄	Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.	脑导水管狭窄（也被称为脑导管，aqueductus mesencephali，或西尔维于导水管），导水管连接间脑的第三脑室到第四脑室，位于脑桥和小脑之间。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002411	Myokymia	肌纤维颤搐	Successive and rapid contractions of motor units associated with chronic nerve injury. The discharges arise from the peripheral aspects of regenerating nerves, and clinically impart a nearly continuous undulation of the body surface overlying the muscle.	慢性神经损伤相关的运动单位的连续，快速收缩。放电产生于再生神经的周边方面和临床上赋予身体表面覆盖在该肌肉的几乎连续的起伏
神经系统的异常	HP:0002414	Spina bifida	脊柱裂	Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.	胚胎神经管不完全闭合，因此一些椎弓仍然未融合和开放。在最轻的形式是隐性脊柱裂，其次为脑脊髓膜膨出和脑脊髓脊膜膨出。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002415	Leukodystrophy	脑白质营养不良	Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes.	脑白质营养不良是指源于中枢神经系统髓鞘变性的脑白质退变。它们的基本缺陷与髓鞘膜的合成和维持直接相关。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002416	Subependymal cysts	室管膜下囊肿		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002418	Abnormality of midbrain morphology	中脑形态异常	An abnormality of the `midbrain` (FMA:61993), which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.	中脑（61993 FMA）的形态异常，其组成部分包括中脑顶盖，大脑脚，中脑被盖和中脑导水管。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002419	Molar tooth sign on MRI	磁共振磨牙征	An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.	在轴位磁共振成像的中脑异常表现，细长的小脑上脚使中脑呈现磨牙或智齿的外观。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002421	Poor head control	头部控制能力弱	Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting.	站或坐时很难保持头的正确位置。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002425	Anarthria	构音障碍	A defect in the motor ability that enables speech.	在运动能力的缺陷导致的不能发音。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002427	Motor aphasia	运动性失语	Impairment of expressive language  and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.	语言表达能力障碍，和语言理解能力相对保留。也就是说，病人可以理解语言（语音，文字），但不能表达。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002435	Meningocele	脑脊膜膨出	Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the vertebral column.	通过脊柱缺口脑膜膨出。

神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0002444	Hypothalamic hamartoma	下丘脑错构瘤	The presence of a `hamartoma` of the `hypothalamus` (FMA:62008).	下丘脑存在错构瘤（FMA:62008）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002445	Tetraplegia	四肢瘫	Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.	相关的脊髓损伤水平以下的所有四肢、躯干的麻痹。四肢瘫的病因是类似于截瘫的不同之处在于病变是在颈脊髓而不是在脊髓的胸腰椎段。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002446	Astrocytosis	星形胶质细胞增殖	Proliferation of `astrocytes` (CL:0000127) in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.	中枢神经系统病变区域的`星形胶质细胞`（CL:0000127）的增殖。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002453	Abnormality of the globus pallidus	苍白球异常	An abnormality of the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835).	在`苍白球`的异常（FMA:61835）。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002454	Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus	苍白球虎眼征	The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity if the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835) that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance.	双侧苍白球、黑质MRI T2加权像对称性低信号，且在`苍白球`(FMA:61835)低信号的前内侧出现斑点状高信号，外观类似老虎眼。

神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002464	Spastic dysarthria	痉挛性构音障碍	A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. 神经系统的异常	HP:0002474	Expressive language delay	语言表达延迟	A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.	延迟获得使用语言进行表达需要、愿望或想法的能力
神经系统的异常	HP:0002475	Myelomeningocele	脊髓脊膜膨出	Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.	通过脊柱缺损处膨出的脊膜和部分脊髓。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002476	Primitive reflexes (palmomental, snout, glabellar)	原始反射（掌颏反射，口鼻部，眉间）

神经系统的异常	HP:0002480	Hepatic encephalopathy	肝性脑病	Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.	肝功能衰竭相关的中枢神经系统功能障碍，临床特点（取决于严重程度）为嗜睡，意识模糊，眼球震颤，去皮层状态，痉挛，双侧巴宾斯基反射阳性。

神经系统的异常	HP:0002487	Hyperkinesis	多动	Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.	运动多动与整个身体肌肉过度的运动。

神经系统的异常;头或颈部的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002491	Spasticity of facial muscles	面肌痉挛	Involuntary twitching of the facial muscles.	面部肌肉的不自主收缩。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002492	Abnormality of the corticospinal tract	皮质脊髓束异常	Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.	皮质脊髓束的异常，其是锥体系统的主要组成部分，是大脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002493	Corticospinal tract dysfunction	皮质脊髓束功能障碍	A functional deficit of the tract that conveys nervous impulses from the motor cortex of the brain to the spinal cord. The corticospinal tract mediates discrete voluntary skilled movements.	从大脑运动皮层传递神经冲动到脊髓束的功能缺损。皮质脊髓束介导不相关联的自主技能运动。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002494	Abnormal rapid eye movement (REM) sleep	快速眼动睡眠异常	Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements.	REM睡眠异常。 REM睡眠阶段的特点是脑电图模式去同步化，心率增快、血压升高，交感神经激活，除了眼睛和中耳肌肉之外的其它肌张力明显消失。其后跟随快速眼球运动阶段。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002495	Impaired vibratory sensation	振动觉障碍	A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.	感知振动的能力下降。临床上，通常使用128Hz的音叉放置于骨性突起，如踝尖或掌指关节。音叉的振动缓慢衰减。振动觉缺失的程度可以通过检查者感知振动长于患者的时间粗略计算。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002497	Spastic ataxia	痉挛性共济失调		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002500	Abnormality of the cerebral white matter	脑白质异常	An abnormality of the `cerebral white matter` (FMA:241998).	在`脑白质`的异常（FMA:241998）。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002501	Spasticity of pharyngeal muscles	喉头痉挛		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002503	Spinocerebellar tract degeneration	脊髓小脑束变性		
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002504	Calcification of the small brain vessels	脑小血管钙化	Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.	大脑内的小血管钙盐沉积。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002505	Progressive inability to walk	逐行无法行走		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002506	Diffuse cerebral atrophy	弥漫性脑萎缩	Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.	大脑弥漫非局灶性萎缩。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002507	Semilobar holoprosencephaly	前脑无裂畸形	A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.	一种前脑无裂畸形的，其左右侧额顶叶融合，半球间纵裂只出现在后头部。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002508	Brainstem dysplasia	脑干发育不良	A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.	大脑的茎样部分（脑干）的结构发育异常，包括中脑、脑桥和延髓，脑干连接大脑半球与颈部脊髓。
神经系统的异常;四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002509	Limb hypertonia	肢体张力亢进		
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0002510	Spastic tetraplegia	痉挛性四肢瘫	Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.	痉挛性瘫痪影响到四肢。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002511	Alzheimer disease	阿尔茨海默病	A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.	一种脑部的退行性疾病，其特点是以隐袭性起病的痴呆。记忆、判断力、注意力和解决问题的能力受损，继之出现严重的失用和全面的认知能力损害。首发症状出现在60岁后，其病理学标记是严重的皮质萎缩和老年斑、神经元纤维缠结、神经毡细丝。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002512	Brain stem compression	脑干受压		
神经系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002514	Cerebral calcification	脑钙化	The presence of `calcium deposition` (MPATH:36) within brain structures.	脑实质中出现钙沉积(MPATH:36)。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002515	Waddling gait	蹒跚步态		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002516	Increased intracranial pressure	颅内压增高	An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.	在颅骨（头骨）、脑组织和脑脊髓液之间的压力增加。
神经系统的异常	HP:0002518	Abnormality of the periventricular white matter	脑室周围白质异常		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002519	Hypnagogic hallucinations	睡前幻觉		
神经系统的异常	HP:0002521	Hypsarrhythmia	高度失律	Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (>200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).	高度失律是发作间歇期异常的高波幅脑波和不规则的棘波背景活动。脑电图（EEG）显示持续的（清醒时），高波幅（> 200赫兹？？），广泛的多形慢波，伴无组织的背景活动和多灶棘波。
神经系统的异常;四肢异常	HP:0002522	Areflexia of lower limbs	下肢反射消失	Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.	无法引起下肢肌腱反射
神经系统的异常	HP:0002524	Cataplexy	猝倒症	A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.	突发、短暂性的双侧肌张力下降，常因情绪诱发。

消化系统的异常	HP:0002570	Steatorrhea	脂肪泻	Greater than normal amounts of fat in the feces. This is a result of malabsorption of lipids in the small intestine and results in frothy foul-smelling fecal matter that floats.	粪便中脂肪含量比正常高。是小肠脂质吸收不良的结果，导致泡沫状、恶臭味的排泄物漂浮。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0002616	Aortic root dilatation	主动脉根部扩张	Aortic root dilation occurs when the aortic root becomes enlarged. It can be caused by many different factors, including age, connective tissue disorders, and high blood pressure.	主动脉根部扩大引起主动脉根部扩张，致病原因包括年龄、结缔组织疾病以及高血压等。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0002621	Atherosclerosis	动脉粥样硬化	A condition characterized by patchy atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques which develop in the walls of medium-sized and large arteries and can lead to arterial stenosis with reduced or blocked blood flow.	大、中型动脉壁形成片状斑块或粥样斑块，导致动脉狭窄，减小或阻断血流。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002622	Dissecting aortic aneurysm	主动脉夹层动脉瘤	Dissecting aortic aneurysm occurs when a tear in the tunica intima of the aorta causes blood to flow between the layers of the wall of the aorta, forcing the layers apart.	主动脉夹层动脉瘤发生在主动脉内膜撕裂，引起血液在主动脉壁内膜层之间流动，迫使内膜层之间分离。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002623	Overriding aorta	主动脉骑跨	An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.	主动脉骑跨是一种先天性心脏缺陷，指主动脉的位置直接跨过室间隔缺损而不是跨过左心室。其结果是主动脉接收一部分来自右心室的血液，导致血液中氧含量降低了。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002624	Venous abnormality	静脉血管异常	An anomaly of vein (FMA:50723).	静脉血管的异常（FMA:50723）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0002625	Deep venous thrombosis	深静脉血栓形成	Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected.	血块在深静脉形成。血块通常阻断血流量，引起肿胀和疼痛。腿部深静脉最常受到影响。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002626	Venous varicosities of celiac and mesenteric vessels	腹腔及肠系膜静脉血管曲张	Elongated and tortuous mesenteric veins, which comprise the inferior mesenteric vein(FMA:15391) and the superior mesenteric vein(FMA:14332).	肠系膜下静脉（FMA:15391）和肠系膜静脉（FMA:14332）的扭曲、伸长。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002627	Right aortic arch with mirror image branching	右位主动脉弓伴镜像分支	The aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus and not the left mainstem bronchus, but does not result in the creation of a vascular ring. The first branch is the left brachiocephalic artery which divides into the left carotid artery and left subclavian artery, the second branch is the right carotid artery, the third branch is the right subclavian artery.	主动脉弓穿过右主支气管而不是左主支气管，但是不导致血管环的产生。第一分支是分成左颈动脉和左锁骨下动脉的左头臂动脉，第二分支是右颈动脉，第三分支是右锁骨下动脉。
心血管系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0002629	Gastrointestinal arteriovenous malformation	胃肠道动静脉畸形

心血管系统的异常	HP:0002631	Ascending aortic aneurysm	升主动脉瘤	A bulging, weakened area in the wall of the ascending thoracic aorta.	升主动脉壁隆起、变薄的部位。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002632	Low-to-normal blood pressure	轻度正常血压	Mild decrease of blood pressure	是指体循环动脉压力稍低于正常的状态。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002633	Vasculitis	血管炎	Inflammation of blood vessel.	血管炎症。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002634	Arteriosclerosis	动脉硬化	Sclerosis (hardening) of the arteries with increased thickness of the wall of arteries as well as increased stiffness and a loss of elasticity.	动脉壁增厚，硬度增加，弹性减小。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002635	Atheromatosis	动脉粥样化病	An atheroma is an accumulation of degenerative material in the tunica intima (inner layer) of artery walls. The accumulated material forms a swelling in the artery wall, which may intrude into the channel of the artery, narrowing it and restricting blood flow.	动脉壁内膜退行性物质的积累,引起动脉壁增厚，也可能入侵动脉通道，缩小通道以及限制血液流动。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002636	Aneurysm of an abdominal artery	腹部动脉瘤	Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in an artery that originates from he abdominal aorta.	源于腹主动脉的动脉壁异常或囊样扩张。
神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0002637	Cerebral ischemia	脑缺血		
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0002638	Superficial thrombophlebitis	浅表性血栓性静脉炎	Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).	浅静脉炎症并导致静脉血栓形成（静脉内血栓形成）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0002639	Budd-Chiari syndrome	Budd-Chiari综合征	Budd–Chiari syndrome is a condition caused by occlusion of the hepatic veins that drain the liver. It presents with the classical triad of abdominal pain, ascites, and liver enlargement.	Budd-Chiari综合征是由肝静脉阻塞引起的疾病，主要症状为腹痛、腹水以及肝脏肿大。

神经系统的异常;肿瘤;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0002666	Pheochromocytoma	嗜铬细胞瘤	Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.	嗜铬细胞瘤（也称为嗜铬肿瘤）生产，储存，并分泌儿茶酚胺。嗜铬细胞瘤，通常从肾上腺髓质发起的，但也可以从在或约交感神经节铬细胞发展。嗜铬细胞瘤的常见症状是高血压，由于儿茶酚胺的释放。

The typical symptoms of osteosarcoma comprise bone pain, fracture, limitation of motion, and tenderness or swelling at the site of the tumor.	一个恶性骨肿瘤在青春期，通常开发，通常会影响长骨包括胫骨，股骨，肱骨及。骨肉瘤的典型症状包括骨痛，骨折，关节活动受限，压痛或肿瘤的部位肿胀。

头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002693	Abnormality of the skull base	颅底异常	An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.	颅底的异常。颅底指形成颅腔的底部从而隔离脑部与其他面部结构。颅底是由五块骨头:筛窦、蝶窦、枕骨、配对的额骨和配对的顶骨构成，并细分为前，中，后颅窝3个区域。石枕裂细分颅中窝为1中央部分和2侧部分。

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0002756	Pathologic fracture	病理性骨折	A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondary to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.	当骨破坏在被削弱继发于另一种疾病过程，如肿瘤，感染和某些遗传骨疾患的区域时，发生病理性骨折。病理性骨折可出现不用程度的创伤造成骨折健康的骨骼需要。

神经系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0002870	Obstructive sleep apnea	阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停	A condition characterized by obstruction of the airway and by pauses in breathing during sleep occurring many times during the night. Obstructive sleep apnea is related to a relaxation of muscle tone (which normally occurs during sleep) leading to partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway with resultant obstruction of the air flow.	夜间睡眠过程中多次出现呼吸道梗阻而导致睡眠中呼吸暂停。阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停与肌肉张力松弛（通常是在睡眠时）导致气道内的软组织部分塌陷，从而引起气道阻塞有关。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002871	Central apnea	中枢性呼吸暂停	Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow.	由于延髓呼吸中枢的抑制而导致的呼吸暂停从，表现为呼吸动力缺失而非气流受阻。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002872	Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress	因疾病、疲劳、紧张而导致的呼吸暂停发作	Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress.	由疾病、疲劳或紧张导致的呼吸暂停反复发作。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0002878	Respiratory failure	呼吸衰竭	A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.	呼吸功能不全的一种严重形式，表现为气体交换不足，使得氧气或二氧化碳的水平不能保持在正常范围内。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0002883	Hyperventilation	过度通气	Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.	过度通气指肺通气速率快于所需要的气体交换率。过度通气可由呼吸频率增加、潮气量增加或两者都有的原因所致，可以引起氧摄取和二氧化碳呼出过量。

消化系统的异常	HP:0002910	Elevated hepatic transaminases	肝脏转氨酶升高	Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.	血清中SGOT和SGPT水平升高。SGOT（血清谷草转氨酶）和SGPT（血清谷丙转氨酶）是主要发现于肝脏和心脏的转氨酶，当肝脏和心脏损伤时被释放到血液中。临床上SGOT和SGPT是肝损伤的主要标志物。

The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.	皮肤由抗体或细胞介导的对特异性抗原的迟发免疫应答。迟发型超敏反应试验是测量活化的T细胞识别特定抗原的一种免疫功能测试，通过注入少量的抗原进入皮肤，48-72小时之后观察注射的区域的变化。

Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.	神经母细胞是一种起源于交感神经系统神经嵴细胞的实质肿瘤。大部分神经母细胞瘤起源于腹腔，而腹腔内的神经母细胞瘤最常见于肾上腺。神经母细胞瘤也可起源于胸，通常在后纵隔。

Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in  the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.	`凝血因子VIII`（PR:000007302）的活性减少。因子VIII（fVIII生物）是内源性凝血系统中的一个辅助因子， 被微量凝血酶活化后成为fVIIIa。 fVIIIa是因子IXa的和X的受体。

神经系统的异常	HP:0003133	Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts	脊髓小脑束异常	An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72642), the anterior spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72642), and the posterior spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72641).	脊髓小脑束的异常。脊髓小脑束是一组轴突纤维源自脊髓并终止于同侧小脑。脊髓小脑束将与肢体和关节位置（本体）有关的信息传递给小脑。它们包含腹侧脊髓小脑束（FMA:72642）、前脊髓小脑束（FMA:72642）、和后脊髓小脑束（FMA:72641）。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0003160	Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin	血清转铁蛋白的等电位聚焦异常	Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.	糖基化转铁蛋白的浓度可作为N联糖基化保真度的标记物在血清中检测。在先天性糖基化缺陷病的传统命名法中，整个聚糖的缺失被命名为I型，一个或多个单糖的缺失被命名为II型。这些术语因历史原因被保留，但应记录新的注释作为对糖基化缺陷的精确注解。

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003200	Ragged-red muscle fibers	粗糙的红色肌纤维	An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red  is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.	肌肉活检可见肌纤维异常。粗糙的红肌纤维可与莫里三色染色不规则和强烈的红色肌膜区域进行可视化，而正常的肌原纤维是绿色的。影响纤维的边缘出现红色粗糙的形态，异常形态的原因是由于肌肉纤维的质膜以下异常线粒体的积累，导致了红色边缘和肌浆斑点的外观。

免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0003203	Negative nitroblue tetrazolium (NBT) reduction test	负四氮唑蓝（NBT）还原试验	In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in `superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity` (GO:0016175) with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.	在NBT法检测中，中性粒细胞使无色NBT化合物变成深蓝色的化合物。如果这个测试是阴性（即没有蓝色产生），那么这表明'超氧化物生成NADPH氧化酶活性缺陷（GO:0016175），提示中性粒细胞不能有效地杀灭吞噬细菌。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0003220	Abnormality of chromosome stability	染色体稳定性异常	A type of chromosomal aberration characterized by an increased susceptibility to chromosomal breakage induced by treatment of cultured lymphocytes with agents such as chemical mutagens, irradiation, and alkylating agents.	染色体畸变的一种类型，其特征为，当使用如化学诱变剂，辐射，和烷基化剂来处理淋巴细胞培养液时诱导产生染色体断裂十，易感性增加。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0003337	Reduced prothrombin consumption	凝血酶原消耗减少	The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.	凝血酶原消耗测试是用来测量内源性凝血酶的形成，通过确定血液凝固完成后残留血清凝血酶原浓度。如果在这个过程中有缺陷，较少的凝血酶原被转化为凝血酶（较少的凝血酶原被消耗）。这个测试可见于多种异常情况，包括因子VIII或IX缺乏，使用循环抗凝剂，血小板减少症。

The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.	在单向细胞培养时，受由植物血凝素（PHA）刺激时，正常外周血淋巴细胞表现为对于同源和异源细胞的细胞毒性，但对自体细胞无效应。这种细胞毒性作用被认为是代表淋巴细胞的免疫能力的。

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003403	EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) to repetitive nerve stimulation	肌电图:复合肌肉动作电位对神经重复刺激的递减反应	A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.	复合肌肉动作电位（CMAP）是肌电图（EMG）的一种类型。 CMAP是指由供给运动神经刺激引起同一部位的若干个肌肉纤维几乎同时的动作电位，被记录为一个多峰累加动作电位。这种异常在检查过程中呈现大于正常的减少幅度。

神经系统的异常	HP:0003463	Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment	神经元外自体荧光脂褐素增加	Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.	脂褐素，自体荧光脂褐素的专业术语，是积聚在最衰老细胞的蛋白质和脂质混合物，尤其是涉及高脂质转换（例如，肾上腺髓质）或吞噬的其他类型细胞（例如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）。此术语适用于神经元外脂褐素（也称为自身荧光脂蛋白）的积聚增加是否超过患者预期的年龄。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0003464	Abnormal cholesterol homeostasis	胆固醇内稳态平衡的失常

神经系统的异常	HP:0003469	Peripheral dysmyelination	外周髓鞘形成障碍	Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths.	有缺陷的结构和髓鞘的作用。
神经系统的异常	HP:0003470	Paralysis	瘫痪	Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.	
神经系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0003472	Hypocalcemic tetany	低钙搐搦	Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.	血液中钙水平异常减低相关的神经肌肉系统过度兴奋，从而导致手足搐搦或广泛痉挛。
神经系统的异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003473	Fatigable weakness	易疲劳性	A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.	肌肉运动后出现的无力感，休息后可以减轻。即肌肉重复运动后力量下降。
神经系统的异常	HP:0003474	Sensory impairment	感觉损害	An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hyesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.	初级感觉的异常是由末梢神经（疼痛，温度，触觉，振动，关节位置）介导的。感觉减退（或hyesthesia）是指在皮肤感觉测试中某一特定感觉类型的减退。
神经系统的异常	HP:0003477	Peripheral axonal neuropathy	轴索性周围神经病	An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.	周围神经轴索正常功能受到破坏为特征的疾病
神经系统的异常	HP:0003481	Segmental peripheral demyelination/remyelination	节段性神经末梢脱髓鞘/髓鞘再生	A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.	节段性的影响周围神经的髓鞘脱失和再生（髓鞘再生）。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003482	EMG: axonal abnormality	肌电图:轴索异常	Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves and fibrillation potentials.	肌电图（EMG）发现轴突性神经病变，神经传导速度正常或略有下降，远端潜伏期正常或稍长时间，但动作电位和感觉电位幅度显著降低。有可能是在肌电图中的自发活动，如增加插入性活动，正锐波和纤颤电位。

神经系统的异常	HP:0003487	Babinski sign	巴彬斯基征	Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.	刺激足底后出现踇趾背屈（有时其余脚趾成扇形分开）的体征。如果查体出现巴彬斯基征，指示皮质脊髓束损害。

Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.	肩，或胸饰，腰带由锁骨和肩胛骨的。肩，腰带的弱点是指缺乏连接到这些骨头的肌肉的力量，那就是，缺乏的肩膀肌肉的力量。

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003555	Muscle fiber splitting	肌纤维分裂	Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.	纤维分裂或分叉是一种表现在人类和大鼠骨骼肌病理的常见现象。纤维分裂表现为完整纤维的纵向对分，而纤维分叉则是起源于坏死纤维再生末端由于肌纤维膜内陷所致。在纤维分叉中，纤维一端保持为单个整体，而另一端则有多个分叉。

However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness, defects in muscle proteins, and the apoptosis of muscle cells.	术语营养不良是指生长异常。然而，肌营养不良是用来描述原发性肌肉疾病具有遗传基础及渐进的过程，其特征为进行性骨骼肌无力，肌蛋白的缺陷，以及肌细胞的凋亡。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0003574	Positive regitine blocking test	酚妥拉明阻断试验阳性	A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.	酚妥拉明阻断试验阳性是指施用酚妥拉明后血压显著降低，提示肾上腺素和去甲肾上腺素在循环系统中水平增多，这种现象也在嗜铬细胞瘤相关的高血压中出现。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0003653	Cellular metachromasia	细胞异染	Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.	异染（也称为异染色）是颜色发生的一种特异性改变，发生在某些苯胺染料与特定的物质结合或在液体中浓缩时。例如，当碱性染料甲苯胺蓝与软骨基质结合时，颜色变成明显的粉红色。在这里特指，异染是指在正常组织中无法观察到颜色的变化，却非常规的用阳离子染料甲苯胺蓝O和阿尔新蓝染色，由于阴离子糖胺多糖糖胺过量所致的颜色改变。

遗传模式	HP:0003743	Genetic anticipation	遗传早现	A mode of inheritance in which the severity of a disorder increases or the age of onset decreases as the disorder is passed from one generation to the next.

神经系统的异常	HP:0003763	Bruxism	磨牙症	Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.	磨牙症的特点是磨牙齿包括紧咬下颌，通常在睡眠过程中出现。
体壁的异常	HP:0003764	Nevus	色素痣	A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.	色素痣是一种错构瘤，一般局限于皮肤且较为稳定。
免疫系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0003765	Psoriasis	牛皮癣	A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).	一种以片状红斑，表面覆有易脱落的银白色鳞屑为特征的皮肤疾病。
神经系统的异常	HP:0003768	Periodic paralysis	周期性麻痹	Episodes of muscle weakness.	肌无力发作。

泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0003774	Stage 5 chronic kidney disease	慢性肾病Ⅴ期	A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.	肾功能严重衰竭，需要透析或肾移植才能，其特征是肾小球滤过率严重降低（小于15毫升/分钟/ 1.73m平方米），还有其他临床表现，包括血清肌酐增加。
体壁的异常	HP:0003777	Pili torti	卷发	Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.	Pili（来自拉丁语pilus，毛发）torti（来自拉丁语tortus，卷曲）是指显微镜下可看到的短的、脆的、卷曲的毛发。

四肢异常;肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003797	Limb-girdle muscle atrophy	肢带肌萎缩	Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.	肌萎缩影响肢带的肌肉。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003798	Nemaline bodies	线状小体	Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.	杆棒状线样体是一种异常小体，常发生于骨骼肌纤维。这种杆棒状结构可通过肌组织活检后病理光镜下或电镜下观察，表现为肌原纤维“Z”形或无规则形（常为肌小节缺乏区域），或发生于肌纤维膜或肌纤维内的大片成簇结构。

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0003805	Rimmed vacuoles	镶边空泡	Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.	肌纤维膜存在异常细胞液泡（膜旁细胞器）。在组织染色与HE染色，镶边空泡是爆米花样有密集蓝色边缘的清亮空泡。液泡形成与细胞质和核内偶尔出现的嗜酸性夹杂物有关。

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004051	Advanced ossification of the hand bones	手部骨骼骨化过早	Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.	手部骨骼骨化在较早的年龄比正常。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004052	Delayed ossification of the hand bones	手骨骨化延迟	Ossification of hand bones is less advanced than would be expected according to age-adjusted norms.	手部骨骼骨化症是不太先进的比将根据年龄调整规范可以预期的。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004053	Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones	手部骨骼成熟不平衡	Pattern of hand-wrist development does not fit the normal sequence of ossification of the individual bones of the hand.	手手腕的发展模式不适合手的各个骨骼骨化的正常顺序。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004054	Sclerosis of hand bone	手骨硬化症	Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.	骨硬化影响手的一个或多个骨骼。
四肢异常	HP:0004057	Mitten deformity	连指手套状并指	Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a "mitten" hand deformity.	融合看出，在营养不良大疱性表皮松解，并导致形成一个“手套”手畸形的手和脚用薄的皮肤（疤痕）膜。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004058	Monodactyly (hands)	单指畸形		
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004059	Radial club hand	桡偏畸形手	Wrist is bent inward toward the thumb because of a congenital defect associated with shortening or absence of the radius.	由于有缩短或缺席半径相关联的先天性缺陷手腕向内弯向拇指。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004060	Trident hand	三叉手	A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.	手指几乎等长，缺陷发生在第一指关节，呈现叉子样形状，第一和第二指以及第三和第四指分离。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004095	Curved fingers	手指弯曲		
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004097	Deviation of finger	手指偏离	Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.	偏离的手指是应使用如果手的一个或多个手指从其正常位置偏离的术语，无论对径向或尺侧。手指的偏差可以由一个或多个受影响的手指的指骨，或由一个或多个指骨的偏差或位移的异常形式引起。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004099	Macrodactyly	巨指	Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit.	显著增加的长度和周长大部分或全部数字的相比，它的对侧数字（如果未受影响），或者相对于所预期的年龄/体型。增加的周长是伴随着与增加的背腹维度的位数的横向尺寸。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004100	Abnormality of the 2nd finger	食指的异常	This term means any abnormal structure or form of the phalangeal bone of the 2nd finger. also known as the index finger.	第二手指（也称食指）的异常结构或形态。
头或颈部的异常	HP:0004112	Midline nasal groove	中线鼻沟	An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.	鼻子上的可延展至鼻尖的异常中线沟槽。

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0004222	Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger	小手指的末节指骨锥形骨骺	A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.	锥形外观手的小指末节指骨骨骺，产生“球在一个插座'的出现。这骨骺位于指骨的近端，通常是几乎持平。在相关的实体'天使形“骨骺是指一种明显的锥形骨骺结合一个pseudoepiphysis在方阵的远端。

结缔组织的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0004299	Hernia of the abdominal wall	腹壁疝	The presence of a hernia in the `abdominal wall` (FMA:259054).	存在于腹壁的疝。
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0004302	Functional motor problems.	功能性运动问题		
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0004303	Abnormality of muscle fibers	肌纤维异常	Any abnormality of the `skeletal muscle cell` (FMA:9727). Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.	“骨骼肌细胞”异常（FMA:9727）。肌纤维被细分为两种类型:I型纤维抗疲劳并富含氧化酶（与肌球蛋白ATP酶反应染色浅），II型纤维收缩快速，易疲劳，并富含糖解酶（染色深）。正常肌肉组织随机分布I型和II型纤维。
神经系统的异常	HP:0004305	Involuntary movements	不自主运动	Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.	肌肉的不自主地收缩，导致四肢，颈部，躯干，或面部不自主运动。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004306	Abnormality of the endocardium	心内膜异常	An abnormality of the `endocardium` (FMA:7280).	心内膜的异常（FMA:7280）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004307	Abnormal anatomic location of the heart	心脏解剖位置异常	Normally,the heart is located in the thoracic cavity medial to the lungs and posterior to the sternum. Abnormal anatomic location of the heart is not located where it should be.	正常情况下，心脏位于胸腔内两肺之间、胸骨后面。如果心脏位置不在此处，则为心脏解剖位置异常。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004308	Ventricular arrhythmia	室性心律失常	Ventricular arrhythmias is a common arrhythmia occur in ventricle, including Ventricular extrasystoles, ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, etc.	室性心律失常指起源于心室的心律紊乱，是常见的心律失常，包括室性早搏(室早)、室性心动过速(室速)、心室颤动(室颤)等。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004309	Ventricular preexcitation	心室预激	An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.	心室过早去极化造成心脏传导通路诸如旁路的异常。

生长异常	HP:0004322	Short stature	身材矮小	A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).	身高低于该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。虽然没有普遍接受的身材矮小的定义，许多 “身材矮小”的定义指身高低于该年龄同性别平均值超过2个标准差（或位于该年龄同性别身高第3百分位以下）。

头或颈部的异常	HP:0004428	Elfin facies	小精灵脸	This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.	本词条此前用于描述如下的特殊脸形: 短而上翘的鼻子，宽嘴，间隔远的双眼，以及饱满的脸颊。因为这个定义并不精确，所以最好精确地描述这些特征。保留本词条是因为它在过去较常用，但在新注释中应避免使用。
免疫系统的异常	HP:0004429	Recurrent viral infections	反复病毒感染	Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.	病毒感染的传染易感性增加，表现为反复发作的病毒感染。

消化系统的异常	HP:0004448	Fulminant hepatic failure	暴发性肝衰竭	Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.	肝功能衰竭是指肝脏无法行使其正常的合成和代谢功能，这将导致凝血病和正常个体的精神状态的改变。若原先肝脏为正常的病人在肝功能衰竭症状发生4周内脑病发作，则为爆发性肝功能衰竭。

This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.	典型的椎体（C3-L5）中存在三骨化中心:椎体一个、两个椎弓各一个。该术语适用于下列情况:在脊椎的发育和成熟过程中存在额外椎体骨化中心。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0004749	Atrial flutter	心房扑动	A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.	一种240~400次/min 心跳的房性心律失常，一定程度的房室传导阻滞。通常，心室率是心房率的一半。心电图显示，心房扑动波呈现锯齿状的心房活动。病理生理学上，心房扑动是心房折返的一种。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004751	Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia	阵发性室性心动过速	Not persistently ventricular tachycardia	非持续性室性心动过速，偶尔发作，可自行终止。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0004754	Permanent atrial fibrillation	永久性房颤	AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.	不能由复律成功终止，持续性发生（超过1年），其中复律无效或未实行复律，被称为永久性房颤。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004755	Supraventricular tachycardia	室上性心动过速	Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.	室上性心动过速（SVT）是一种与原正常心室率比异常增加的心脏速率（超过100次每分钟静止）。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0004756		室性心动过速		室性心动过速是指起源于希氏束分叉处以下的3—5个以上宽大畸形QRS波组成的心动过速，通常心律会超过150/分。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0004758	Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardias	劳力诱导型多形性室性心动过速	Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardias，which is defined as a ventricular rhythm at a rate greater than 100 beats per minute with a continuously varying QRS complex morphology in any recorded electrocardiographic (ECG) lead.	多形性室性心动过速是指在任何心电图记录导联上均显示室性心动过速伴连续变化的QRS波群,节律不规则,频率 100~250次/min。劳力诱导后产生的多形性室性心动过速即劳力诱导型多形性室性心动过速。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0004902	Congenital lactic acidosis	先天性乳酸酸中毒	A form of `lactic acidemia` (HP:0003128) with `congenital onset` (HP:0003577).	一种`先天性发作`（HP:0003577）的`乳酸酸中毒`形式（HP:0003128）。
内分泌系统的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0004904	Maturity-onset diabetes of the young	青少年的成年发病型糖尿病	The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.	青少年的成年发病型糖尿病（MODY）最初是用于描述有空腹高血糖症，而且可以不用胰岛素治疗两年以上的病人，而对这些病人的最初诊断是在年轻的时候做的（低于25岁）。因此，MODY结合了1型糖尿病（年轻的诊断时年龄）和2型糖尿病（比1型糖尿病较少的胰岛素依赖）的特点。术语MODY现在经常用来指一组具有如下特点的单基因疾病，即在年轻时确诊的高血糖症，没有胰岛素依赖或有轻微胰岛素依赖，没有胰岛素抵抗，并且缺乏β细胞自身免疫损伤的证据。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0004905	Vitamin A deficiency	维生素A缺乏症		
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0004906	hypernatremic dehydration	高钠脱水		
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0004909	hypokalemic hypochloremic metabolic alkalosis	低钾低氯代谢性碱中毒		
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0004910	Bicarbonate-wasting renal tubular acidosis	碳酸氢盐消耗性肾小管性酸中毒

心血管系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0005136	Premature calcification of mitral annulus	二尖瓣钙化	Mitral annular calcification (MAC) results from progressive calcium deposition along and beneath the mitral valve annulus . MAC is a common degenerative process involving the fibrous annulus of the mitral valve, and is generally an incidental finding associated with aging. This term applies if MAC occurs at a substantially younger age than usual.	二尖瓣环钙化（MAC）的结果，从沿与二尖瓣环下方渐进钙沉积。 MAC是涉及二尖瓣的纤维环一个共同的退化过程，并且一般与老龄化有关一个偶然的发现。如果MAC地址发生在一个基本上年轻的年龄比平常这个词适用。

It is generated within the ventricle,below the BUNDLE OF HIS.	室性心动过速是指起源于希氏束分叉处以下的频率在150/分以上的心动过速，伴有宽大畸形QRS波组成。不持续的、自发终止的室性心动过速即阵发性室性心动过速。

心血管系统的异常	HP:0005155	Ventricular escape rhythms	室性逸搏心律	When the impulse from sinoatrial node or intra-atrial can not transmitted on time, the lower level of pacemaker atrioventricular transition area, should make atrioventricular transition zone from cardiac to control the ventricular.  If atrioventricular transition zone is also affected by the same reason and do not escape beat, the ventricular pacemaker impulse to control the ventricular, means ventricular escape. Three or more consecutive ventricular escape is ventricular escape arrhythm.	当窦房结或心房内的激动由于某些原因不能按时下传，则下一级的起搏点房室交接区，应发出房室交接区逸搏来控制心室。如果房室交接区也受到与窦房结等相同原因的影响，不能发出逸搏时，则心室起搏点即发出激动来控制心室，形成室性逸搏。连续3个或3个以上的室性逸搏，即构成室性逸搏心律。

消化系统的异常	HP:0005212	Anal mucosal leukoplakia	肛门粘膜白斑	Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.	白斑是粘膜类似物的一种癌前皮肤病变。白斑基本上是一种慢性炎症性肥厚，其中可能会发展为间变及恶性异常角化，并随后推进为侵袭性鳞状细胞癌。缀于肛管的单个或多个微微隆起、不规则的、有边缘的、灰白色角化的白斑在临床上可诊断为原发性肛门白斑。要进行确认须进行组织活检。

IgG production normally begins at the age of two months. A delay in recovery from this physiological hypogammaglobulinemia between the 3rd and the 6th month of life, and of recovery period between 18 and 36 months defines transient newborn hypogammaglobulinemia.	出生时，新生儿携带母源抗体。 IgG的产生通常开始于出生后两个月。此处指暂时性新生儿低丙球蛋白血症常见于从出生后第三和第六个月之间。这种生理低丙球蛋白血症至18至36个月恢复。

头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0005495	Metopic suture patent to nasal root	额头缝开到鼻根	The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.	前额缝合在婴儿期分割成前额骨两半，通常到六岁时融合。缝线从前囟（在头盖骨上位于冠状缝和矢状缝垂直相交的点）到鼻根。本术语适用于颅缝从前囟到鼻根大开。

肿瘤;免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0005506	Chronic myelogenous leukemia	慢性粒细胞白血病	A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.	骨髓增生性疾病，其特点的粒细胞系多度增殖但仍有分化能力。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0005507	Hemoglobin Barts	Barts 血红蛋白	Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues.	正常成人血红蛋白由两个α球蛋白链和两个β球蛋白链构成。Barts血红蛋白是由四个γ球蛋白链形成的四聚体，是地中海贫血的另一种病理形式。该血红蛋白对氧具有非常高的亲和力，导致几乎没有氧气输送到组织。

肿瘤;免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0005550	Chronic lymphatic leukemia	慢性淋巴性白血病	A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.	慢性淋巴细胞/淋巴性/成淋巴母细胞性白血病（CLL），是一种血液肿瘤性疾病。特征是在血液中发现形态成熟但免疫功能失调的淋巴细胞，在骨髓和淋巴器官的增殖和积累。因为没有T细胞淋巴细胞白血病的病例报告，慢性淋巴性白血病是一个B细胞淋巴细胞性白血病。

A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a "metopic suture".	前额缝把婴儿和儿童头骨的额骨平分为两部分。这两半一般到六岁完全融合。持久性前额缝隙被称为“额骨缝”。

Bony fusions are revered to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as "Symphalangism".	织带或融合手指，仅涉及软部件或包括骨结构。骨融合物尊称为“骨”指畸形如果融合发生在桡尺轴线。手指在PROXIMO - 远端轴骨头融合物refered为“Symphalangism”。
