眼睛的异常	HP:0012038	Corneal guttata	角膜点状变性	Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.	角膜Descemet膜的后表面出现的非带状胶原的微滴状堆积。后弹力膜局灶性增厚术语称角膜点状变性。角膜点状变性通过体内和离体显微镜装置很容易地诊断出，因为它的出现使局部内皮细胞缺失，是暗区。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012039	Descemet Membrane Folds	后弹力膜皱褶	Presence of folds in the Descement membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descement membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.	Descement膜是角膜内皮的基底膜， Descement膜褶皱一般是角膜炎症或水肿的表现。
眼睛的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012040	Corneal stromal edema	角膜基质水肿	Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the `stroma of cornea` (FMA:58306).	角膜基质层出现的非正常的液体积聚和肿胀（FMA:58306）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012041	Decreased fertility in males	男性生育能力下降		
免疫系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0012042	Aspirin-induced asthma	阿司匹林诱发的哮喘	A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.	哮喘的一种类型，阿司匹林和其他非类固醇抗炎药（NSAID）抑制了 环氧化酶-1（COX-1）从而加剧了支气管收缩。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012043	Pendular nystagmus	钟摆样眼球震颤	Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.	一个或两个眼睛有节奏的，不由自主的正弦振荡。摆动性眼球震颤的波形可能会发生在任何方向。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012044	Seesaw nystagmus	跷跷板眼球震颤	Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.	跷跷板眼球震颤是一种摆动眼球震颤，其中一半周期表现为一只眼睛的升高和内旋，同时另一只眼睛下降和外展。在另一半周期中，眼运动反转。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012045	Retinal flecks	视网膜斑点	Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.	各种尺寸和构造的多个黄白色病变在视网膜上存在，与血管病变不相关。
神经系统的异常;四肢异常	HP:0012046	Areflexia of upper limbs	上肢反射消失	Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.	上肢腱反射未引出。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012047	Hemeralopia	昼盲	A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.	视觉缺陷的特点是光线明亮的地方视力下降，而夜间视力无影响，昼盲的字面意思白天盲。
神经系统的异常	HP:0012048	Oromandibular dystonia	口下颌肌张力障碍	A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.	一种局限性肌张力障碍，表现为脸，下颌，和/或舌的有力的收缩导致难以打开和关闭嘴部和经常影响咀嚼和讲话。
声音的异常;神经系统的异常	HP:0012049	Laryngeal dystonia	喉肌张力障碍	A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.	一种影响声带的局灶肌张力障碍类型，声带不自主的收缩导致言语中断，影响声音质量，常常导致模式化的反复言语中断。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012050	Anasarca	全身水肿	An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.	由于体液渗出进入细胞外间隙，导致极端性的全身广泛大量的水肿。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012051	Reactive hypoglycemia	反应性低血糖	Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).	Hypoglycermia以下一餐（或更一般地，摄取葡萄糖后）。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012052	Low serum calcitriol (1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol)	低血清骨化三醇（1,25-二羟基胆钙化醇）	A reduced concentration of `calcitriol` (CHEBI:17823) in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.	血液中的:`calcitriol`（17823 CHEBI）浓度降低。骨化三醇也被称为1,25-二羟或1,25-二羟基维生素D3。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012053	Low serum calcifediol (25-hydroxycholecalciferol)	低血清骨化二醇（25-羟基胆钙化醇）	A reduced concentration of `calcidiol` (CHEBI:17933) in the blood. Calcidiol is also known as 25-hydroxycholecalciferol or 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.	血液中的:`calcidiol`（17933 CHEBI）浓度降低。骨化二醇也被称为25-羟基胆钙化醇或25-羟基维生素D3。
眼睛的异常;肿瘤	HP:0012054	Choroidal melanoma	脉络膜黑色素瘤	Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).	脉络膜黑素细胞的恶性肿瘤。脉络膜黑色素瘤经典的外观是一种着色的圆顶形或套环，按钮形状的肿瘤与相应的渗出性视网膜脱离。脉络膜黑色素瘤通常是着色的，但也可以是可变颜料和甚至无黑色素（无色素沉着）。
眼睛的异常;肿瘤	HP:0012055	Ciliary body melanoma	睫状体黑色素瘤	Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.	睫状体黑色素细胞的恶性肿瘤。
肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0012056	Cutaneous melanoma	皮肤黑色素瘤	The presence of a `melanoma` (MPATH:359) of the `skin` (FMA:7163).	皮肤来源的黑色素瘤。
肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0012057	Superficial spreading melanoma	浅表扩散性黑素瘤	A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.	黑素瘤的一种，主要表现为黑棕色深浅不一的不规则扁平状肿物。
肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0012058	Nodular melanoma	结节性黑素瘤	A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color.	黑素瘤的一种，初起为淡黑蓝或淡蓝红色的隆起皮损，一般无其他颜色。
肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0012059	Lentigo maligna melanoma	恶性雀斑样痣黑素瘤	A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.	是黑色素瘤的一种亚型，常发生于日晒后受损的皮肤，开始表现为普通的雀斑（边界清楚的小色素斑 ），之后渐渐发展为较大不规则色素斑。发展成恶性常需20年以上，多数患者以为是皮肤衰老的表现。
肿瘤;体壁的异常	HP:0012060	Acral lentiginous melanoma	肢端雀斑样黑色素瘤	A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixture of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.	一种位于掌跖或甲下（甲下黑色素瘤）的皮肤黑色素瘤。肢端雀斑样黑色素瘤往往初起为一褪色扁平斑点，之后缓慢扩大至直径超过6毫米甚至数厘米，此外，包括棕色、蓝灰色、黑色和红色的混合性色素沉着也是特征之一。皮损起初表面光滑，之后慢慢变得粗糙且不规则，甚至可能出现溃疡和出血。
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012061	Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides	尿液唾液酸化寡聚糖的排泄	Excretion of `oligosaccharides` (CHEBI:50699) conjugated to `sialic acid` (CHEBI:26667) in the urine.	的`oligosaccharides`排泄（CHEBI:50699）共轭`唾液酸acid`（CHEBI:26667）在尿液中。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012075	Personality disorder	人格障碍	An abnormality of mental functioning affecting the personality and behavioural tendencies of an individual and characterized by a rigid and unhealthy pattern of thinking and behavior. The definition of a personal disorder implies that the abnormality is not the result of damage or insult to the brain or from another psychiatric disorder.	影响个体人格和行为异常的精神类疾病，主要表现为思考和行为方式不正常。人格疾病的定义主要为异常的原因不是大脑损害导致的
神经系统的异常	HP:0012076	Borderline personality disorder	边缘性人格障碍	A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions.	主要以冲动行为、不可预测和反复无常的情绪为特征的人格障碍。患者表现为易于情绪爆发并且不能控制行为爆发。
神经系统的异常	HP:0012077	Histrionic personality disorder	表演型人格障碍	A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.	是一种以情感肤浅易变，戏剧化的自我表现，夸张，过度表达情绪，易受暗示，自我中心，任性，不考虑他人，感情易受伤害，持续追求欣赏、兴奋和关注为特点的人格障碍。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012097	Intracranial dermoid cyst	颅内皮样囊肿	A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from the inclusion of ectodermally committed cells at the time of neural tube closure (3rd-5th week of embryogenesis). The capsule of dermoid cysts consists of simple epithelium supported by collagen. In thicker parts, the lining is supplemented with dermis containing hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and apocrine glands.	先天性包涵囊肿，源于神经管闭合时（胚胎发育的第3-5周）外胚层干细胞的封入。皮样囊肿的囊是由胶原支撑的单层上皮细胞组成。在较厚的部分，内壁辅以含有毛囊，皮脂腺，汗腺的真皮。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012113	Abnormality of creatine metabolism	肌酸代谢异常	An anomaly of the concentration or homeostasis of `creatine`  (CHEBI:16919). Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.	`肌酸 `（CHEBI:16919）的浓度或体内平衡的异常。肌酸为具有甲基和脒基的甘氨酸连接到氮上的衍生物。肌酸主要是在肝脏和肾脏自然产生的，为肌肉细胞的主要能量来源。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0012119	Methemoglobinemia	高铁血红蛋白血症	Abnormally increased levels of Methemoglobinemia in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.	在血液异常增高的高铁血红蛋白血症。在这种形式的血红蛋白，含有氧化三价铁（Fe 3），而不是在正常血红蛋白中存在的亚铁形式（Fe 2+）。高铁血红蛋白对氧亲和力低，导致释放氧气到组织的能力降低。

免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0012176	Abnormality of natural killer cells	自然杀伤细胞异常	An anomaly of the `natural killer cell` (CL:0000623), which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors and also regulate immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.	自然杀伤细胞异常（CL:0000623），自然杀伤细胞是一种无需抗原活化直接通过种系编码的活化的淋巴细胞，与其直接接触的免疫反应细胞释放细胞因子从而自发杀死多种靶细胞。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012185	Constrictive median neuropathy	压迫性正中神经病变	Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.	由于正中神经在手腕处穿越腕管时受困损伤。压迫性正中神经病变临床表现特征是手的正中神经分布区出现疼痛，感觉异常和无力。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0012196	Cheyne-Stokes respiration	潮式呼吸	An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.	呼吸运动的一种异常模式，其特点是呼吸越来越深而后逐渐变浅，并可能有间停。患者在1分钟左右的时间内可能有10到20秒低通气或窒息发作，继而出现呼吸深度与频率的增加。这种循环每45秒至3分钟重复1次。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0012257	Absent inner dynein arms	内在动力蛋白臂缺失	Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.	呼吸运动纤毛的外动力蛋白臂通常位于动纤毛的周边微管外，其缺失常通过电子显微镜发现。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0012258	Abnormal axonemal organization of motile cilia	运动纤毛轴丝异常排列	Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.	轴丝结构的异常排列。所谓轴丝指形成运动纤毛内芯的细胞骨架结构，呈现为镶有动力蛋白臂的、典型的9 + 2运动纤毛微管图案。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0012259	Absent inner and outer dynein arms	内、外动力蛋白臂缺如	Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.	呼吸运动纤毛的动力蛋白臂完全缺失，即内、外动力蛋白臂（通常是位于内部和运动纤毛的外周微管外）缺失。这一特点常通过电子显微镜发现。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0012262	Abnormal ciliary motility	纤毛运动障碍	Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.	正常运动纤毛的任何异常运动。评价纤毛运动频率和纤毛摆动模式，需活检获得新鲜运动纤毛，使用要高速电视显微镜在特定培养条件下进行观察。

体壁的异常	HP:0012399	Pressure ulcer	褥疮、压疮	A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips.	溃疡常由长时间受压迫引起，可仅表现为红斑，严重时可形成深达肌肉或骨骼的开放性创面。最常见的发病部位是骶骨、尾骨、脚踝和臀部。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012407	Scissor gait	剪刀步态	A form of gait abnormality characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use.	步态异常的一种形式，以腿，臀部和骨盆肌张力增高和屈曲伴极度收导致双侧膝盖和大腿互相碰撞，或有时甚至互相交叉，形成剪刀样运动。拮抗肌肉（外展肌）由于废用而变得相对无力。

泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012409	Cortical nephrocalcinosis	肾皮质钙化	The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla).	钙盐在肾皮质内沉积（肾包膜和肾髓质之间肾脏的外层部分）。

Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.	一型贫血，原因是红细胞生成受抑制，白细胞或血小板数目正常或少量减少。在骨髓中红细胞几乎不存在， 但白细胞和血小板生成略微或没有减少。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012467	Acute respiratory acidosis	急性呼吸性酸中毒	Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).	突然发作的通气障碍，使呼吸系统移除的二氧化碳少于组织中产生的二氧化碳在，导致二氧化碳（PaCO2的）分压高于正常值范围（超过45毫米汞柱），并伴发血症（pH值小于7.35）。

神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0012481	Cerebral venous angioma	脑静脉血管瘤	A congenital malformation of veins which drain normal brain characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system.	先天性畸形的静脉为正常的脑组织提供静脉引流的特征是“水母头”、多个小静脉伞样汇聚成一个静脉或偶见多发髓静脉实质部分扩张，就像树干或伞柄一样。这种扩张的终末静脉穿透皮层引流至（a）浅表型至皮质静脉或窦，（b）深部型至侧脑室室管膜下静脉，然后进入galen’s静脉系统，（c）至第四脑室，然后到脑桥中脑静脉，或（d）到小脑中央前静脉并进入galen’s静脉系统。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012489	Suprasellar arachnoid cyst	鞍上蛛网膜囊肿	An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards.	一种由Liliequist膜或脚间池内的异常进行性扩大而形成的蛛网膜囊肿，通常由，脑桥前区扩大，导致第三脑室的底板向上移位，垂体柄和视交叉向上和向前移位，乳头体向上和向后移位。

TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.	一个异常降低的数额甲状腺素结合球蛋白（TBG）的血液。 TBG负责执行甲状腺激素甲状腺素（T4）和3,5,3'碘甲状腺原氨酸（T3）在血流中。

神经系统的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0012520	Perivascular spaces	血管周围间隙	Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery.	Virchow-Robin spaces（又称为血管周围间隙）是指小血管从蛛网膜下腔发起时从脑实质穿过时在血管壁周围形成的腔隙。血管周围间隙多为显微镜下的，一般不能通过传统的神经影像学发现。这条术语是指这些腔隙变大可以从神经影像学上观察到（多为核磁共振），多为包含一条动脉的规则的空腔。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012521	Optic nerve aplasia	视神经发育缺陷	Congenital absence of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863).	先天性无视神经（FMA:50863）。
心血管系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0012522	Spider hemangioma	蜘蛛痣	A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released.	毛细血管扩张的一种类型，以针尖样隆起的红点为中心，，周围辐射性分布较多小动脉，形似蜘蛛腿。典型的特征为按压中央动脉导致整个病变区域发白且松开后又迅速恢复。
神经系统的异常	HP:0012523	Oral aversion	口服厌恶	Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing).	儿童拒绝或不情愿被哺乳或者进食，表现为恶心、呕吐、转头远离食物，或口腔或口周任何感觉的触碰（如刷牙或洗脸）。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0012527	Abnormal alpha granule content	α颗粒内容物异常	A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.	血小板α颗粒通常含有凝血因子如纤维蛋白原、von Willebrand因子和生长因子 (如血小板衍生的生长因子)。此处指这些成分的异常。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0012529	Abnormal dense granule content	致密颗粒含量异常	A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.	正常的血小板α颗粒包括三磷酸腺苷（ATP），腺苷二磷酸（ADP），血清素，钙和焦磷酸盐，血小板被激活后分泌这些成分。

神经系统的异常	HP:0012533	Allodynia	痛觉过敏	Pain due to a stimulus that does not normally provoke pain.	由通常情况下不能引发疼痛的刺激导致的疼痛。
神经系统的异常	HP:0012534	Dysesthesia	感觉异常	Abnormal sensations with no apparent physical cause that are painful or unpleasant.	没有明显物理原因而存在异常的疼痛或不愉快的感觉。
神经系统的异常	HP:0012535	Abnormal synaptic transmission	突触传递异常	An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse. This is a four step process, comprising (i) synthesis and storage of neurotransmitters; (ii) neurotransmitter release; (iii) activation of postsynaptic receptors by the neurotransmitter; and (iv) inactivation of the neurotransmitter. Thus, this term is defined as an anomaly of `neurotransmitter metabolic process` (GO:0042133).	从神经元跨突触到目标靶点联络异常。在这个四步骤的过程中包括:（i）合成和储存神经递质; （ⅱ）神经递质释放; （ⅲ）通过神经递质激活突触后受体;和（iv）神经递质的失活。因此，该术语被定义为'神经递质代谢程序process`（GO:0042133）的异常。

The antibody closely related to thrombosis, thrombocytopenia, spontaneous abortion or intrauterine fetal death.	抗心磷脂抗体阳性常见于SLE及其他自身免疫性疾病。该抗体与血栓形成、血小板减少、自然流产或宫内死胎关系密切。

内分泌系统的异常	HP:0012559	Increased T3/T4 ratio	T3/T4升高	A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is higher than normal.	血清三碘甲状腺原氨酸（T3）和甲状腺素（T4）的比值在血液中高于正常值。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0012560	Decreased T3/T4 ratio	T3 / T4比值降低	A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is lower than normal.	血清三碘甲状腺原氨酸（T3）和甲状腺素(T4)的比值?偏低。
心血管系统的异常	HP:0012561	Unicuspid aortic valve	单瓣主动脉瓣	The presence of an `aortic valve` (FMA:7236) with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).	只有一个主动脉瓣，而不是正常的3个。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0012562	Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in hand	手过早外延干骺端融合	Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the hand, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.	在骺板的透明软骨板在干骺端在一个或多个长骨中的手，生长停止在一个比正常年龄早，导致生长停滞和所涉及的骨的缩短。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0012563	Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in foot	足过早外延干骺端融合	Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.	在骺板的透明软骨板在干骺端在一个或多个长骨的脚，生长停止在一个比正常年龄早，导致生长停滞和所涉及的骨的缩短。

头或颈部的异常;代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0012568	Lower eyelid edema	下眼睑浮肿	Edema in the region of the `Lower eyelid` (FMA:54442).	下眼睑区域浮肿

肿瘤	HP:0012570	Synovial sarcoma	滑膜肉瘤	A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities.	一类间质细胞肿瘤表现为上皮细胞分化，多出现在四肢。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012571	Ureter fissus	输尿管分叉	A partial duplication of the ureter such that the duplicated ureters fuse to a single ureter before their insertion into the bladder.	输尿管发生部分节段的重复，进入膀胱前与原输尿管融合为单个输尿管。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012572	Ureter duplex	双重输尿管	A complete duplication of the ureter such that the duplicated ureters with separate insertions into the bladder.	输尿管完全是双份，具有独立通道进入膀胱。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012573	Global proximal tubulopathy	全肾近端肾小管病	A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption with bicarbonate loss and resulting acidosis.	近端肾小管病，特点是重吸收缺陷，导致糖尿、氨基酸尿、肾小管性蛋白尿、肾性低磷血症、尿酸盐肾小管重吸收降低，致碳酸氢盐丢失和酸中毒。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012574	Mesangial proliferation	肾小球系膜增生	Increased numbers of mesangial cells per glomerulus.	每个肾小球的系膜细胞数量增加。

免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012578	Membranous nephropathy	膜性肾病	A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space.	肾小球肾炎的一种，特点是基底膜增厚和上皮下间隙免疫复合物沉积。
免疫系统的异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012579	Minimal change glomerulonephritis	微小病变性肾小球肾炎	The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.	在肾病性蛋白尿病人，光镜下可见微小改变，电子显微镜可见扁平状且融合的足细胞足突。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012580	Calcium phosphate nephrolithiasis	磷酸钙肾结石	The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.	肾脏内存在含钙磷酸盐的结石。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012587	Macroscopic hematuria	肉眼血尿	Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine.	尿液中含有一定量的红细胞时称为血尿，当肉眼就可以看到尿液为红色时，即为肉眼血尿。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012588	Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome	激素耐受性肾病综合征	A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication.	一种肾病综合症，类固醇药物治疗无效。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012593	Nephrotic range proteinuria	肾病蛋白尿范围	Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.	尿液中蛋白质的排泄量重度增加，成人达到3.5克/天或更多，儿童每米平方体表面积40毫克/小时。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012594	Microalbuminuria	微量白蛋白尿	The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine (in adults, 30-150 mg per day).	尿液中白蛋白浓度轻度增加（成人每天30-150毫克）。
代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012595	Mild proteinuria	轻度蛋白尿	Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults).	尿中蛋白质水平轻度增加（成人每天150-500毫克）。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012597	Heavy proteinuria	严重蛋白尿	Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults).	尿液中蛋白质水平大量增加（成人每天正常值为1000-3000毫克）。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012615	Cylindruria	管型尿	The presence of renal casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.	尿中存在管型（在某些疾病状态由肾脏产生的圆柱结构）。

代谢/内稳态异常;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012617	Erythrocyte cylindruria	红细胞管型尿	Presence of erythrocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.	尿中存在红细胞管型（在某些肾脏疾病尿中所见的管形结构）。

泌尿生殖系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0012620	Cloacal abnormality	泄殖腔畸形	A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate.	发育过程中，直肠、阴道和膀胱未能成功发生分离。
泌尿生殖系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0012621	Persistent cloaca	泄殖腔遗存	Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel.	一种发育异常，阴道、膀胱和直肠融合形成公共通道。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012622	Chronic kidney disease	慢性肾病	Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months.	肾脏功能异常持续至少三个月。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012623	Stage 1 chronic kidney disease	慢性肾病Ⅰ期	A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).	一种慢性肾脏疾病，表现为肾小球滤过率（GFR）正常或增加（GFR至少为90毫升/分钟/ 1.73平方米）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012624	Stage 2 chronic kidney disease	慢性肾脏病Ⅱ期	A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2).	一种慢性肾脏疾病，表现为肾小球滤过率轻度减少（GFR为 60-89毫升/分钟/ 1.73m平方米）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012625	Stage 3 chronic kidney disease	慢性肾脏病Ⅲ期	A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2).	一种慢性肾脏疾病，表现为肾小球滤过率中度减少（GFR为 30-59毫升/分钟/ 1.73m平方米）。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012626	Stage 4 chronic kidney disease	慢性肾脏病Ⅳ期	A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2).	一种慢性肾脏疾病，表现为肾小球滤过率重度减少（GFR为 15-29毫升/分钟/ 1.73m平方米）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012627	Pseudoexfoliation	假性剥脱	Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor.	纤维状物质在前房房水中的沉积。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012628	Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens	晶状体悬韧带异常	An anomaly of the `suspensory ligament of lens` (FMA:58838), also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.	晶状体悬韧带的异常（FMA:58838），晶状体悬韧带也被称为睫状小带。这些韧带是连接睫状体和晶状体的纤维，保持晶状体在适当位置。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012629	Phacodonesis	晶体摇动	Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye.	眼睛的晶状体的震颤（颤抖）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012630	Abnormality of the trabecular meshwork	小梁网异常	An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm.	小梁网，是前房周边部的角膜和睫状体间的网眼状结构，小梁网的工作是负责排泄房水进入Schlemm管。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012631	Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork	小梁网色素沉积	Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.	小梁网内发生的异常色素量的沉积。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012632	Abnormal intraocular pressure	眼内压异常	An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.	眼内压是指眼内流体施加的单位面积的力的大小。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012633	Asymmetry of intraocular pressure	眼压不对称	A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.	右和左眼的眼内压不同。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012634	Iris pigment dispersion	虹膜色素播散	Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor.	脱落的色素颗粒进入房水。

眼睛的异常	HP:0012795	Abnormality of the optic disc	视盘异常	A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.	视盘是眼底检查中临床可见的视神经部分，视盘形态异常。
眼睛的异常	HP:0012796	Increased cup-to-disc ratio	杯盘比大	An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefoy may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.	杯盘比升高。视盘具有橙粉色轮缘与浅中心（杯）不包含视神经视网膜组织。在这个比率增加表明健康的神经节细胞数量的减少。

肿瘤;免疫系统的异常;心血管系统的异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0012798	Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis	肺淋巴管肌瘤病	Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated.	平滑肌细胞样细胞在淋巴管以及肺部（胸膜，肺泡隔，支气管，肺血管和淋巴管，以及淋巴结，特别是在后纵隔和腹腔后膜）浸润。局灶性肺气肿可能由于气道狭窄而不断增生，甚至胸导管可能会被擦掉。

临床调节因素	HP:0012823	Clinical modifier	临床调节因素	This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012824	Severity	严重程度	The intensity or degree of a manifestation.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012825	Mild	轻度	Having a relatively minor degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between two and three standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012826	Moderate	中度	Having a medium degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between three and four standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012827	Borderline	临界	Having a minor degree of severity that is considered to be on the boundary between the normal and the abnormal ranges. For quantitative traits, a deviation of that is less than two standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012828	Severe	重度	Having a high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between four and five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012829	Profound	深度	Having an extremely high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of more than five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012830	Position	位置	The anatomical localization of the specified phenotypic abnormality.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012831	Laterality	偏侧性	The localization with respect to the side of the body of the specified phenotypic abnormality.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012832	Bilateral	双侧	Being present on both sides of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012833	Unilateral	单侧	Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012834	Right	右侧	Being located on the right side of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012835	Left	左侧	Being located on the left side of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012836	Spatial pattern	空间模式	The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012837	Generalized	全身性	Affecting all regions without specificity of distribution.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012838	Localized	局限性	Being confined or restricted to a particular location.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012839	Distal	远端	Localized away from the central point of the body.	
临床调节因素	HP:0012840	Proximal	近端	Localized close to the central point of the body.

泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012870	Vanishing testis	睾丸消失	A condition which is considered to be due to the subsequent atrophy and disappearance in fetal life of an initially normal testis. In the presence of spermatic cord structures is evidence of the presence of the testis in early intrauterine life. When associated with a blind-ending spermatic cord, this entity is named as his absence of a testis in an otherwise normal 46XY male is usually unilateral and is assumed to be a consequence of intrauterine or perinatal torsion or infarction.	胎儿期起初睾丸正常而后期萎缩而消失的一种病况。存在精索结构是胎儿早期睾丸存在的证据。当与精索盲端相连时，表明这个46XY男性发生睾丸缺失，他其他方面都正常，睾丸消失一般为单侧，估计是宫内或围产期发生扭转或梗塞的结果。
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0012871	Varicocele	精索静脉曲张	A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.	精索静脉曲张是沿精索发生静脉扩大，导致阴囊内增大、扭曲的静脉，临床表现为睾丸无痛性肿块、阴囊肿胀或阴囊膨出。

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0025021	Abnormal erythrocyte sedimentation rate	红细胞沉降率异常	A deviation from normal range of the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen. A decreased ESR may be seen in polycythemia or in certain blood diseases in which red blood cells have an irregular or smaller shape that causes slower settling.	
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0025022	Decreased erythrocyte sedimentation rate	红细胞沉降率下降	A reduced erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR is a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. A decreased ESR may be seen in polycythemia or in certain blood diseases in which red blood cells have an irregular or smaller shape that causes slower settling.

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0030119	Abnormal muscle fiber calpain-3	肌肉纤维钙蛋白酶-3异常	A deviation from normal in the amount of calpain-3 in muscle tissue. Calpains are intracellular nonlysosomal cysteine proteases modulated by calcium ions. A typical calpain is a heterodimer composed of two distinct subunits, one large (over 80 kDa) and the other small (30 kDa). While only one gene encoding the small subunit has been demonstrated, there are many genes for the large one. CAPN3 is similar to ubiquitous Calpain 1 and 2 (m-calpain and micro-calpain), but contains specific insertion sequences (NS, IS1 and IS2). Calpains cleave target proteins to modify their properties, rather than breaking down the substrates.	
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0030120	Absent muscle fiber calpain-3	肌肉纤维钙蛋白酶-3缺失	Western blot shows complete lack of calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue.

消化系统的异常	HP:0030170	Cystic artery pseudoaneurysm	囊性假性动脉瘤	Presence of a pseudoaneurysm in the artery that supplies the gallbladder and cystic duct with blood. A pseudoaneurysm, also known as a false aneurysm, forms when blood leaks through a breach of the arterial wall but is contained by the adventitia or surrounding perivascular soft tissue.	
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030171	Perirenal hematoma	肾周血肿	A collection of clotted blood surrounding the kidney.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030175	Myelin tomacula	腊肠状髓鞘	The presence of multiple sausage-shaped swellings of the myelin sheath (The Latin tomaculum means sausage).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030176	Asymmetric peripheral demyelination	不对称性周围神经脱髓鞘	Loss of myelin from peripheral nerves in a pattern that differs between right and left.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030179	Abnormal peripheral action potential amplitude	周围神经动作电位振幅异常	An anomaly in the magnitude of the action potential along a peripheral nerve, that is, of the rapid rise and fall of the electrical membrane potential of the nerve.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030180	Oppenheim reflex	奥本海姆反射	Dorsiflexion of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by stroking along the medial side of the tibia (the normal response would be no movement of the big toe).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030181	Gordon reflex	戈登反射	Dorsal extension of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by compressing the calf muscles (a normal response is no movement of the big toe).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030182	Tetraplegia/tetraparesis	四肢瘫痪/四肢轻瘫	Loss of strength in all four limbs. Tetraplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas Tetraparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength.	
耳朵的异常	HP:0030183	Impaired visually enhanced vestibulo-ocular reflex	受损的视觉增强的前庭眼反射	The vestibulo-ocular reflex is responsible for the stabilization of the retinal image during movement. The visual vestibular ocular reflex (VVOR) or visual enhanced VOR, maintains ocular stability during head motion by generating compensatory eye movement opposite to head movement, and is a major component of visual vestibularninteraction. This feature is an impairment of this reflex, manifested as the combined impairment of the three compensatory eye movement reflexes, namely the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR), smooth pursuit (SP) and optokinetic reflex (OKR).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030185	Isometric tremor	等轴性震颤	An isometric tremor occurs with muscle contraction against a rigid stationary object (e.g., when making a fist).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030186	Kinetic tremor	活动性震颤	Tremor that occurs during any voluntary movement. It may include visually or non-visually guided movements. Tremor during target directed movement is called intention tremor.

That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030201	Response to drugs acting on neuromuscular transmission	对作用于神经肌肉传递过程的药物的反应	Specific drugs interfere selectively with the different cellular mechanisms involved in neuromuscular transmission (synthesis, storage, release, action and inactivation of transmitter). The response of a patient to a specific drug can therefore be useful information for the differential diagnosis.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030202	Favorable response of weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors	肌肉无力对于乙酰胆碱酯酶抑制剂的有利反应	Improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030203	Unfavorable response of muscle weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors	肌肉无力对于乙酰胆碱酯酶抑制剂的不利反应	Lack of improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor.	
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0030205	Increased jitter at single fibre EMG	单纤维肌电图时颤抖增加	The variation in the time interval between the two action potentials of the same motor unit is called jitter. This term therefore applies to increased variability in the interval between successive action potentials of the same motor unit, which is measured by electromyography (EMG).	
肌肉组织的异常	HP:0030206	EMG: incremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation	肌电图: 复合肌肉动作电位对于重复神经刺激的反应渐增	A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to an abnormal increase in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.	
呼吸系统异常	HP:0030207	Paradoxical respiration	反常呼吸运动	Breathing movements in which the chest wall moves in on inspiration and out on expiration, in reverse of the normal movements. It may be seen in children with respiratory distress of any cause, which leads to indrawing of the intercostal spaces during inspiration. Patients with chronic airways obstruction also show indrawing of the lower ribs during inspiration, due to the distorted action of a depressed and flattened diaphragm. Crush injuries of the chest, with fractured ribs and sternum, can lead to a severe degree of paradoxical breathing.	
免疫系统的异常	HP:0030208	Acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity	乙酰胆碱受体抗体阳性	The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the acetylcholine receptor.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030222	Visual agnosia	视觉失认症	Difficulty in recognizing objects by visual input in absence of sensorial visual impairment.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030223	Perseveration	持续症现象	Perseveration can be defined as the contextually inappropriate and unintentional repetition of a response or behavioral unit. In other words, the observed repetitiveness does not meet the demands of the situation, is not the product of deliberation, and may even unfold despite counterintention. Perseveration can therefore be differentiated from goal-directed and intentional forms of repetition, such as linguistic redundancies designed to enhance communicative or poetic impact.

肌肉组织的异常	HP:0030230	Central core regions in muscle fibers	肌肉纤维中央轴空区域	The presence of disorganized areas called cores in the center of muscle fibers. There is a typical appearance of the biopsy on light microscopy, where the muscle cells have cores that are devoid of mitochondria and specific enzymes. Cores are typically well demarcated and centrally located, but may occasionally be multiple and of eccentric.

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030271	Reduced erythrocyte 2,3-diphosphoglycerate concentration	红细胞 2，3-二磷酸甘油酸浓度降低	2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) controls the movement of oxygen from red blood cells to tissues. Anemia is usually accompanied by an increased level of 2,3-DPG in order to promote tissue oxygenation. This term refers to an inappropriate low 2,3-DPG concentration in erythrocytes.

肿瘤;呼吸系统异常	HP:0030357	Small cell lung carcinoma	小细胞肺癌	Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) is a type of highly malignant lung cancer that is composed of small ovoid cells. In the past, SCLC was called oat cell carcinoma because the microscopic appearance of the cells was felt to resemble oats. SLCLC usually originates near the bronchi and in many cases may grow and metastasize quickly.

Hyperphalangy of the index finger results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint, resulting in radial deviation of the index finger. Note that this term refers only to this type of hyperphalangy.	存在与其他指骨线性排列的食指附加指骨。附加指骨是由掌指关节额外骨化中心形成的，位于正常食指指骨的桡侧。注意，该词语仅特指这种类型的多指。

免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030376	Abnormal immature B cell count	不成熟 B 细胞计数异常	A deviation from normal of the count in the ciculation of immature B cells (CD19+/ CD21low). Immature B cells (IgM+) are still in final stages of development within the bone marrow. 免疫系统的异常;血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030388	Decreased class-switched memory B cell count	类别转换记忆 B 细胞计数降低	A reduction from the normal count of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+). Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B-cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.	
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030389	Abnormality of thromboxane metabolism	血栓烷代谢异常	An anomaly of the metabolism of thromboxane (CHEBI:26995). Thromboxanes are derived from prostaglandin precursors in platelets, and stimulate aggregation of platelets and constriction of blood vessels.	
代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030390	Abnormality of leukotriene metabolism	白三烯代谢异常	An anomaly of the metabolism of leukotriene (CHEBI:25029).	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030391	Spoken Word Recognition Deficit	口语词汇识别能力降低	Reduced ability of lexical discrimination, which refers to the process of distinguishing a stimulus word from other phonologically similar words. Lexical discrimination can be defined as the process of correctly identifying words in the mental lexicon to match the phonological input of a stimulus.	
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0030392	Choroid plexus carcinoma	脉络丛癌	Intraventricular papillary neoplasm derived from choroid plexus epithelium. Plexus tumors are most common in the lateral and fourth ventricles; while 80% of lateral ventricle tumors present in children, fourth ventricle tumors are evenly distributed in all age groups. Clinically, choroid plexus tumors tend to cause hydrocephalus and increased intracranial pressure. Histologically, choroid plexus papillomas correspond to WHO grade I, choroid plexus carcinomas to WHO grade III.	
肿瘤;耳朵的异常	HP:0030393	Endolymphatic sac tumor	内淋巴囊肿瘤	A low-grade papillary epithelial neoplasm (adenocarcinoma) with a slow growth pattern. The endolymphatic duct emerges from the posterior wall of the saccule (of the inner ear) and ends in a blind pouch, the endolymphatic sac. Endolymphatic sac tumors (ELSTs) are known under different names in the literature (Heffner tumor, aggressive papillary middle ear tumor, and low-grade adenocarcinoma of endolymphatic sac origin).	
肿瘤;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030394	Fallopian tube carcinoma	输卵管癌	Carcinoma that originates in the Fallopian tube. It may be located in the wall or within the lumen as a growth attached to the wall by a stalk.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030396	Abnormal platelet granule secretion	血小板颗粒分泌异常	Platelets are replete with secretory granules, which are critical to normal platelet function. Among the three types of platelet secretory granules - alpha-granules, dense granules, and lysosomes - the alpha-granule is the most abundant. Granule contents must be released from their intracellular repository in order to achieve their physiologic function, and this term refers to a functional defect in granule secretion.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030397	Abnormal platelet dense granule secretion	血小板致密颗粒分泌异常	Abnormal release of dense granules from platelets.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030398	Abnormal platelet ATP dense granule secretion	血小板 ATP 致密颗粒分泌异常	Abnormal secretion of the platelet dense-granule content adenosine triphosphate (ATP).	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030399	Abnormal platelet alpha granule secretion	血小板α颗粒分泌异常	Abnormal release of alpha granule contents from platelets.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030400	Abnormal platelet lysosome secretion	血小板溶酶体分泌异常	Abnormal release of lysosome contents from platelets.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030401	Abnormal platelet dense granule ATP/ADP ratio	血小板异常致密颗粒 ATP/ADP 比率	Deviation from normal of the ratio of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) to adenosine diphosphate (ADP) within platelets.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030402	Abnormal platelet aggregation	血小板聚集异常	An abnormality in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030403	Spontaneous platelet aggregation	自发性血小板聚集	Clumping together of platelets in the blood in a platelet aggregation test without addition of agents normally used to induce aggregation.

肿瘤;消化系统的异常	HP:0030406	Primary peritoneal carcinoma	原发性腹膜癌	A type of cancer that originates in the peritoneam. It is to be distinguished from metastatic cancer of the peritoneum. Peritoneal cancer can occur anywhere in the abdominal space, and affects the surface of organs contained inside the peritoneum.

神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0030408	Pineoblastoma	松果体母细胞瘤	Pineoblastoma is a rare primitive neuroectodermal tumour (PNET) arising in the pineal gland. Pineoblastomas are classified as a WHO grade IV tumour and comprise one-fourth to one-half of pineal parenchymal tumours. Pineoblastoma is a highly cellular tumor originating in the pineal gland and containing small, poorly differentiated cells.

肿瘤;内分泌系统的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0030447	Merkel cell skin cancer	默克尔细胞皮肤癌	A malignant cutaneous tumor of the elderly that is characterized by an aggressive course with regional nodal involvement, distant metastases and a high rate of recurrence. 肌肉组织的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0030664	Beevor's sign	比佛氏征	Weakness of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, which is ascertained clinically as follows. When a patient sits up or raises the head from a recumbent position, the umbilicus is displaced toward the head. This is the result of paralysis of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, so that the upper fibres predominate pulling upwards the umbilicus.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030665	Rubral tremor	红核颤抖症	Rubral tremor is characterized by a slow coarse tremor at rest that is exacerbated by postural adjustments and by guided voluntary movements.	
眼睛的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0030666	Retinal neovascularization	视网膜新生血管形成	In wound repair, neovascularization (NV) involves the sprouting of new vessels from pre-existent vessels to repair or replace damaged vessels. In the retina, NV is a response to ischemia. The NV adheres to the inner surface of the retina and outer surface of the vitreous. NV are deficient in tight junctions and hence leak plasma into surrounding tissue including the vitreous. Plasma causes the vitreous gel to degenerate, contract, and eventually collapse which pulls on the retina. Since retinal NV is adherent to both retina and vitreous, as the vitreous contracts the NV may be sheared resulting in vitreous hemorrhage or the NV may remain intact and pull the retina with the vitreous resulting in retinal elevation referred to as traction retinal detachment.	
眼睛的异常;心血管系统的异常	HP:0030667	Peripheral retinal neovascularization	周边视网膜新生血管形成	A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the periphery of the retina.	
头或颈部的异常	HP:0030668	Periorbital dermoid cyst	眶周皮样囊肿	A cyst that is localized in the region of the orbit and exhibits an epithelial lining with a keratin-filled lumen. Hair follicles are one of the adnexal structures that are commonly found in walls of dermoid cysts.	
头或颈部的异常	HP:0030669	Abnormal morphology of the ocular adnexa	眼附属器形态异常	An anomaly of the adjacent structures (i.e., adnexa) of the eye, defined as the lacrimal apparatus, the extraocular muscles and the eyelids, eyelashes, eyebrows and the conjunctiva.	
头或颈部的异常	HP:0030670	Hamartoma of the orbital region	眶区错构瘤	A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the orbital region.	
头或颈部的异常	HP:0030671	Abnormality of the common tendinous ring	总腱环异常	Any anomaly of the ring of fibrous tissue that surrounds the optic nerve at its entrance at the apex of the orbit. The common tendinous ring, also know as the annulus of Zinn or annular tendon, is the origin for five of the seven extraocular muscles.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030725	Neurenteric cyst	神经管原肠囊肿	The neurenteric cyst is a rare lesion composed of heterotopic endodermal tissue. During the third week of human embryogenesis, the neurenteric canal unites the yolk sac and the amniotic cavity as it traverses the primitive notochordal plate. Persistence of the normally transient neurenteric canal prevents appropriate separation of endoderm and notochord. This results in a variable degree of communication between neural and enteric epithelium.

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0030728	Meromelia	残肢畸形	Partial absence of a free limb (excluding girdle). It can refer to the proximal, middle or distal segment of the upper or lower limb. The deficiency may be transverse or longitudinal. Thus, meromelia is a lack of a part, but not all, of one or more limbs with the presence of a hand or foot.

肿瘤	HP:0030731	Carcinoma	癌	A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells. 心血管系统的异常	HP:0030732	Dysplastic tricuspid valve	三尖瓣发育不良	A congenital malformation of the tricuspid valve characterized by leaflet deformation.	
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030733	Vesicoallantoic abdominal wall defect	膀胱尿囊腹壁缺损	An abdominal wall defected related to a developmental anomaly of the allantois, which is an embryonic structure that develops as a diverticulum off the yolk sac at about 16 days post fertilization. During further development, the allantois becomes incorporated into the body of the embryo, connecting the ventral aspect of the urogenital sinus (which will develop into the upper pole of the urinary bladder) to the external portion of the umbilicus. Upon further development, the lumen of the allantois becomes obliterated and forms a thick fibrous cord called the urachus, which connects the apex of the bladder to the umbilicus. In adults, the urachus is known as the median umbilical ligament. Failure of the allantoic cavity to obliterate can result of one of four conditions: 1) congenital patent urachus (a completely open connection between bladder and umbilicus); 2) vesicourachal diverticulum (a diverticulum off the bladder but not communicating with the umbilicus); umbilical cyst and sinus (not communicating with the bladder); and 4) alternating urachal sinus. An abdominal wall defect can be associated with a urachal cyst.	
泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030735	Ureterovesical junction obstruction	膀胱输尿管交界处梗阻	Blockage at the level of the bladder and the ureter caused by stenosis of the ureteral valves or failure of a narrow juxtavesical ureteral segment to dilate due to segmented fibrosis or localized absence of muscle.

The dot appears as a black speck that ranges in size from the dot made by a sharp pencil point to the size of a poppy seed. It is usually well defined, although occasionally there may be irregular, fine lines radiating outward from the dot.

泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030754	Allantoic cyst	尿囊囊肿	A swelling formed at the base of umbilicus associated with a patent urachus which results from an allantoic remnant. The urachus is a fibrous remnant of the allantois which communicates from the apex of the urinary bladder to the umbilicus. Failed obliteration of the urachus can lead to various abnormalities: urachal cyst, urachal diverticulum, sinus or patent urachus - the most common type. Allantoic cysts in infants with patent urachus can be formed due to the drainage of urine into the umbilical cord, or in uncommon situations, after leakage of hypo-osmotic urine into the Wharton's jelly.

泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0030762	Mesangiolysis	系膜溶解	Dissolution or attenuation of mesangial matrix and degeneration of mesangial cells. In essence, mesangiolysis is an injurious process which affects the glomerular mesangium without causing obvious damage to the capillary basement membranes. The matrix swells, loosens, and eventually dissolves; the mesangial cells may show only edema and vacuolization, or may undergo severe degeneration and necrosis.

体壁的异常	HP:0030764	Ochronosis	褐黄病	Brown or blue-gray discoloration of the skin tha can present on the axillary and inguinal areas, face, palms or soles. In addition, blue-black discoloration can be apparent on skin overlying cartilage in which the pigment is deposited, such as the ears. This is a characteristic manifestation of alkaptonuria, which is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of homogentisic acid oxidase that results in accumulation of homogentisic acid in collagenous structures. The sclerae are also typically involved.

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030774	Mitochondrial swelling	线粒体肿胀	The mitochondrial matrix refers to the substance occupying the space enclosed by the inner membrane of a mitochondrion, which contains enzymes, DNA, granules, and inclusions of protein crystals, glycogen, and lipid. Mitochondrial swelling refers to an increase in size of the mitochondrial matrix. This phenomenon is thought to be related to a permeabilized inner membrane that originates a large swelling in the mitochondrial matrix. Mitochondrial swelling may distend the outer membrane until it ruptures.

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0030777	Modic type II vertebral endplate changes	Modic II 型椎体终板改变	An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a high signal on T1-weighted sequences and high- or isointense signal on T2 sequences. 骨骼系统的异常	HP:0030778	Modic type III vertebral endplate changes	Modic III 型椎体终板改变	An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a low signal on T1 and T2-weighted sequences. 神经系统的异常	HP:0030779	Ethmocephaly	猿头畸形	Ethmocephaly is the rarest form of holoprosencephaly, which occurs due to an incomplete cleavage of the forebrain. Clinically, the disease presents with a proboscis, hypotelorism, microphthalmos and malformed ears.	
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0030780	Abnormality of the protein C anticoagulant pathway	蛋白 C 抗凝途径异常	An anomaly of the protein C anticoagulant pathway, which serves as a major system for controlling thrombosis, limiting inflammatory responses, and potentially decreasing endothelial cell apoptosis in response to inflammatory cytokines and ischemia. A natural anticoagulant system denoted the protein C pathway exerts its anticoagulant effect by regulating the activity of FVIIIa and FVa. The vitamin K-dependent protein C is the key component of the pathway. Activated protein C (APC) cleaves and inhibits coagulation cofactors FVIIIa and FVa, which result in downregulation of the activity of the coagulation system. The endothelial protein C receptor stimulates the T-TM-mediated activation of protein C on the endothelial cell surface. The two cofactors, protein S and the intact form of FV, enhance the anticoagulant activity of APC.

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030794	Abnormal C-peptide level	C-肽水平异常	An anomolous circulating concentration of the connecting (C) peptide, which links the insulin A and B chains in proinsulin, providing thereby a means to promote their efficient folding and assembly in the endoplasmic reticulum during insulin biosynthesis. After cleavage of proinsulin, C-peptide is stored with insulin in the soluble phase of the secretory granules and is subsequently released in equimolar amounts with insulin, providing a useful independent indicator of insulin secretion.

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030796	Increased C-peptide level	C-肽水平增加	An elevated concentration of C-peptide in the circulation. Since C-peptide is secreted in equimolar amounts to insulin, this feature correlates with increased insulin secretion.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030798	Abnormality of the bed nucleus of stria terminalis	终纹床核异常	The stria terminalis is a slender, compact fiber bundle that connects the amygdala (amygdaloid body) with the hypothalamus and other basal forebrain regions. The bed nucleus of the stria terminalis is a limbic forebrain structure that receives heavy projections from, among other areas, the basolateral amygdala, and projects in turn to hypothalamic and brainstem target areas that mediate many of the autonomic and behavioral responses to aversive or threatening stimuli. This term refers to an anomaly of the bed nucleus.	
头或颈部的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0030799	Scaphocephaly	舟状头	Scaphocephaly is a subtype of dolichocephaly where the anterior and posterior aspects of the cranial vault are pointed (boat-shaped). Scaphocephaly is caused by a precocious fusion of sagittal suture without other associated synostosis.	
眼睛的异常	HP:0030800	Abnormal visual accommodation	视觉调节异常	An anomaly in the process of visual accommodation, which is the process of adjustment of the eye to enable sharp vision of objects at different distances. Accommodation is mediated by contraction of the ciliary muscles, which alter the convexity of the lens and, consequently, its refractive power.

眼睛的异常	HP:0030824	Mizuo phenomenon	水尾现象	Change in the color of the fundus from red in the dark-adapted state to golden immediately or shortly after the onset of the light. The color of the fundus reflex in the light adapted state has also been described as golden-yellow, gray-white, and yellow-white. This reflex can appear either homogeneous or in streaks in the fundus. The retinal vessels appear to be protruding in contrast to the radiant background. Dark adaptation leads to disappearance of the unusual fundus coloration [Digital Journal of Ophthalmology 2008; Volume 14, Number 14].

代谢/内稳态异常	HP:0030843	Cardiac amyloidosis	心脏淀粉样变性	Extracellular deposition in cardiac tissue of a proteinaceous material that, when stained with Congo red, demonstrates apple-green birefringence under polarized light and that has a distinct color when stained with sulfated Alcian blue. Viewed with electron microscopy, the amyloid deposits are seen to be composed of a beta-sheet fibrillar material. These nonbranching fibrils have a diameter of 7.5 to 10 nm and are the result of protein misfolding.

心血管系统的异常	HP:0030847	Abnormal jugular venous pressure	颈静脉压异常	An anomaly of the jugular venous pressure. The internal jugular veins, being continuous with the superior vena cava, provide a visible measure of the degree to which the systemic venous reservoir is filled. The vertical height above the right atrium to which they are distended and above which they are in a collapsed state provides an imperfect reflection of the right atrial pressure.	
心血管系统的异常	HP:0030848	Elevated jugular venous pressure	颈静脉压升高	Increased jugular venous pressure.	
心血管系统的异常	HP:0030849	Hepatojugular reflux	肝颈静脉返流/回流	The examiner applies firm but persistent pressure over the liver for 10 seconds while observing the mean jugular venous pressure. Normally there is either no rise or only a transient (i.e., 2 to 3 sec) rise in mean jugular venous pressure. A sustained increase in the mean venous pressure until abdominal compression is released is abnormal and indicates impaired right heart function. This abnormal response is called hepatojugular reflux.

四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0030883	Femoroacetabular Impingement	股骨髋臼撞击症	Femoroacetabular impingement (FAI) results from one or more bony abnormalities that lead to abnormal contact between the acetabulum and the femoral head or neck. The femoral abnormality is proposed to cause compression and shear stresses in the region between the labrum and cartilage, anterosuperiorly. These stresses cause a separation between the labrum and cartilage as the labrum is pushed outwards and the cartilage is pushed centrally. This eventually leads to articular degeneration and eventually global hip osteoarthritis.

神经系统的异常	HP:0030902	Palmomental reflex	掌颌反射	A type of primitive reflex characterized by an involuntary contraction of the mentalis muscle of the chin caused by stimulation of the thenar eminence of the palm.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030903	Grasp reflex	抓握反射/握持反射	A type of primitive reflex that can be elicated when the hand of the examiner is gently inserted into the palm of the patient's hand. The palmar surface is stroked or simply touched. The flexor surfaces of the fingers may be stimulated also by the examiner's fingers. The stimulus should be in a distal direction. With a positive response, the patient grasps the examiner's hand with variable strength and continues to grasp as the examiner's hand is moved. Ability to release the grip voluntarily depends on the activity of the reflex; some patients can do so readily, while others can even be lifted off the bed, since the grasp has such power [NCBI Books:NBK395].	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030904	Glabellar reflex	眉心反射	A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by repetitive tapping on the forehead. Normal subjects usually blink in response to the first several taps, but if blinking persists, the response is abnormal and considered to be a sign of frontal release. Persistent blinking is also known as Myerson's sign.	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030905	Snout reflex	撅嘴反射	A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by tapping the upper lip lightly. The contraction of the muscles causes the mouth to resemble a snout [NCBI Books:NBK395].	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030906	Suck reflex	吸吮反射	A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched [NCBI Books:NBK395].	
神经系统的异常	HP:0030907	Thunderclap headache	霹雳性头痛	Severe head pain with sudden onset, reaching its maximum intensity in less than one minute and lasting from one hour to ten days.

Anti-LKM-1 antibodies are considered to be a diagnostic marker of autoimmune hepatitis type 2 (AIH2).	
免疫系统的异常	HP:0030909	Anti-liver cytosolic antigen type 1 antibody positivity	抗肝细胞胞浆抗原1型抗体阳性	The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a 60-kd peptide contained in the liver cytosolic fraction.

内分泌系统的异常	HP:0100000	Early onset of sexual maturation	早发性成熟	An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious.	青春期开始得早，在这种情况下，早发不是指早熟。
肿瘤	HP:0100001	Malignant mesothelioma	恶性间皮瘤	Malignant mesothelioma is a form of cancer that originates from the cells of the mesothelium, a thin tissue layer surrounding the body's internal organs. Malignant mesothelioma is almost exclusively caused by asbestos exposure, pleural mesothelioma being the most common form, affecting the lining of the lungs called the pleura. Other forms such as perioneal-, percardial- or testicular- mesothelioma are much rarer.	恶性间皮瘤起源于间皮细胞，即一层包绕人体内脏的薄层组织。恶性间皮瘤的发生几乎都与石棉的暴露接触有关，胸膜间皮瘤是最常见的形式，发生于胸膜组织。其他还有发生于腹膜、心包以及睾丸的间皮瘤，后者更为少见。
肿瘤;呼吸系统异常	HP:0100002	Pleural mesothelioma	胸膜间皮瘤	A `Malignant mesothelioma` (HP:0100001) originating from cells of the pleura (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the lungs). Pleural mesothelioma is the most common form of mesothelioma.	起源于胸膜细胞的恶性间皮瘤（胸膜是衬于肺外围的薄层间皮）。胸膜间皮瘤是间皮瘤的最常见形式。
肿瘤;消化系统的异常	HP:0100003	Peritoneal mesothelioma	腹膜间皮瘤	A `Malignant mesothelioma` (HP:0100001) originating from cells of the peritoneum (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the abdomen). Peritoneal mesothelioma is the second most common form of mesothelioma after pleural mesothelioma.	一种起源于腹膜细胞（腹部的薄层间皮）的恶性间皮瘤。是仅次于胸膜间皮瘤的第二常见的间皮瘤形式。
肿瘤;心血管系统的异常	HP:0100004	Pericardial mesothelioma	心包间皮瘤	A `Malignant mesothelioma` (HP:0100001) originating from cells of the pericardium (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the heart).	源于心包细胞（间皮薄层衬的心脏）的“恶性间皮瘤”（HP:0100001）。
肿瘤;泌尿生殖系统的异常	HP:0100005	Testicular mesothelioma	睾丸间皮瘤	A `Malignant mesothelioma` (HP:0100001) of the `testis` (FMA:7210).	睾丸形成恶性间皮瘤。
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100006	Neoplasm of the central nervous system	中枢神经系统的肿瘤	A `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) of the `central nervous system` (FMA:55675).	在`中枢神经system`的（FMA:55675）:一个`neoplasm`（218的mpath）。一种中枢神经系统的肿瘤
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100007	Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system	外周神经系统的肿瘤	A benign or malignant `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) (tumour) of the `peripheral nervous system` (FMA:9903).	在'周围神经system`的（肿瘤）（FMA:9903）:一个良性或恶性`neoplasm`（218的mpath）。外周神经系统良性或恶性的肿瘤
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100008	Schwannoma	神经鞘瘤	A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.	由雪旺细胞形成的良性神经鞘瘤。
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100009	Intracranial meningioma	颅内脑膜瘤		
神经系统的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100010	Spinal meningioma	脊膜瘤		
神经系统的异常;眼睛的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100011	Scleral schwannoma	巩膜神经鞘瘤	schwannoma on the Scleral	巩膜上发生的神经鞘瘤
眼睛的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100012	Neoplasm of the eye	眼肿瘤	The presence of a `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) of the eye.	眼睛的一个新生物（218的mpath）的存在。
乳房的异常;肿瘤	HP:0100013	Neoplasm of the breast	乳腺肿瘤	A `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) of the `breast` (FMA:9601).	在`breast`的（FMA:9601）:一个`neoplasm`（218的mpath）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0100014	Epiretinal membrane	视网膜前膜	An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy.	视网膜前膜是一种薄片状的纤维组织，可以发生的视网膜黄斑部表面，并引起视力下降。视网膜前膜可发生于黄斑区小范围内。前膜有时也被称为黄斑皱褶，黄斑纤维化，表面起皱性视网膜病或黄斑病玻璃纸。
耳朵的异常	HP:0100015	Stahl ear	猿耳畸形施塔尔耳	The presence of a `supernumerary` (PATO:0002002), i.e. third, `crus of the helix (FMA:61024) in the `helix` (FMA:60992), arising at or above the normal bifurcation of the antihelix.	“额外”(PATO:0002002)耳轮脚(FMA:61024的存在，即第三个耳轮脚，位于对耳轮正常分岔处或其之上。
消化系统的异常	HP:0100016	Abnormality of the mesentery	肠系膜异常	Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).	附着于腹壁及其包裹的内脏之间的膜状组织（腹膜，间皮）的折叠。包括小肠肠系膜、连接横结肠和背侧腹壁的结肠系膜、以及结肠乙状弯曲部分折叠而成的乙状结肠系膜。相同胚系起源的细胞也环绕身体的其他器官，如肺（胸膜）或心脏（心包膜）。
眼睛的异常	HP:0100017	Capsular cataract	囊膜型白内障	A cataract that affects the `capsule of the lens` (FMA:58881).	白内障的一种，主要影响晶状体的（FMA:58881）囊膜。
眼睛的异常	HP:0100018	Nuclear cataract	核性白内障	A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the `lens nucleus` (FMA:58971). That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown.	核性白内障是指晶状体核的混浊。也就是说，核性白内障发生于晶状体的中心。细胞核变暗，由清晰到黄色，有时褐改变。
眼睛的异常	HP:0100019	Cortical cataract	皮质性白内障	A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the `lens cortex` (FMA:58970). It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance.	一种类型的白内障，主要影响皮质（FMA:58970）。通常形成独特的楔形或辐条的外观。
眼睛的异常	HP:0100020	Posterior capsular cataract	后囊型白内障	A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly.	是在晶状体后囊部发生的一种白内障。这种类型往往发展得更快。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100021	Cerebral palsy	脑瘫	Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behaviour, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.	脑瘫是指一组持久的运动和姿势发育障碍,造成活动受限,被认为是胎儿或婴儿的大脑发育尚未成熟阶段遭受非进行性脑损伤所致。脑瘫的运动障碍常伴有感觉、知觉、认知、交流和行为障碍，癫痫及继发性骨骼肌系统的问题。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100022	Abnormality of movement	运动异常	An abnormality of movement with a neurological basis characterized by changes in coordination and speed of voluntary movements.	神经支配异常为原因的运动异常，以随意运动的协调和速度的改变为特征。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100023	Recurrent hand flapping	反复用手拍打	A type of stereotypic behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands up and down.	一种刻板的行为表现为受累个体重复双手不停的上和下。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100024	Conspicuously happy disposition	显着快乐的性格	An unusually happy aspect over time which can also may be observed during inappropriate situations that should be causing for example distress, fear or anger.	异常快乐的面貌，久而久之，甚至在不恰当的情况下（例如悲痛，恐惧或愤怒）仍然可以观察到异常快乐的表情。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100025	Overfriendliness	过度友善	A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate people-orientation and friendliness towards others on an inadequate level which might go as far as being dangerous considering for example young children following strangers without restriction.	过度友善是表现为不恰当的、不合时宜的对他人过度友善，这有可能导致危险的行为，如幼儿可能会不受任何约束的与陌生人离开
心血管系统的异常	HP:0100026	Arteriovenous malformation	动静脉畸形	An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries.	血管结构异常造成动脉血不经毛细血管直接进入静脉。
免疫系统的异常;消化系统的异常	HP:0100027	Recurrent pancreatitis	复发性胰腺炎	A `recurrent` (PATO:0000427) form of `pancreatitis` (HP:0001733).	胰腺炎的复发形式。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0100028	Ectopic thyroid	异位甲状腺	`Mislocalised` (PATO:0000628) `thyroid gland` (FMA:9603).	甲状腺位置异常
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0100029	Lingual thyroid	舌部甲状腺	An aberrant thyroid gland or `Ectopic thyroid` (HP:0100028) located at the base of the tongue (FMA:54645), just posterior to the foramen cecum as a result of a failure of the thyroid to descend.	异位的甲状腺(HP:0100028)，位于舌根，舌盲孔的后面，由于甲状腺未能下降导致。
内分泌系统的异常	HP:0100030	Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue	异位甲状腺组织	Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.	异位甲状腺组织可来自于沿甲状舌管路径的任何地方的甲状舌管残余
肿瘤;内分泌系统的异常	HP:0100031	Neoplasm of the thyroid gland	甲状腺肿瘤	The presence of a `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) of the `thyroid gland` (FMA:9603).	甲状腺肿瘤
神经系统的异常	HP:0100033	Tics	抽动症	A tic is a sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic, stereotyped motor movement or vocalization involving discrete muscle groups.	抽搐是突然的，重复的，非节律性，刻板的电机运动或发声涉及广泛的肌肉群。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100034	Motor tics	运动抽动	Movement-based tics affecting discrete muscle groups.	影响个别肌群的运动抽动
神经系统的异常	HP:0100035	Phonic tics	声音抽搐	Involuntary sounds produced by moving air through the nose, mouth, or throat. The vocal cords are not involved in all tics that produce sound.	产经鼻腔，口腔或咽喉空气流动时的非自主的声音。声带不参与的发声抽动。
骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100036	Pseudo-fractures	假性骨折	A band of bone material of decreased density forming alongside the surface of the cortical bone with thickening of the periosteum. Callus formation in the affected area is common and gives the appearance of a false fracture.	的带密度降低形成沿着皮质骨与骨膜增厚的表面的骨材料制成。愈伤组织形成在受影响的区域是常见的，并给出了假骨折的外观。
头或颈部的异常;体壁的异常	HP:0100037	Abnormality of the scalp hair	头皮毛发异常	An abnormality of the `hair of head` (FMA:54241).	头皮的毛发异常

四肢异常;呼吸系统异常	HP:0100241	Ectopic respiratory mucosa	呼吸道黏膜异位	Ectopic respiratory epithelium presenting as a superficial lesion in the skin usually localised unilateral in the skin of the forearm and associated with ipsilateral hand malformations.	异位呼吸道上皮呈现为浅病变皮肤通常局部单方面在前臂的皮肤和同侧的手畸形。
肿瘤	HP:0100242	Sarcoma	肉瘤	The presence of a `sarcoma` (MPATH:551).	一个`sarcoma`的存在（的mpath:551）。
肿瘤	HP:0100243	Leiomyosarcoma	平滑肌肉瘤	A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.	平滑肌结缔组织肿瘤，是一种少见的发生于平滑肌的恶性肿瘤，当这种肿瘤为良性时则称为平滑肌瘤。
肿瘤	HP:0100244	Fibrosarcoma	纤维肉瘤	A fibroblastic sarcoma is a malignant tumor derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells.	纤维母细胞肉瘤是起源于纤维结缔组织增生的恶性肿瘤，以未成熟或未分化的梭形细胞增生的成纤维细胞为特征。
肿瘤;消化系统的异常	HP:0100245	Desmoid tumors	硬性纤维瘤	Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.	良性的，生长缓慢的肿瘤，没有任何转移的可能。尽管具有良性属性，它们能损害周围结构从而引起器官功能障碍。组织学上，它们与低度恶性纤维肉瘤类似，但它们仅限于原位侵袭且易于复发，即使是完全切除后。施行手术前即有复发的趋势，且这些肿瘤最常见定位于腹内肠道平滑肌细胞。
肿瘤;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100246	Osteoma	骨瘤	Osteomas are bony growths found most commonly on the skull and mandible; however, they may occur in any bone of the body. Osteomas do not usually cause clinical problems and do not become malignant.	骨瘤是发现最常见的头骨和下颌骨骨生长;然而，它们可能发生在身体的任何骨。骨瘤通常不会引起临床问题，不要变成恶性的。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0100247	Recurrent singultus	反复性嗝逆	A contraction of the diaphragm that repeats several times per minute. In humans, the abrupt rush of air into the lungs causes the epiglottis to close, creating a hic sound. Also known as synchronous diaphragmatic flutter (SDF), or singultus, from the Latin singult, the act of catching one's breath while sobbing. The hiccup is an involuntary action involving a reflex arc.	每分钟重复几次的横膈膜挛缩。在人类，空气突然冲入肺中引起会厌关闭，发出打嗝的声音。也称为同步膈膜颤振，或呃逆，来自拉丁语singult（抽泣时喘气的行为）。打嗝是反射弧参与的不自主动作。
神经系统的异常	HP:0100248	Hemiballismus	偏侧投掷	Hemiballismus is a rare movement disorder that is caused primarily by damage to various areas in the `basal ganglia` (FMA:84013). Hemiballismus is usually characterized by involuntary flinging motions of the extremities. The movements are often violent and have wide amplitudes of motion. They are continuous and random and can involve proximal and/or distal muscles on one side of the body, while some cases even include the facial muscles. The more a patient is active, the more the movements increase. With relaxation comes a decrease in movements.	偏身投掷是主一种基底节不同区域损害（FMA:84013）造成的罕见的运动障碍。 偏身投掷的特点通常是肢体不自主的投掷样运动。这些运动往往是大幅度的、剧烈的。它们可以是连续的，随机的，累及一侧身体的近端和/或远端，某些情况下甚至累及面部肌肉。患者越是活动，运动越是明显；随着放松，运动减弱。
肌肉组织的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100249	Calcification of muscles	肌肉钙化	Deposition of calcium salts in muscle tissue.	钙盐肌肉组织中沉积。
神经系统的异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100250	Meningeal calcification	脑膜钙化	`Calcium deposition` (MPATH:36) affecting the `Meninges` (FMA:231572).	影响脑膜（FMA:231572）的钙沉积(MPATH:36)。

骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100254	Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones	长骨骨髓腔狭窄

神经系统的异常	HP:0100256	Senile plaques	老年斑	Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.	老年斑是大脑灰质内的细胞外类淀粉样蛋白沉积。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100257	Ectrodactyly	缺趾/指畸形	A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.	一个条件，其中的手和/或脚（数字和元腕骨和-tarsals）中间部分丢失给人一种裂的外观。的严重程度是非常可变的，从略微发育不全第三趾/手指在缺席第二或第三脚趾/手指尽可能低聚糖或monodactyl手和/或脚。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100258	Preaxial polydactyly	轴前多指畸形	A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the thumb or great toe.	多趾的形式，其中额外的数字或数字是定位于拇指或大脚趾的一侧。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100259	Postaxial polydactyly	轴后多指畸形	A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.	趾的一种形式，其中，额外的数字或数字被定位于第五手指或第五脚趾的一侧。
四肢异常;骨骼系统的异常	HP:0100260	Mesoaxial polydactyly	多指（趾）畸形	The presence of a supernumerary finger or toe (not a thumb or hallux) involving the third or fourth metacarpal/tarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.	一个额外手指或脚趾（未拇指或拇）涉及第三或第四掌骨/跗具有相关骨并指的存在。
